Wisconsin Scholarships


#Thedreamernextdoor Scholarship Program
#TheDREAMerNextDoor Scholarship Program is designed for currently matriculating DREAMers who wish to achieve the American Dream, but because of their DREAMer status, are ineligible for the Free Application for Federal Student Aid (FAFSA).
CRITERIA:
(1) Have been accepted to a 2- or 4- year institution of higher education;
(2) are currently enrolled in a 2- or 4- year institution of higher education; or
(3) are currently pursuing a professional degree; and
(4) Have a current DACA or TPS authorization, or do not otherwise qualify for DACA or TPS authorization and have undocumented status. more...

4Imprint Business Scholarship
Applicant must be enrolled full-time as an undergraduate student at the Oshkosh campus. Applicant must be admitted, or have applied for spring admission, to the College of Business. Applicant must have a minimum 3.0 cumulative GPA and must have completed at least 60 credits. This award will be split evenly between the Fall 2022 and Spring 2023 semesters. If the recipient is not enrolled in the spring semester, the second installment will be forfeited. more...

4Imprint Graphic Art Scholarship
Applicant must be a full-time undergraduate student enrolled at the Oshkosh campus. Applicant must be pursuing a BFA in design, must have a minimum 3.0 cumulative GPA, and must have at least 60 credits completed. This award will be split evenly between the Fall 2022 and Spring 2023 semesters. If the recipient is not enrolled in the spring semester, the second installment will be forfeited. more...

4Imprint Information Technology Scholarship
Applicant must be a full-time undergraduate student enrolled at the Oshkosh campus. Applicant must be majoring in computer science or information systems. Applicant must have a minimum 3.0 cumulative GPA and must have at least 60 credits completed. Applicant must have completed either IS 318 or CS 271 with a grade of C or higher at the time of application. This award will be split evenly between the Fall 2022 and Spring 2023 semesters. If the recipient is not enrolled in the spring semester, the second installment will be forfeited. more...

4Imprint, Inc. Scholarship
Scholarship for full-time undergraduate students (freshmen ineligible) attending the University of Wisconsin-Oshkosh who are enrolled in the College of Business. Applicants must have a minimum 3.0 GPA and completed 75 credit hours. Number of awards may vary. Nonrenewable. more...

50Th Anniversary Marketing Alumni Challenge Scholarship
The Marketing Department, along with the many alumni who contributed, is pleased to announce one $5000 scholarship will be awarded to Marketing majors for the 2021-2022 academic year, in honor of the CBA 50th Anniversary.
Criteria:
 MKT Major, admitted to CBA, with 6 credits of upper-level MKT coursework, beyond MKT 309, completed or in process.
 Applicants graduating in December 2021 or later are eligible to apply
 GPA 3.0 or higher
 Preference is given to applicants who are participating or have participated, in one or more Marketing experiential learning opportunity (e.g., AMA, Sales Competition, London Program, Undergraduate Research, etc.)
 Preference is given to students willing to share their marketing experiences with underclassmen by speaking in a class, student organization meeting or participating in some other event, such as academic advising sessions or the freshmen meet & greet. (1-3 hours expected) more...

A. R. Graham Scholarship
This scholarship was established in memory of former Madison College board member, Alexander R. Graham and his strong belief in continuing education. Donor: Emily Kiekhofer more...

freshman, sophomore, junior or senior to be enrolled full time with a major in theatre arts
above average grade point average more...

A. Vincent And Janet B. Weber Scholarship In Biology
junior or senior to be enrolled full time with a major in biology (shall include students in education with a biology major) but not include any other majors such as microbiology
minimum of 60 credits earned at UW-L including at least 12 credits completed in the biology major
at least a 3.6 GPA more...

A.T. Brown Award For History Graduate Students
This award is given to a history graduate student with demonstrated academic merit.
Students who have an up-to-date Panther Scholarship Portal General Application and the College of Letters & Science Scholarships and Awards Application will be considered, typically in spring each year between February and April. No additional or separate application is required; students should thoroughly fill out the Panther Scholarship Portal General Application and the College of Letters & Science Scholarships and Awards Application. Awards given in spring are for the following school year so students graduating that same spring or summer are not eligible. E.G. applications reviewed in Spring 2022 are for Fall 2022; students graduating in May or August 2022 are not eligible. more...

A.T. Brown Award For History Undergraduates
This award is given to history majors with high academic achievement. Qualified candidates will meet the following criteria:
A student with sophomore, junior or senior standing and a declared major in History with at least twelve credits in history completed
Minimum cumulative GPA of 3.25
Full-time enrollment
Students who have an up-to-date Panther Scholarship Portal General Application and the College of Letters & Science Scholarships and Awards Application will be considered, typically in spring each year between February and April. No additional or separate application is required; students should thoroughly fill out the Panther Scholarship Portal General Application and the College of Letters & Science Scholarships and Awards Application. Awards given in spring are for the following school year so students graduating that same spring or summer are not eligible. E.G. applications reviewed in Spring 2022 are for Fall 2022; students graduating in May or August 2022 are not eligible. more...

A.W. Asmuth Scholarship
Scholarship for undergraduate students attending Cardinal Stritch University in Wisconsin. Due date, number of awards and award amount varies. more...

Aaron Cizewski-Robinson Scholarship
This scholarship has been funded by Cheryl Robinson and Leonard Cizewski, and friends of Aaron Cizewski-Robinson. Aaron died on July 2004, at the age of 19. He was an East High School graduate, attended MATC and planned to take more classes there. The intent with this scholarship is to help graduates of Madison East High School who plan to continue their education at MATC, but for whom this would be a financial hardship. Donor/Thank You Letter: Cheryl Robinson and Leonard Cizewski more...

Aauw La Crosse Branch Scholarship For Continuing Students At Uwl
1) Must have earned 30 or more credits and plan to enroll full-time at UWL for the next academic year
2) Must have a cumulative GPA of at least 3.0 on a 4.0 scale
3) Must submit an essay to include: (A) an explanation of educational goals, education-related activities, and involvement in the community; (B) a statement that tells why or how receiving this scholarship will support educational opportunity; and © an explanation of financial need or circumstances affecting educational progress.
4) Must provide the name of a reference who can be contacted for more information. The person may be a faculty advisor, teacher, or university/college staff member who addresses the applicant’s potential to succeed in the declared major and/or intended career.
5) Must include a current resume. more...

Abel/St. Andrew's Performing Arts Scholarship
This scholarship was established through a donation by Joan Abel to St. Andrew’s Lutheran Church. Applicant must be a full-time undergraduate enrolled at the Oshkosh campus. Applicant must be majoring in music (instrumental performance, piano performance, or vocal performance) or theatre (acting emphasis). Applicant must have at least sophomore standing, must have a minimum 2.5 cumulative GPA, and must have financial need based on the FAFSA. This award will be split evenly between the Fall 2023 and Spring 2024 semesters. If the recipient is not enrolled in the spring semester, the second installment will be forfeited. more...

Academic Achievement Award (Aaa) Scholarship
Scholarship for incoming freshmen students accepted at Marian College of Fond du Lac in Wisconsin. Applicants must have a minimum 3.6 GPA, rank in the top 15% of their graduating class, and have an ACT score of 26 or better. Due date and number of awards varies. Renewable. more...

Academic Honors Scholarship - Carthage College
The Academic Honors Scholarship is open to entering freshman students at Carthage College. You must have a minimum 28 ACT/1240 SAT score and a minimum 3.0 GPA to be eligible for this renewable award. more...

Academic Merit Scholarship-Mbbc
The Academic Merit Scholarship is available to new students at Maranatha Baptist Bible College. You must demonstrate exceptional academic achievement, have a minimum GPA of 3.0, and have a minimum 25 ACT or 1200 SAT score to be considered for this renewable award. You must also be a freshman or transfer student and carry at least 12 hours of Maranatha class work each semester. more...

Accelerated Bsn Scholarship
This scholarship was established by Nardalyn Johnson ‘06 and other nursing alumni to support nursing students and to celebrate the tenth anniversary of the Accelerated Online Bachelors to Bachelor of Science in Nursing (BSN) Option. Applicant must be a full-time accelerated nursing major. This scholarship is awarded based on students’ Nursing Philosophy assignment; there is no application required. For more information, please contact the College of Nursing at conscholarships@uwosh.edu. more...

Access To Excellence Scholarship
The Access to Excellence Scholarship is open to full-time students in the College of Letters & Science with demonstrated academic excellence. Criteria for this scholarship include a minimum 3.4 cumulative GPA; sophomore, junior or senior standing; and a record of extracurricular and co-curricular engagement such as research or other learning experiences.
The donors to this scholarship wish to support students who might otherwise not have the opportunity to pursue higher education. This scholarship varies in amount from $500 to $1,500.
Students who have an up-to-date Panther Scholarship Portal General Application and the College of Letters & Science Scholarships and Awards Application will be considered, typically in spring each year between February and April. No additional or separate application is required; students should thoroughly fill out the Panther Scholarship Portal General Application and the College of Letters & Science Scholarships and Awards Application. Awards given in spring are for the following school year so students graduating that same spring or summer are not eligible. E.G. applications reviewed in Spring 2022 are for Fall 2022; students graduating in May or August 2022 are not eligible. more...

Accounting Faculty Scholarship
This scholarship was established in 2012 by Joann Noe Cross, Professor of Accounting at UW Oshkosh. No application is required for this award; accounting faculty and academic staff members each nominate a student meeting the award criteria. The award is given to a full-time undergraduate enrolled at the Oshkosh campus. Recipient must be majoring in accounting and must have demonstrated a high level of academic performance as measured by accounting GPA and a commitment to active involvement in service to the profession as exemplified by their level of participation in the Accounting Club and their communities while a student and show potential for continued exemplary service in those areas. Recipient must complete Intermediate Accounting I and II by the semester the award is disbursed. Financial need is not a consideration. Previous recipients are not eligible to receive the award again. This award will be paid out in Fall 2022. more...

Accounting Program Scholarship
Mark enjoyed being an instructor in the Madison College accounting program for 24 years. During that time, he worked with many different students who worked hard to complete their Associate Degrees and were hired into the profession pursuing meaningful careers. It is our hope that this scholarship will help new students afford their education in this discipline. more...

Recipient must have a cumulative GPA of at least 3.0

Ackerman Scholarship (College Of Education And Human Services)
This scholarship was established by the Ackerman family to alternate annually between the College of Education and Human Services and the College of Nursing. Applicant must be a full- or part-time undergraduate enrolled at the Oshkosh campus. Applicant must have met Gateway I requirements and must be admitted, or have applied for fall admission, to the Teacher Education Program. Applicant must have a minimum 3.0 cumulative GPA. Preference will be given to students who are pursuing a major in upper elementary education. This award will be paid out in Fall 2021. more...

Ackerman Scholarship (College Of Nursing)
This scholarship was established by the Ackerman Family to alternate annually between the College of Education and Human Services and the College of Nursing. Applicant must be enrolled full- or part-time as an undergraduate at the Oshkosh campus. Applicant must be admitted, or have applied for spring admission, to the College of Nursing. Applicant must have a cumulative GPA of 3.0 or higher. This award will be paid out in Fall 2022. more...

Activision Blizzard Call Of Duty Endowment Scholarship
According to statistics from the U.S. Bureau of Labor Statistics, more that 500,000 unemployed veterans between the ages of 18 and 64 currently live in the United States. And amid the greatest economic uncertainty since the 1930s, today’s veterans by some accounts endure a jobless rate that is nearly twice the national average. To help combat these alarming trends, Activision Blizzard, Inc., a global video game publisher, established to Call of Duty Endowment (CODE). This non-profit public benefit corporation will focus its resources on assisting organizations that provide job placement and training to veterans, as well as engaging the media and public forums to raise awareness about the issue. Part of the endowment funds will be used to provide scholarships to veterans who are looking for a career in the video game industry Reqirements: The requirements of the scholarship are: must allow personal info to be used to promote CODE on their web site one conference call with CODE board per semester students will provide progress reports throughout the semester and one within 3 months of graduation participate in an Activision Blizzard mentoring program students must be veterans of the military having served in active duty, the reserves, or national guard.
Donor/Thank You Letter: Aaron Rossi more...

Acz Scholarship Endowment Fund
• Must be an incoming freshman at UWL enrolled full-time
• Must be a high school graduate from the School District of La Crosse
• Must rank in the top 10% of high school graduating class
• Financial need must be considered – FASFA on file
• Must demonstrate participation in extra-curricular activities and community service/volunteerism
• Must demonstrate strong interpersonal skills and character
• This scholarship is renewable for three additional years if a GPA of 3.25 is maintained and application is submitted for renewal more...

Adela Pfeiffer Iversen Memorial Scholarship
This scholarship was established in 1983 in memory of Adela Pfeiffer Iversen by her son, Lothar. Applicant must be a female finance or accounting major enrolled at the Oshkosh campus. Applicant must have at least junior standing and must have a minimum 2.5 cumulative GPA. Applicant must be in good standing and be admitted, or have applied for spring admission, to the College of Business. This award will be paid out in Fall 2021. more...

Adela Pfieffer Iversen Scholarship
Scholarship for female seniors attending the University of Wisconsin-Oshkosh who are majoring in Accounting or Finance. Applicants must have a minimum 2.5 GPA. Number of awards may vary. Nonrenewable. more...

Advance College Experience (Ace) Scholarship
Scholarship for undergraduate students attending Ripon College in Wisconsin full-time. This award recognizes a students participation and achievement in two or more years of Ripon Colleges summer program for young people from grade 4-12. The award requires acceptance to the College followed by a review of the candidates academic credentials, community service and references. Number of awards and award amount varies. Renewable; must remain full-time and have satisfactory progress. more...

Ahmad Family Scholarship
The Ahmad Family Scholarship was established by history alumna Diana Ahmad, currently Curators’ Distinguished Teaching Professor, specializing in the history of the American West, at Missouri University of Science & Technology. Dr. Ahmad is a Milwaukee native and earned her bachelor’s and master’s degrees at UWM. Eligible candidates will meet the following criteria:
Declared History major
Demonstrated academic achievement with a minimum 3.0 cumulative GPA

Full-time student
Junior or Senior standing
Preference will be given to a student who started at UWM as a freshman (not as a transfer student)
Students who have an up-to-date Panther Scholarship Portal General Application and the College of Letters & Science Scholarships and Awards Application will be considered, typically in spring each year between February and April. No additional or separate application is required; students should thoroughly fill out the Panther Scholarship Portal General Application and the College of Letters & Science Scholarships and Awards Application. Awards given in spring are for the following school year so students graduating that same spring or summer are not eligible. E.G. applications reviewed in Spring 2022 are for Fall 2022; students graduating in May or August 2022 are not eligible. more...

Aileen Wood Barr Memorial Nursing Scholarship
This scholarship was established by Charlene Barr Chalberg, in honor of her mother, Aileen Wood Barr. Applicant must be currently enrolled full- or part-time or accepted for admission for Summer 2023 or Fall 2023 at the Oshkosh campus. Applicant must be a registered nurse pursuing a master’s or doctoral degree in clinical nursing. Preference will be given to applicants preparing to be nurse practitioners or their equivalent. Applicant must have worked a minimum of three years as a registered nurse and must currently be working in the healthcare field. Selection is based on intellectual merit. Evidence will include academic performance during undergraduate studies and the applicant’s potential for successful completion of graduate studies. New applicants will be given preference in the selection process. However, previous recipients may apply for a second award. This award will be split evenly between the Fall 2023 and Spring 2024 semesters. If the recipient is not enrolled in the spring semester, the second installment will be forfeited. more...

Alan C. Howe Memorial Scholarship Fund In Sociology (Cls)
sophomore, junior, senior or graduate student with preference given to “non-traditional” student to be enrolled full time with a major in sociology
at least a 3.0 gpa
financial need may be considered but only as a “tie-breaker”
preference will be given to potential recipients who have a demonstrated interest in family/alcohol rehabilitation or, in the alternative, whose career plans focus on working in the area of human services more...

Alan Larson Memorial Scholarship
Alan Larson passed away October 31, 2017, leaving behind his wife, Sally, 3 sons (2 attended Madison College), and 7 grandchildren. This scholarship is an opportunity for Alan’s family to honor him in the field that meant so much to him. His career revolved around computer technology. He was instrumental in formulating Dane County’s computer system under the County’s first County Executive George Reinke, working for Dane County for 20 years. He then spent the next 18 years as the Director of Information Technology for MATC. He especially enjoyed being involved in the student atmosphere of Madison College in an area where those enrolled are eager to learn, gaining knowledge and experience for a hopeful future. He encouraged his sons to expand their computer knowledge with courses at Madison College.
He was a passionate family man and with a family of sons, he enjoyed being involved in their activities during their growing-up years with coaching their sports teams. He was also involved with the Boy Scouts and especially enjoyed the Scout trips to the Boundary Waters.
Al was a man of faith, committed to living his life with integrity as an Ambassador for his Lord and Savior, Jesus Christ. He was on the Board of Directors for the Dane County Credit Union for over 30 years, serving as Chairman 10 years. After retiring, he and Sally spent many enjoyable days on the banks of the Mississippi River in Cassville, WI, relaxing at Larsons-on-the-River with family and friends.
Donor/Thank you letter: Sally Larson more...

Alan R. Propst Scholarship
Applicant must be enrolled full-time as an undergraduate or graduate student at the Oshkosh campus. Applicant must be majoring in a healthcare-related field. Preference will be given to students in the College of Nursing. However, others are encouraged to apply. Applicant must have graduated from any Dodge County, WI high school. Applicant must have an excellent attendance record during high school and must have done volunteer work in the healthcare field. Applicant must have a minimum 3.0 GPA. Preference will be given to students with financial need based on the FAFSA. This award will be paid out in Fall 2023. more...

Aldrian Guszkowski Scholarship
The Aldrian Guszkowski Scholarship is available to students in the School of Architecture and Urban Planning at the University of Wisconsin-Milwaukee. You must enrolled in the M.Arch or M.Arch/MUP program and demonstrate academic and design merit. You must also have an interest in the design and construction of senior and multi-family developments to be eligible for this award. more...

Alexander M. Fortney Memorial Endowed Scholarship
This scholarship funds students enrolled in Madison Area Technical College Fire Service programs. It was established in memory of Alex Fortney, a student in the Madison College Fire Service program at the time of his death in 2005. "Alex’s qualities will continue to go on with those who knew him while he so-journeyed here on earth and for those recipients in the future receiving this scholarship. Those closed to Alex today still wear the wrist bands with his birth and death date and “WWFD” (What Would Fortney Do?) proving the influence of his life’s example with his looking at the world in a different way than the norm when physically present among us. Alex’s life enfolds a great legacy for those knowing him and even those told of who he was; desiring to do with what he was blessed with regardless of others viewpoint; as being created for a purpose and with making the world a better place for others coming after as his life and example are of great value. Doing the best with what has been given one, and if not done what a great loss for others coming after." Students eligible to be considered must be enrolled in the Fire Service program. New and returning students can be considered at the discretion of the program. Credit enrollment must meet the minimum established by the program. Academic achievement must be acceptable, but is not of prime significance. Donor/Thank you: Kari Matson-Fortney
HPS Scholarship more...

Alfred Kisubi Scholarship
This scholarship was established in 2018, in honor of COEHS professor Alfred Kisubi, who made a significant impact on the human services leadership program at UW Oshkosh. Applicant must be a full- or part-time undergraduate student enrolled at the Oshkosh campus. Applicant must be a human services leadership major who intends to graduate in the academic year of application and has plans to pursue a master’s degree in human services leadership. Applicant must have a minimum 3.75 cumulative GPA in their major. Applicant must be active in the Human Services Leadership Student Organization or Tau Upsilon Alpha, must have demonstrated leadership in the community, and must demonstrate a commitment to the human services leadership profession. This award will be paid out in Spring 2023, or Fall 2022 depending on the recipient’s date of graduation. more...

Alice Siu-Fun Leung Award
Alice Siu-Fun Leung earned a BS Degree with a major in Mathematics from UWM in January, 1973. In her will she donated funds to establish an award for outstanding UWM undergraduate students in Mathematical Sciences. Applicants must be UWM math majors or intended majors (includes Actuarial Science, Data Science, and Applied Math and Computer Science) with demonstrated academic merit (minimum 3.0 cumulative GPA) and the support of a math professors.
Applications are typically accepted between March and April. Awards given in spring are for the following school year so students graduating that same spring or summer are not eligible. E.G. applications reviewed in Spring 2022 are for Fall 2022; students graduating in May or August 2022 are not eligible. more...

Allan W. Gerow Memorial Scholarship
Applicant must be an undergraduate student enrolled as a finance major at the Oshkosh campus. Applicant must be in good standing and have been admitted, or have applied for spring admission, to the College of Business. Applicant must have at least junior standing and must have completed at least six credit hours of finance coursework, not including Bus 331. Applicant must demonstrate a high level of academic achievement in finance and related business courses and leadership skills in student organizations or other extracurricular activities (excluding athletics). This award will be paid out in Spring 2022. more...

Allen & Tammy Becker Family Pay It Forward La Crosse Area Endowed Scholarship
1. Recipient must be enrolled full-time at UWL with a major in Accountancy
2. Recipient must be a sophomore or junior
3. Recipient must have graduated from a La Crosse, Onalaska, or Holmen, WI High School
4. Recipient must be in good academic standing with GPA of at least 3.25
5. Recipient must be the type of person who will eventually “pay it forward” by helping others within the La Crosse community
6. Essay required on how you (have given/plan to give back) to the greater La Crosse community more...

Allen K. Butcher Music Education Scholarship
This scholarship was established in memory of Allen K. Butcher, UW Oshkosh music faculty member from 1971 to 1995. Applicant must be an incoming freshman admitted to the Oshkosh campus for Summer 2022 or Fall 2022. Applicant must plan to pursue a degree in instrumental music education. Applicant’s primary instrument must be wind or percussion. Applicant must have a minimum 3.0 cumulative high school GPA. The primary criteria for selection are outstanding academic and musical achievement and potential for growth, as demonstrated through a scholarship audition. Applicant must enroll full-time for Fall 2022 in order to receive the award payout. more...

Alliant Energy Scholarship
The Alliant Energy scholarship will be directed to provide access to learning opportunities. The goal is to help future generations lead productive lives by increasing their self-esteem and self-sufficiency through programs that lead to rewarding careers. Support can help meet tuition, book and/or supply assistance for which other financial aid is not available. Donor/Thank you: Adam Erdmann more...

Alumni Scholarship - Mbu
The Alumni Scholarship is available to freshmen and transfer students at Maranatha Baptist University. Your parent or parents must have graduated from Maranatha to be eligible for this award. Additionally, you must enroll on a full-time basis. more...

Alumni-Sponsored Excellence In Nursing Scholarship
This scholarship is funded by donations from College of Nursing alumni who want to help the next generation of nurses achieve their dream of becoming a nurse. Applicant must be a full-time undergraduate enrolled at the Oshkosh campus. Applicant must have been admitted, or have applied for spring admission, to the College of Nursing and must be pursuing a BSN degree. Applicant must demonstrate financial need based on the FAFSA; academic excellence as shown through GPA; and a commitment to UW Oshkosh, as shown through campus involvement. Applicant must be willing to have their name and photo used for publicity purposes. This award will be paid out in Fall 2023. more...

Amelia Lucas Trust Fund Award
The Amelia Lucas Trust Fund Award is open to undergraduate and graduate students at the University of Wisconsin-Milwaukee who are studying communication. You must be conducting research to qualify for this award. Selection is based on the quality and level of student participation in the research and its presentation. more...

Annual award for resident of AZ, CO, IA, ID, IL, IN, KS, MN, MO, ND, NE, NV, OH, OR, SD, UT or WI who is an undergraduate student attending Marian College of Fond du Lac in Wisconsin full-time. Applicant must have a minimum GPA of 3.0 (for entering freshmen, top 25% of high school class); show financial need; and show involvement on their campus and in their community. more...

Amy Stephenson Memorial Scholarship
Provide scholarship funds for a student studying business at Madison College with a preference for a returning adult female. This scholarship was established as an annual scholarship in 1999 by family members and friends of Amy who was employed full-time at Oscar Mayer while pursuing a business degree at Madison College. Amy was involved in a range of athletic and volunteer activities. Donors: Carol, Christine and Janeen Stephenson more...

Mr. Anderson’s goal is to provide financial assistance to select recipients who are committed to pursuing a technical degree leading to employment. Andrews Family Outstanding Scec Service Award
This award was established by Marlene Andrews and her family. The award is given to an undergraduate special education major at the Oshkosh campus who is an active participant in the Student Council for Exceptional Children (SCEC) and has demonstrated outstanding service to both SCEC and the Special Education Department. Preference will be given to the president of the SCEC. Additional experience working with special needs children will be considered. No application is required for this award. For more information, please contact the Special Education Department at speced@uwosh.edu. This award will be paid out in Spring 2023. more...

Andy Robson Earth Charter Award
This award is named in honor of Professor Andy Robson, whose efforts were central to UW Oshkosh becoming a national leader in supporting the Earth Charter. This award is given to a student who has engaged in sustained activism that embodies the principles of the Earth Charter: respect and care for the community of life, ecological integrity, social and economic justice, democracy and peace. No application is required for this award. For more information, please contact Environmental Studies at es@uwosh.edu. more...

*Financial need must be considered with preference for a student who needs assistance in overcoming social, cultural, financial and personal challenges in order to participate fully in college life more...

Anna Maria Williams Endowed Scholarship
The Anna Maria Williams Endowed Scholarship is available to full - time entering freshmen at the University of Wisconsin, Parkside. You must be majoring in pre - medicine, have a minimum GPA of 3.7 and an ACT score of 27 to be eligible for this award. In addition, you must be planning to complete four years at UW-Parkside and then seek professional degrees in medicine, osteopathic, podiatric or veterinary medicine, optometry or dentistry. more...

Once she graduated from the RT program she continued to work on her education obtaining her MBA and eventually became the director of the Respiratory Therapy Department at UW. This scholarship is in her honor. Donor/ Thank you letter: Amy Setchell more...

Arend Family Accounting Scholarship
This scholarship was established in 2021 by the Arend Family to recognize and give back for the excellent education they received from the UW Oshkosh College of Business. Applicant must be a full-time undergraduate student enrolled at the Oshkosh campus. Applicant must be admitted, or have applied for spring admission, to the College of Business and must have a declared accounting major. Applicant must have a minimum 3.5 cumulative GPA and must be a current or past executive board member of the Accounting Club. Financial need is not a consideration. This award will be paid out in Fall 2023. more...

Arlan Vandewater Memorial Scholarship
Available to part- or full-time students enrolled in any program at Madison College-Reedsburg. Must have completed 12 or more credits at Madison College and earned 2.5 grade point average or higher. Donor: John Alt more...

Arlisle Wolff Memorial Scholarship

Army Rotc Scholarship
Army ROTC at UW Oshkosh offers two, three, and four-year scholarships to qualified students who are motivated to become officers in the United States Army, Army National Guard, or Army Reserve. All Army ROTC scholarships cover full tuition, fees, books (maximum of $1,200 per year), and a cash stipend. The stipend is $300, $350, $400, and $500 per month as a freshman, sophomore, junior, and senior respectively. Applicant must be enrolled at the Oshkosh campus. Applications for this scholarship are accepted year-round. More information can be found on the Army ROTC webpage. more...

Arnold And Lois Domer Foundation Scholarship
The Arnold and Lois Domer Foundation Scholarship is available to continuing students at Chippewa Valley Technical College. You must have at least a 2.75 GPA with a minimum of 12 credits completed to be eligible for this award. First preference will be given to first-generation college student with financial need. more...

Applicant must be in good standing and must have been admitted, or have applied for spring admission, to the College of Business. Applicant must be majoring in finance and must have a minimum 2.5 cumulative GPA. Applicant must demonstrate participation in extra-curricular activities. This award will be paid out in Fall 2023. more...

Arthur Chapple Study Abroad Scholarship
This scholarship is awarded to full-time undergraduate students majoring in history or international studies at the Oshkosh campus. Applicant must be participating in a UW Oshkosh-sponsored study abroad program taking place in 2023. Applicant must have a minimum 3.0 cumulative GPA (both overall and in their major) and must have completed at least 15 credits in their major. This award will be paid out against the recipient’s study abroad program fee. more...

Ascension Athletic Training Award
This award was established by Ascension to encourage and recognize a student who has demonstrated excellence in the area of athletic training. The award is given to a graduate student enrolled at the Oshkosh campus who is in the second year of the athletic training master’s degree program. No application is required for this award. It is awarded to the student with the highest cumulative GPA at the conclusion of the fall semester preceding the announcement of the award. This award will be paid out in Spring 2023. more...

Ascension Mercy Hospital Volunteers Scholarship
This scholarship was established by the Ascension Mercy Hospital Volunteers Organization to financially support students in the UW Oshkosh nursing program and to promote the advancement of nursing care in our community. Applicant must be a full-time undergraduate admitted to the traditional BSN program at the Oshkosh campus. Applicant must have completed one semester of the clinical major (must be Junior I or Junior II when applying). Applicant must show academic achievement and must demonstrate financial need based on the FAFSA. Preference will be given to a student who is or has been a volunteer at Ascension Mercy Hospital. However, other students are encouraged to apply. This award will be paid out in Fall 2022. more...

Aurora Health Care Scholarship
Applicant must be a full- or part-time graduate student enrolled at the Oshkosh campus in one of the following nursing programs: Nurse Practitioner, Nurse Educator or Clinical Nurse Leader emphasis or Doctor of Nursing Practice. Applicant must have a GPA greater than 3.5 and must have candidacy approval (9+ graduate credits). Applicant must agree to work in the state of Wisconsin for at least one full year post-graduation. Preference will be given to applicants whose post-graduation goals are congruent with promoting affordable, accessible healthcare. This award will be paid out in Fall 2023. more...

(3) Recipient may be a junior, senior or graduate student in any of the disciplines listed above who is a high school graduate from the Rusk County (Wisconsin) Public Schools;

The automotive service industry is continuously changing. Technologies are advancing and the need for a highly skilled workforce is needed. To be eligible, new students need to enter the Wisconsin Skills USA High School state competition competitors placing 1st, 2nd, and 3rd in the Automotive Services Technology contest. Bartlett Award
This award was established by William P. Bartlett. It is awarded to a geology major enrolled at the Oshkosh campus who has completed their second-year geology courses. Recipient must have at least 18 credits in geology completed, including at least two credits of field trip courses by the end of the academic year. Recipient must demonstrate a commitment to the study of geology and must have a minimum 2.5 overall GPA and financial need. No application is required for this award. For more information, please contact the geology department at geology@uwosh.edu. This award will be paid out in Fall 2023. more...

Batien-Carlson Memorial Scholarship
This scholarship was created in loving memory of Lori Batien-Carlson and her father, David Batien. Lori worked several years as an EMT for the Fitchrona EMS District. She died suddenly on March 20, 2006 and was an alumna of the MATC program. Her father, a radiology professional, was also a graduate of MATC and worked as an EMT for Klutz Ambluance Service, Fort Atkinson. He died of complications from diabetes just one month after his daughter. They both loved serving the public and were, in turn, helped through their illnesses by paramedics in our community. Must work in field for 2 years. Fort Atkinson student is preferred.
HPS Scholarship more...

Applicant must have been admitted, or have applied for fall admission, to the Teacher Education Program. Applicant must demonstrate academic achievement and financial need based on the FAFSA. Preference will be given to students who are studying social science education or elementary education with a social science minor. However, other applicants will be considered. This award will be paid out in Fall 2022. more...

Bernice & Forrest Derickson Memorial Scholarship
Forrest and Bernice Derickson’s children established this scholarship in recognition of the commitment to learning demonstrated by their parents. Applicant must be a full-time undergraduate enrolled at the Oshkosh campus. Applicant must have been admitted, or have applied for fall admission, to the Teacher Education Program. Preference will be given to students pursuing a degree in elementary education. Applicant must be either over the age of 30 or must be a student who has returned to school after an absence of more than 10 years. Preference will be given to those applicants who have financial need based on the FAFSA. This award will be paid out in Fall 2022. more...

Berquist Study Abroad Scholarship
The Berquist Study Abroad Scholarship supports undergraduate students from any major leading to a bachelor’s degree going on an approved study abroad experience outside of the United States. Preference is given to students who are first generation and/or have documented financial need. Minimum GPA is a 2.5 cumulative. Applications are typically accepted in November/December for Spring study abroad and in February/March for Summer and Fall study abroad. more...

Beth Jefferson ‘Women In Firefighting’ Scholarship
The Beth Jefferson Women in Firefighting Scholarship is awarded twice a year to individuals looking for a career in firefighting. The scholarship will be awarded on merit and MUST be awarded to a female or racial/ethnic minority candidate, looking to join the firefighting industry. The brave first responders have a special calling, that allows them to put others before themselves while serving our communities. This scholarship will provide a worthy candidate the opportunity to be trained to serve this cause. Jefferson Fire & Safety is a 4th generation, female owned and operated business, looking to promote females in the fire service industry. Jefferson Fire is a supplier of fire fighter gear and this scholarship may include a basic set of turnout gear to the candidate. Scholarship may also provide candidate the opportunity to participate in ‘in-house’ trainings if qualified.
HPS Scholarship more...

Betty Baird And Beatrice Baird Scholarship Fund (Soe)
Recipient must be full time at UWL and enrolled in the School of Education with a major in Physical Education Teacher Education;
Recipient must be in good academic standing with a GPA of at least 3.0
Recipient must be student teaching when the scholarship is paid, so must apply in the spring prior to their student teaching semester
Financial need shall be considered
Applicants must provide faculty references who will be asked to complete a survey with the following questions:
* What is your relationship to the applicant?
* How long have you known the applicant?
* Rate the applicant’s academic ability & knowledge of subject matter in your class
* Rate the applicant’s character and motivation
* Rate the applicant’s potential for making future contributions to society more...

Betty Griesbach Scholarship
Scholarship for juniors, seniors or graduate students attending the University of Wisconsin-Oshkosh who are majoring in Special Education. Selection based on academic achievement and career goals. Number of awards may vary. Nonrenewable. more...

Betty L. Griesbach Scholarship
This scholarship was established in memory of Betty L. Griesbach ’74. Applicant must be a full- or part-time graduate student or a full-time undergraduate student enrolled the Oshkosh campus. Applicant must be majoring in special education. Undergraduate applicants must have met Gateway I requirements and been admitted, or have applied for fall admission, to the Teacher Education Program and must achieve at least junior standing by Fall 2021. Preference will be given to women over 30 years old with family responsibilities. Preference will be given to applicants whose interest is working directly with special needs children or adults, either in the classroom or one-on-one, rather than those applicants whose interest is pursuing other career paths such as research or administration. Preference will be given to applicants with financial need based on the FAFSA. This award will be split evenly between the Fall 2021 and Spring 2022 semesters. If the recipient is graduating in the semester, they are eligible to receive the full award amount in Fall 2021. more...

Beverly Engeldinger Memorial Nursing Scholarship
This nursing scholarship is created in honor of Beverly Evans Engeldinger, who after living a long, full life passed away at 92! One of her proudest services to her community was being a nurse for more than 30 years and continuing to help family members, friends, and many others with their physical, emotional, and spiritual well-being in her retirement. This scholarship is for deserving nursing students to help them in their educational journey so that they too can serve in this unique way. more...

Big Dog F.I.S.H Scholarship
Food insecurity is a real issue for Madison College students. Scholarship donation boxes have been placed at every Food Service cash registers so customers can donate their spare change. These donations will fund the scholarship. The goal of this scholarship is to minimize food insecurity for a student who struggles to afford daily nutrition. The $125 award will be deposited on their Madison College student One-card and will allow purchases at any Madison College food venue. Students using their student One-card at a College venue receive at 10% discount. Thank you letter: Jason Walker & Brad Kahn more...

Biotechnology Scholarship

Bollom Family Scholarship
This scholarship was established by Dan and Penny Bollom. Recipient must be an incoming freshman from Winnebago or Brown County, WI who has been admitted to the Oshkosh campus for Summer 2022 or Fall 2022. Recipient cannot be receiving any other scholarships other than financial aid (grants and loans). No application is required; every student meeting these criteria will be automatically considered for the scholarship. The recipient is selected at random. This award will be paid out in Fall 2022.
Recipients are eligible to receive three additional years of this scholarship, provided they maintain enrollment at the Oshkosh campus, remain in good standing, continue to have financial need, and there are sufficient funds to support renewals. Renewal award amounts decrease each year of the award based on a formula determined by the donor. more...

Bolz Family Scholarship
Available for full time Madison/Dane Country residents. Students with a miniumum of a 3.0 grade point average or higher enrolled in the Animation-Concept Development, Graphic Design, Photography or Visual Communications- Media Design programs. Donor/TY: Mr. and Mrs. Bolz more...

Bonell Family Nursing Scholarship
Applicant must be a full-time graduate nursing student enrolled at the Oshkosh campus. Applicant must have completed a minimum of 15 graduate credits. Applicant must be in good standing and must demonstrate academic achievement. Applicant must be a role model of healthy behavior via a self-report of lifestyle improvement or a leadership role within a community group or class. Applicant must have need based on the FAFSA. This award will be paid out in Spring 2023. more...

Bowman Scholarship
This scholarship was established by Max Bowman, UW Oshkosh professor emeritus of chemistry, in honor of his parents, Earl and Alpha Bowman, who were both in the teaching profession. Applicant must be a full-time undergraduate or graduate student enrolled at the Oshkosh campus or an incoming student accepted for full-time admission to the Oshkosh campus. Applicant must have a declared or intended major in biology, microbiology, chemistry, physics, astronomy, geology, psychology, or a closely allied field. In accordance with the donor’s desire to encourage more African Americans, Native Americans, Hispanic Americans and females to enter the sciences, preference will be given to applicants from these groups. This award will be split evenly between the Fall 2021 and Spring 2022 semesters. If the recipient is not enrolled in the spring semester, the second installment will be forfeited. more...

Bowman Scholarship
Scholarship for undergraduate or graduate students attending the University of Wisconsin-Oshkosh who are majoring in Biology, Microbiology, Chemistry, Physics, Astronomy, Geology, Psychology or allied field. Selection based on career goals. Preference given to minority and female applicants. Nonrenewable. more...

Boys-Girls State Scholarship
Scholarship for undergraduate students attending Ripon College in Wisconsin full-time. Applicants must participate in their states annual Boy/Girl State Conference each summer. By involvement in this program, candidate has demonstrated leadership and commitment to our nations democratic ideals. Number of awards and award amount varies. Renewable; must remain full-time and have satisfactory progress. more...

Braatz-Starr Memorial Award
This award was established by the History Department in honor of Dr. Werner Braatz and Dr. Joseph Starr, two long-time department members. It is awarded to a senior history major enrolled at the Oshkosh campus who has demonstrated academic achievement. There is no application for this award. For more information, please contact the History Department at historyoffice@uwosh.edu. This award will be paid out in Spring 2023. more...

2. Financial need must be considered

Brannan Family Student Veteran And Military-Connected Student Scholarship
This scholarship is open to student veterans, current service members, service members in the Reserve or National Guard, spouses of veterans or service members, or dependent children of veterans or service members.
Recipient must be enrolled full-time
Recipient must have good academic standing
The applicant is required to complete the following supplemental questions:
1. What is the student’s military status or military connection?
2. What did the student learn, what enduring lessons exist, and/or what is their most poignant memory from their military service or the service of their spouse/parent?
3. How does this military service inspire or influence the student in their academic pursuits? more...

Brenda Lee Lau Storytelling Scholarship
This scholarship was established by Radio-TV-Film alumna Brenda Lau ’83. It recognizes students who demonstrate promise in the field of narrative storytelling. Applicant must be a full-time undergraduate enrolled at the Oshkosh campus. Applicant must have a declared major or minor in Radio-TV-Film, English, or creative writing. First preference will be given to a student majoring in Radio-TV-Film or English. Applicant must have at least 45 credits completed and must have a minimum 3.0 cumulative GPA. Financial need shall not be a consideration. Previous recipients are eligible to apply. However, students may only receive the award a total of two times. This award will be paid out in Spring 2023. more...

Bret Goodman Marketing Scholarship
This scholarship was established in 2019 by Bret Goodman ’71. Applicant must be a full-time undergraduate enrolled at the Oshkosh campus. Application must be admitted, or have applied for spring admission, to the College of Business and must be majoring in marketing. Applicant must have a minimum 3.25 cumulative GPA and must demonstrate an interest in marketing through marketing-related extra-curricular or professional activities. This award will be paid out in Spring 2022. more...

Brett Marlow Wise Memorial Endowed Scholarship
This scholarship has been established for Electrical Engineering students with a GPA of 3.0 or greater (in EET courses).
Brett Marlow Wise was born on July 7, 1985 in Opelika, AL. After several family moves, in June 2002 he settled in Madison, WI, along with his parents and younger sister. Brett graduated from Madison Memorial High School in 2003. After high school he entered the United States Army, serving for two years at Ft. Stewart, GA. Following his Army tour he returned to Wisconsin and worked at several different jobs in Madison. Brett also found great enjoyment playing guitar with his friends in several bands around the Madison area. In 2011 Brett moved to Milwaukee to be near his future wife, Amanda Strobel, who he married in 2015; while there he earned an associate’s degree in Criminal Justice from Milwaukee Area Technical College. He returned to Madison for good in 2013.
In 2015, Brett was accepted into an apprenticeship program at Extreme Engineering Solutions (X-ES) in Verona, WI. Meanwhile he attended Madison Area Technical College (Madison College), pursuing an electrical engineering technology (EET) degree, which he received in May 2017. While at Madison College Brett made the Dean’s List each semester and he was inducted into the Phi Theta Kappa Honor Society. Following graduation Brett was employed fulltime by X-ES, and he found his work there to be profoundly satisfying. He knew the work he performed at X-ES was important and he hoped to build a career there.
Tragically, in August 2019, Brett died unexpectedly from undiagnosed heart disease. His parents, in concert with Extreme Engineering Solutions, have established an endowed scholarship fund in Brett’s memory for deserving students in the EET program. The hope is that this scholarship will help other young men and women with aspirations for a career in the electronics industry to achieve their goals and to keep Brett’s memory alive for decades to come. more...

Bruce & Peggie Riley Endowed Scholarship In Mathematics Education (Soe Or Csh)
● Recipient must be enrolled full-time at UWL
● Recipient must be formally admitted or has applied to the School of Education working toward certification in Secondary Mathematics Education.
● Recipient must be in good academic standing with a cumulative GPA of at least 3.0
● Recipient must participate in research in mathematics education, mathematics or statistics, working with a
faculty mentor on a research project relevant to K-12 curriculum during the time the scholarship is being received, and present the results of the project at an appropriate venue (for example, the UWL Celebration of Student Research and Creativity, a Wisconsin Mathematics Council conference, or another professional conference/meeting)
● A letter of support from the faculty mentor for the research project must be submitted with the scholarship application
● Recipient must be a junior or senior
● Financial need may be considered more...

Burton E. Karges Geology Scholarship
This scholarship was established by Vivian Karges in memory of her husband, Burton E. Karges, who started the geology program at UW Oshkosh in 1934 and taught at UW Oshkosh until his death in 1972. It is awarded to a graduating senior enrolled in the geology professional emphasis (not hydrogeology) at the Oshkosh campus who has demonstrated an outstanding record of scholarship. There is no application for this award. Selection is based on GPA in geology and overall GPA. For more information, please contact the Geology Department at geology@uwosh.edu. This award will be paid out in Spring 2023. more...

Business Capp Scholarship
This scholarship is awarded to high school Cooperative Academic Partnership Program (CAPP) students who have been admitted to UW Oshkosh as incoming freshmen for Summer 2022 or Fall 2022 and must be planning to pursue a business degree. Students attending the Oshkosh, Fox Cities, or the Fond du Lac campus are eligible to apply. Applicant must apply during their senior year of high school. Applicant must have either successfully completed at least one CAPP course or be currently enrolled in a CAPP course at the time of application. Applicant must have a minimum 3.0 cumulative high school GPA. Recipients must be enrolled full-time in Fall 2022 to receive the award. This scholarship is not renewable. more...

Business Scholars Dean's Scholarship
Applicant must be an incoming freshmen or incoming transfer student admitted to UW Oshkosh for Summer 2022 or Fall 2022. Applicant must be admitted to the Business Scholars Program and must intend to major within the College of Business. Students will automatically be considered for this award based on the Business Scholars Program and Scholarship Application. Recipient must be enrolled full-time in Fall 2022 when the award is paid out. more...

Business Technology Program Scholarship
We are excited to offer this scholarship to help Business Technology students reach their career goals. This scholarship is for a full-time or part-time student enrolled in the Administrative Professional, Office Assistant, Medical Administrative Specialist, Medical Billing Specialist or Healthcare Receptionist program. Students with a GPA of 2.5 or above are eligible to apply for this scholarship. Business Technology faculty fully fund this scholarship. Donor/Thank you: Lynn Baldwin and Kristyn Jacobson more...

Butch's Lil' America Builders Scholarship
This scholarship has been established in memory of Myron “Butch” Ledworowski. Butch established Lil’ America Builders, Inc as a home remodeling business nearly 30 years ago. His goal was “to provide exceptional service, design, & product delivered with credibility and trust”. A secondary goal was “to make the, typically, stressful remodeling experience fun”. His business thrived on repeat customers and direct referrals. After getting his degree in industrial arts, Butch developed a strong interest in technical education. For many years he served on the education committee of the National Association of the Remodeling Industry (NARI) as well as serving on Madison College’s Construction and Remodeling Advisory committee. Butch helped plan and/or participated in many workshops designed to promote professionalism and ethics in the remodeling industry. This scholarship is available to full-time Construction & Remodeling program students with a 2.5 grade point average or higher who have expressed an interest in owning their own home remodeling business and construction management.
Donor/TY: Doreen Griesbach more...

This scholarship was established in 1987 by the family and friends of C. Kevin Hasson. Applicant must be enrolled at the Oshkosh campus and must be majoring in history. Applicant must have junior or senior standing and must have a minimum 3.75 cumulative GPA. Applicant must demonstrate research and writing that contribute to the history discipline. Applicant must show a determination to continue the search for historical truth as a teacher, scholar, professional, history maker, or enlightened citizen. This award will be paid out in Fall 2021. more...

Candice E. Tylke Emergency Services Scholarship
This scholarship is in memory of Candice E. Tylke. Candice was a 10-year veteran fire fighter and paramedic for the City of Beloit. She also worked in St. Francis in Milwaukee. She was a longtime member of the International Association of Fire Fighters and International Association of Flight Paramedics. In addition, she had experience as a flight paramedic with Wausau MedEvac and is believed to have been the first female enrolled in the college’s fire science program. Candice enjoyed the outdoors and was a very active person. She was a positive influence to all who knew her. Candice passed away July 26, 2008 in Madison, WI at age 42. This scholarship is available for full-time Emergency Services students with a grade point average of 2.5 and higher.
Donor/ Thank You Letter: Mary Ellis
HPS Scholarship more...

Candice E. Tylke Scholarship
This scholarship was established in memory of Candice Tylke, a UW Oshkosh alumna who graduated with a BS in biology in 1994. Applicant must be admitted for Spring 2023, Summer 2023, or Fall 2023 or must be currently enrolled at least part-time in the Bachelor of Applied Studies Fire and Emergency Response Management program at the Oshkosh campus. Preference will be given to applicants with prior experience in fire science/paramedic service. Preference will also be given to fire science graduates of the Madison College and employees of Beloit, WI or St. Francis, WI fire departments. This award will be split evenly between the Fall 2023 and Spring 2024 semesters. If the recipient is not enrolled in the spring semester, the second installment will be forfeited. Recipient must be enrolled in at least six credits each semester to receive the scholarship disbursement. more...

Capital Chapter Industrial Maintenance Institute
Donor/Thank you letter: Dale Schultz more...

Capp Excellence Award
This scholarship is awarded to incoming freshmen admitted to the Oshkosh campus for Summer 2022 or Fall 2022. Applicant must have taken at least one UW Oshkosh CAPP course while in high school. Applicant must have a minimum high school GPA of 3.5. Recipient must enroll full-time and live in an Oshkosh campus residence hall in Fall 2022 and Spring 2023 to receive the award. Recipients of this scholarship are not eligible to receive the CAPP Stay A Titan Award, the Residence Life Access to Excellence Scholarship, or the Campus Life Award.
In order to be considered for the award, students must submit their General Application in Academic Works; no additional application is necessary. Awards will be made on a first-come, first-served basis using the General Application submission date.
This scholarship will be renewable for a second year provided the recipient maintains a minimum 3.0 cumulative GPA, completes at least 27 credits between Fall 2022 and Spring 2023, continues to live in on-campus housing during their second year, and provided funding is available. more...

Capp Newspa Scholarship
This scholarship is awarded to high school Cooperative Academic Partnership Program (CAPP) students who have been admitted to UW Oshkosh as incoming freshmen for Summer 2022 or Fall 2022. Students attending the Oshkosh, Fox Cities, or the Fond du Lac campus are eligible to apply. Applicant must apply during their senior year of high school. Applicant must have either successfully completed at least one CAPP course or be currently enrolled in a CAPP course at the time of application and must have attended the Northeastern Wisconsin Scholastic Press Association (NEWSPA) Conference at least once during their high school career. Recipients must be enrolled full-time in Fall 2022 to receive the award. This scholarship is not renewable. more...

Capp Scholarship
This scholarship is awarded to high school Cooperative Academic Partnership Program (CAPP) students who have been admitted to UW Oshkosh as incoming freshmen for Summer 2022 or Fall 2022. Students attending the Oshkosh, Fox Cities, or the Fond du Lac campus are eligible to apply. Applicant must apply during their senior year of high school. Applicant must have either successfully completed at least one CAPP course or be currently enrolled in a CAPP course at the time of application. Recipients must be enrolled full-time in Fall 2022 to receive the award. This scholarship is not renewable. Students may apply for the CAPP Scholarship and the Honors College CAPP Scholarship, but are only eligible to receive one of the awards. more...

Capp Stay A Titan Award
This scholarship is awarded to incoming freshmen admitted to the Oshkosh campus for Summer 2022 or Fall 2022. Applicant must have taken at least one UW Oshkosh CAPP course while in high school. Applicant must have a minimum high school GPA of 3.5 and must have at least $2,000 of financial need based on the FAFSA. Recipient must enroll full-time and live in an Oshkosh campus residence hall in Fall 2022 and Spring 2023 in order to receive the award. Recipients of this scholarship are not eligible to receive the CAPP Excellence Award, the Residence Life Access to Excellence Scholarship, or the Campus Life Award.
In order to be considered for the award, students must submit their General Application in Academic Works; no additional application is necessary. Awards will be made on a first-come, first-served basis using the General Application submission date.
This scholarship will be renewable for a second year provided the recipient maintains a minimum 3.0 cumulative GPA, completes at least 27 credits between Fall 2022 and Spring 2023, continues to live in on-campus housing during their second year, and provided funding is available. more...

Cecilia & Gabriel Manrique Scholarship
This scholarship will alternate between Golden Key members and Political Science majors: Odd years to Golden Key and Even years to Pol Sci. Odd/even year is determined by the first number year of the academic year (ex. 2020-21 is Pol Sci).
Odd Years
1. The recipient must be enrolled full-time at UWL
2. The recipient must be a sophomore, junior or senior
3. The recipient must be a member of the UWL Chapter of the Golden Key International Honour Society
Even Years
1. The recipient must be enrolled full-time at UWL with a major in political science
2. The recipient must have a GPA of at least 3.75
3. The recipient must be a sophomore, junior or senior more...

This scholarship was established by Mr. Moore Lee, head administrator of Central Boarding Academy, in appreciation of the Academy’s strong partnership with Gruenhagen Conference Center (GCC) and the outstanding service its staff provides to the international secondary students living in GCC. Applicant must be a full- or part-time student enrolled at the Oshkosh campus. Applicant must be employed by GCC. Applicant must have a minimum 2.75 cumulative GPA. Applicant must have financial need based on a statement. Selection will be based primarily on the applicant’s letter of recommendation. This award will be paid out in Spring 2022. more...

Chancellor's Academic Scholarship
Applicant must be a graduating high school senior admitted to the Oshkosh campus for Summer 2022 or Fall 2022. Applicant must have demonstrated an outstanding academic record throughout their high school career and must have a minimum 3.6 high school GPA. Financial need will not be a consideration for this scholarship. Selection will be based upon the applicant’s academic achievement, which may include ACT/SAT scores, and community involvement. Recipient must enroll full-time in Fall 2022 in order to receive the award. more...

Chancellor's Award For Excellence
Applicant must be nominated by a faculty or staff member or a fellow student. Self-nominations are not accepted. Applicant must be an undergraduate enrolled at the Oshkosh campus. Applicant must have at least 84 credits completed at the time of application, of which the last 30 must have been earned at UW Oshkosh. Applicant must have a minimum 3.0 UWO GPA and must be planning to graduate in Spring 2022, Summer 2022, or Fall 2022. Applicant must show evidence of achievement in academic performance, University-related activities, and community involvement. Participation in athletics cannot be considered due to NCAA Division III guidelines. more...

Charles E. Hurst Scholarship
This $1,000 scholarship is given to a full-time undergraduate in the College of Letters & Science with documented financial need who is a first generation student.
Students who have an up-to-date Panther Scholarship Portal General Application and the College of Letters & Science Scholarships and Awards Application will be considered, typically in spring each year between February and April. No additional or separate application is required; students should thoroughly fill out the Panther Scholarship Portal General Application and the College of Letters & Science Scholarships and Awards Application. Awards given in spring are for the following school year so students graduating that same spring or summer are not eligible. E.G. applications reviewed in Spring 2022 are for Fall 2022; students graduating in May or August 2022 are not eligible. more...

Charles J. Lenz Scholarship

Padron ’92, ’94 Madison College (MATC) alumnus established this scholarship in honor of Chef Paul Short, Program Chair of the Culinary Arts Program. “Paul was integral in my accomplishments as a student and as a culinary and hospitality professional. He was a caring and compassionate mentor, who instilled in me the qualities of determination and persistence. I honor his commitment by carrying on his legacy as a passionate educator.” This scholarship assists a first ­generation college student in the Culinary Arts Program. Dr. Padron wishes to recognize the recipient for his/her commitment to culinary professionalism and a passion for leading and advancing the culinary arts profession. more...

The Chemistry and Engineering Majors Scholarship was created by the Chemistry faculty at Madison College for a deserving student who plans to complete a baccalaureate degree with a major in Chemistry or Engineering. This scholarship provides $400, which is intended to help defray the cost of buying textbooks or similar expenses. Applicant must have completed a 200 level chemistry course w/ B or better, and enrolled in either a second chemistry course or an engineering course. Applicant must be a continuing, full-time student with a GPA of 2.0 or higher.

Cheryl Mellenthin Nursing Scholarship
This scholarship was established by nursing alumna Cheryl L. Mellenthin ‘79. It is awarded to an incoming freshman accepted for full-time admission to the Oshkosh campus for Summer 2022 or Fall 2022. Applicant must have an intended major in nursing. Emphasis will be placed on the applicant’s financial need based on an essay. Preference will be given to students from Wisconsin. Recipient will be expected to work in order to help pay for educational expenses (summer or vacation work is acceptable). This award will be split between the Fall 2022 and the Spring 2023 semesters. The recipient will receive the scholarship for a total of four years, provided they maintain full-time enrollment, remain in good academic standing, are accepted into the College of Nursing (once applicable), and funding is available. A copy of the recipient’s transcript will be provided to the donor each year. more...

Child & Family Center Scholarship

Children Of Fallen Heroes Scholarship
This is a scholarship awarded to students whose parent/guardian died in the line of duty while serving as a public safety officer. This could include police, firefighter, emergency medical technician, or other individuals who qualify for Public Safety Officers Benefits (PSOB)*. This scholarship would qualify the student for the maximum Federal Pell Grant allowable for the award year.
*This scholarship does not include children of active duty military members who died in the line of duty.
To qualify for this scholarship, a student must be Pell-eligible and have a Pell-eligible estimated family contribution (EFC), and be less than 24 years of age or enrolled at an institution of higher education at the time of his or her parent’s or guardian’s death. In subsequent award years, the student continues to be eligible for the scholarship, as long as the student has a Pell-eligible EFC and continues to be an eligible student.
All Title IV aid awarded to such eligible students must be based on an EFC of zero without regard to the student’s calculated EFC. Thus, the student is eligible for the maximum Pell Grant for his or her enrollment status and cost of attendance. In addition, the student’s eligibility for Direct Loans and for Campus-Based program aid must be based on an EFC of zero. more...

Children's Theatre/Summerstage Scholarship
continuing student with a major in theatre arts
good academic standing more...

Choral Music Scholarship Fund (Sac)
high school graduate to be enrolled full time as a freshman with a major in choral music education
maintain a 2.75 gpa during both fall and spring semesters
must audition/enroll in at least one choral organization (preferably Concert Choir)
special application required from the Music Department
Performance Guidelines
Piano: Two pieces required (at least one memorized): 1) An allegro sonata movement from
Beethoven, Mozart or Haydn OR Prelude and Fugue by J.S. Bach, 2) Any piece composed in the
Romantic or Contemporary Era. Any repertoire substitutions should be addressed PRIOR to the
audition date.
Strings: a 5-10 minute performance of two contrasting styles or movements of Class A-level
solo literature or above. Memorization is optional. Accompaniment is not required, but is
encouraged.*
Winds: a 5-10 minute performance of two contrasting styles or movements of Class A-level
solo literature or above. Memorization is optional. Accompaniment is not required, but is
encouraged.*
Percussion: a 5-10 minute performance of Class A-level solo literature or above on snare drum
OR timpani, AND a keyboard percussion instrument. Memorization is optional.
Accompaniment is not required, but is encouraged.*
Voice: a 5-10 minute performance of contest-quality solo literature. If the length of one piece is
less than five minutes, a second piece of contrasting tempo, style or language is preferred.
Memorization is optional, but suggested. Vocalists must provide their own accompanist.*
All auditionees will be expected to demonstrate sight-reading abilities
A list of local accompanists is available upon request from the Department of Music.
All auditionees must make their own arrangements with their accompanist of choice.
Questions may be referred to: Dr. Christopher Frye, Department of Music Scholarship
Committee, phone: (608) 785 – 6729 or e-mail: frye.chri@uwlax.edu more...

Cialdini Fellowship
The Cialdini Fellowship provides financial support to exceptional doctoral students in the Department of Psychology. In addition to their departmental teaching/research/project assistantship salaries, each Cialdini Fellow will receive a stipend of $5,000 per year. Contingent on satisfactory progress and maintenance of good standing in the program, each awardee’s $5,000 fellowship will be renewable annually for a total of four years of support (a total of $20,000). Recipients are selected by faculty and there is no application. more...

Clifford A. Christl & Family Endowed Scholarship

Clifford H. Mortimer Scholarship
Multiple awards and scholarships are given to juniors, seniors, and graduate students in the Department of Biological Sciences for academic and scholarly achievements related to research of water, particularly lakes and freshwater (limnology).
Students who have an up-to-date Panther Scholarship Portal General Application and the College of Letters & Science Scholarships and Awards Application will be considered, typically in spring each year between February and April. If any additional application materials are needed, students will be contacted by email. Students should thoroughly fill out the Panther Scholarship Portal General Application and the College of Letters & Science Scholarships and Awards Application to be placed into the pool for consideration. Awards given in spring are for the following school year so students graduating that same spring or summer are not eligible. E.G. applications reviewed in Spring 2023 are for Fall 2023; students graduating in May or August 2023 are not eligible. more...

Clifford W. And William C. Sanders Memorial Award
This award is given to an undergraduate student majoring in German at the Oshkosh campus. First preference is given to an outstanding and deserving senior who is poised for a career in which German will have a prominent role. If there are no students meeting this preference, the award will be given to a student who shows great promise as a German major. If there are no German majors meeting these criteria, the award shall be given to a student in a different field of study in the following order: French, Japanese, and then Spanish. There is no application for this award; it is selected by faculty in the Department of Global Languages and Cultures. This award will be paid out in Spring 2022. more...

Clyde V. And Virginia H. Dohner Nursing Scholarship - Reedsburg
Virginia passed away on May 24, 2001, following a 2-year heart-related illness. During the time of her illness, she received excellent home health care from Sue Doering, a 2001 graduate of the Madison College Reedsburg Associate Degree Nursing Program. Clyde is establishing this memorial scholarship in appreciation of the special care Virginia received, along with his desire to help future students afford the cost of nursing education at Madison College-Reedsburg. Applicants must be interested in home health care and who are over 30 years old in the Associated Nursing program. Donor: James Dohner more...

Cob Capp Instructor Scholarship
The College of Business offers scholarships to students who are completing a professional development plan for COB CAPP instructor eligibility requirements, are enrolled in College of Business graduate courses, and are teaching UW Oshkosh CAPP courses. The scholarship is applicable to any eligible MBA Professional Program courses the student is enrolled in and the scholarship amount is equivalent to the MBA special course fee. The applicant must meet the MBA GPA and academic standing requirements. Students who are eligible for employer or government tuition benefits that are equal to or greater than $270.82 per credit for in person courses or $320.82 per credit for online courses are not eligible to receive this scholarship. UW System employees are eligible for this scholarship. This scholarship will be paid out in Fall 2022.
Students are eligible to receive this scholarship every semester they are enrolled in eligible COB graduate courses. The maximum number of credits that can be earned with the assistance of this scholarship is 18. Scholarships are distributed based on the number of CAPP approved credits taken in a given semester by a student. Students are also eligible to receive additional scholarships offered through the UW Oshkosh Foundation or other organizations. more...

Coehs Impact Grant
This grant is awarded to students facing emergency situations. Applicant must be currently enrolled in at least 9 credits and must be admitted to the College of Education and Human Services at the time of application. Applicant must have an emergency, short-term need for funding. Emergency funding must be used for education-related expenses, such as tuition and fees, books, housing, or other reasonable educational expenses. However, students may qualify for funding due to a personal emergency (e.g. financial crisis, health crisis – personally or within their immediate family, home or apartment fire, or accident). Emergency funding is meant to assist with a one-time expense, not ongoing financial needs. Students are only eligible to receive grants from the impact fund twice. Additional awards may be granted under extreme circumstances with approval from the dean of the College of Education and Human Services. Applications will be accepted and reviewed on an on-going basis until funding is depleted. Grants will be paid out to the recipient’s student account immediately following grant approval. more...

Coleman Nursing Scholarship
Scholarship for undergraduate students attending Cardinal Stritch University in Wisconsin, majoring in Nursing. Due date, number of awards, and award amount varies. more...
