College Of Nursing Emergency Grant
This grant is awarded to students facing emergency situations. Applicant must be officially admitted to the College of Nursing at the time of application and must be enrolled in a nursing program. Applicant must have an emergency, short-term need for funding for the Spring 2022 semester. Emergency funding must be used for education-related expenses, such as tuition and fees, books, housing, or other reasonable educational expenses. However, students may qualify for funding due to a personal emergency (e.g. financial crisis, health crisis – personally or within their immediate family, home or apartment fire, or accident). Emergency funding is meant to assist with a one-time expense, not ongoing financial needs. Grants will be paid out to the recipient’s student account immediately following grant approval (approximately mid-March). more...

College Of Nursing Student Support Grant
This grant is awarded to students who have a need for financial assistance in order to participate in education-related opportunities (e.g. NCLEX exam fees, conference fees, travel to conferences) above and beyond their UWO educational experience. Applicant must be officially admitted to the College of Nursing at the time of application and must be enrolled in a nursing program. Grants will be paid out to the recipient’s student account immediately following grant approval. more...

Commitment To Diversity Award (General)
explain the top three reasons that your nomination deserves the appropriate award recognition;
share diversity related contributions that improved the quality of life for all. This might include any innovations, interventions, generated resources, expansions, etc. that resulted in positive change;
describe impact of diversity and multicultural programs and events implemented and facilitated;
highlight diversity initiatives and proactive efforts to improve the campus climate;
reflect upon the teaching about diversity inside and outside of the classroom;
demonstrate positive impact and outcomes;
show affects in the UW-L community, on-campus and in the La Crosse and neighboring communities;
describe the spectrum of populations impacted and respective effects

Creative Writing Faculty Legacy Award For Prose Or Poetry

Ctr. For Latin American And Caribbean Studies Foreign Language And Area Studies Fellowship (Flas) Fall/Spring
This federally-funded fellowship is awarded to undergraduate students of any major studying Portuguese at UWM or abroad during the academic year. Students must be ready to enroll in third semester Portuguese or higher by the Fall semester of the year they receive the fellowship. They must be a full-time student during the fellowship period and be enrolled in a Portuguese language course and a Latin American/Caribbean area studies course each semester of the fellowship.
Other eligibility requirements include:
U.S. citizenship or permanent residency
a completed FAFSA on file with Financial Aid
a demonstrated record of academic success
The fellowship is valued at up to $15,000 for study at UWM or abroad at an approved overseas program. Up to $5,000 for tuition and a $2,500 stipend is allocated to the recipient each semester of the fellowship. Studying abroad is not required. For those choosing to study abroad, all study abroad programs must be approved by the U.S. Department of Education and students will need to apply for their study abroad program through the Study Abroad Office at UWM.
Applications are accepted each year in January for the following school year. For example, applications will be accepted in January 2023 for the 2023-24 school year. Students must complete the FAFSA and can do that even before applying for FLAS. It is recommended that students complete their FAFSA by Dec. 31 each year.
Questions regarding the fellowship or the application process should be directed to Aimee Orndorf, aorndorf@uwm.edu. It is recommended to meet with Aimee prior to submitting your application. Funding for this fellowship is contingent on the U.S. Department of Education Title VI Higher Education Act. more...

Culinary Arts Endowed Scholarship

Customer Analytics [Ca Cares] Associate Nursing Degree Scholarship

While this scholarship is open to all students in the Associated Nursing Degree program, preference to be considered for single parents, people from underrepresented groups and students who have viable experience working in a health-related field. more...

Customer Analytics [Ca Cares] Early Childhood Education Ad Scholarship
This scholarship was established to support an individual who will devote themselves to best practices in teaching and learning during a crucial time of a child’s development. Donor’s commitment is to ease the financial strain potentially prohibiting the perfect person from achieving this goal. Applicant must be enrolled in or enrolling in the Early Childhood Education AD program. Applicants should possess the ability to cultivate relationships with diverse groups of children, families, and their communities. more...

Customer Analytics [Ca Cares] Women Of Color In I.T. Scholarship
This scholarship was established to help bridge a racial and gender gap within the information technology areas of study. Donor’s commitment is to ease the financial strain potentially prohibiting the right person from attaining their goals. Applicant must be enrolled in the I.T. program, or the school which it resides, ASET [Applied Science, Engineering and Technology]. Qualified candidate should be a female student of color [primary preference; secondary preference to female student within underrepresented groups], burdened by the cost of this education on their own and is motived to learn and grow in an ever-evolving career. Donor believes this scholarship will find the perfect star that is just waiting to shine. more...

Cynthia Tierney Endowed Scholarship
Cindy’s vision included financial assistance for students who otherwise could not afford nursing education. She developed her vision based on her own education and work in a range of healthcare positions. Cindy was an alumna of Madison College’s Practical and Associate Degree Nursing programs. She completed her Bachelor and Master of Science in Nursing degrees at Viterbo College. Her career included positions as a nurse at Divine Savior Hospital, Portage and as a member of the Portage Area Emergency Medical Services staff. She taught EMT courses at Madison College-Reedsburg and was an officer in the Army Reserve Nurse Corps, stationed in Nuremberg, Germany during Operation Desert Storm. Cindy’s approach to learning emphasized critical thinking while making the process enjoyable. She looked forward to sharing her experiences and knowledge with students seeking to become the next generation of skilled nursing professionals when she was scheduled to take a nursing faculty position at Madison College Reedsburg just prior to her cancer diagnosis in summer 2004. She passed away November 3, 2004. Cindy is survived by her husband, Bill and two children, Adam and Elizabeth, along with many other family members and friends. To fulfill Cindy’s vision, Bill established the Cynthia Tierney Endowed Nursing Scholarship to help student nurses complete their training at Madison College-Reedsburg. Columbia County resident preferred. Donor: Bill Tierney more...

D. Paul Moberg Memorial Scholarship
The Horizon High School Board of Directors established a named scholarship for D. Paul Moberg at the Madison College Foundation. The scholarship will honor Paul’s legacy and many years of work at Horizon High School and recovery schools in general. This scholarship will be for graduates of Horizon High School who want to seek higher education. Madison College offers many career options and transfer possibilities. This fund will provide an important funding source for Horizon High School students far into the future.
Thank you note: Nancy Meyer & John Fournelle more...

D. Wetzel Nursing Scholarship
The family of Dave Wetzel is establishing the D. Wetzel Nursing Scholarship Fund in his memory to honor the nurses in his family, especially his wife Donna, and to honor his caregivers at the long-term care facilities in which he lived.
Dave had Parkinson’s Disease and was fortunate to be able to remain at home for many years due in large part to the care that Donna provided. After moving to an assisted living facility, Dave continued to receive excellent care from the staff there.
This scholarship is preferably for individuals who work in long-term care facilities (or intend to work in a long-term care facility) and are pursuing nursing degrees. more...

Dale R. Hoege Memorial Scholarship
Dale Hoege was a natural car guy. When his only son was born, Tim Hoege, he couldn’t wait to share his passion for cars. Tim received both his Automotive Technology degree and his 2-year Auto Collision and Refinishing diploma from Madison College. Dale passed away before he saw Tim carry on his passion for cars as a full time instructor in Auto Collision and Refinishing at Madison College. This schoalrship is in memory of Dale Hoege so that others can pursue their passion for cars. Applicant must be entering second year of the Automotive Collision/Repair program. Must be a continuing, full-time student with a grade point average of 2.0 or higher. Donor/TY: Timothy & Jennifer Hoege more...

Dan Smyczek Political Science/Public Administration Scholarship
1. Recipient must be a junior or senior
2. Recipient must have a major in political science or public administration

Daron James Williams, M.D. Memorial Scholarship In Pre-Medical Studies Fund (Csh)
This scholarship will be awarded to a senior who will be enrolled full-time for the following academic year OR to a graduating senior who meets the following criteria:
Senior
*Recipient must be full time at UW-L and enrolled in the pre-medical curriculum.
*Recipient must be a senior within one year of graduation and has completed or scheduled to take the MCAT exam (provide date and location of exam).
In addition, students are encouraged to take the Kaplan MCAT test preparation course. Applicant must provide information on their intent to enroll in the Kaplan course.
*Recipient must have a GPA of at least 3.75.
*Recipient must provide a personal statement discussing why he/she is pursuing a career in medicine.
*Must provide the names of three faculty for reference who will be asked to complete a survey rating applicantâ€™s potential for success, character, compassion, and suitability for a career in medicine and patient care.
OR
Graduating Senior
*Recipient must be a graduating senior and has applied to or has been accepted to medical school for the upcoming academic year
*Recipient must have earned a cumulative GPA of at least 3.75
*Recipient must provide a personal statement discussing why he/she is pursuing a career in medicine
*Recipient must provide the names of three faculty for reference who will be asked to complete a survey rating applicantâ€™s potential for success, character, compassion, and suitability for a career in medicine and patient care. more...

Dave Edwards Scholarship
The Dave Edwards Scholarship is funded by generous gifts from friends and family of Dave Edwards at the time of his retirement. Dave was the long-time director of WUWM public radio.
The scholarship is given to a journalism major with demonstrated financial need, full-time status, a minimum cumulative GPA of 3.0, and who is a first generation student. Preference is given to students with career aspirations in radio or broadcast journalism.
Applications are typically accepted in spring each year between February and April. Awards given in spring are for the following school year so students graduating that same spring or summer are not eligible. E.G. applications reviewed in Spring 2022 are for Fall 2022; students graduating in May or August 2022 are not eligible. more...

David "Big Dave" Hendrix Memorial Scholarship
This fund was created to honor the life of David “Big Dave’’ Hendrix Jr. "Big Dave’’ who departed this earthly life “way too soon” on September 10, 2022. "Big Dave’’ loved all that Madison College stood for, students, colleagues, their families and community were to David, simply put “family”. David had many roles at Madison College, over his 25+ years of service, Custodian, Culinary, Grounds Keeper and “Duck Man” but his favorite role of all, was playing Santa with his beautiful fiancé Pia Kinney James, by his side playing Mrs. Clause. Volunteering to serve as Madison College’s Santa, putting big smiles on children and their families’ faces, especially children of color being able to see that Santa could look like them. Giving back to the entire Madison College Community in this way, made David so incredibly proud. "Big Dave’s mission in life was to bring light and love to everyone he encountered on and off the job, through “a smile.” It meant so much to him, that he even authored a poem. David’s family, fiancé Pia, God Daughter Jessica, Sister Connie/siblings, and good friend Rhoda have established this scholarship to honor Big Dave’s legacy at Madison College to pay it forward for a person of color. This is David’s Legacy, although he is no longer here this scholarship will replace his smile by putting a smile on the recipients face along with their families, to lessen the financial hardships of returning to school. more...

David & Adele Crary Family Scholarship Fund
The Donor realizes the value of education is a step up in the world. In gratitude the Donor would like to pay it forward. more...

David And Leta Williams Scholarship
This scholarship honors the memory of the parents, Dr. David L. Williams and Mrs. Leta B. Williams, of Fredric and Joyce Williams, and to assist deserving students to attain their goal as healthcare professionals. Dr. Williams was a graduate of the UW Madison Medical School who practiced in Madison for over 50 years and served as team physician to West High and Madison College Athletic teams for a combined 30 years. Leta Williams received her RN from Methodist-Koehler School of Nursing in 1925. Applicant must be a full or part-time student with a GPA of 2.5 or higher enrolled in one of the following programs: AD Nursing, Dental Hygiene, Dietetic Tech, Medical Assistant, Medical Coding, Occupational Therapy, or Physical Therapy Assistant. Donors: Fred & Joyce Williams more...

David M. Dwyer Memorial Scholarship
The David M. Dwyer Memorial Scholarship is being set up by his family and friends to honor David’s legacy of giving. Our wish is to aid others as he did with the many skill sets he used to help those in need. After working for American Family Insurance for 30 years David undertook small home repair for the elderly, infirmed or disadvantaged through Saint Dennis Parish where he and his wife Mary were active members for over 40 years. The numerous recipients were amazed how he resolved their various issues with a few parts and time. Always handy, he fine tuned his skills in light plumbing, carpentry and electrical. Over the years he repaired countless faucets and installed several water heaters, toilets, screen doors, safety bars and any number of other projects. He also met with professionals to ensure his clients were getting the most cost effective repair or replacement. Many of his clients were on a fixed income so payment was just a thank you, a hug or a dinner as he would typically only charge for parts. He would often share the details about the latest project and the various challenges they presented and we loved to hear about them. David was always positive, quick to laugh and loved by all who knew him. As he was so dear to us and his skills were a gift to so many, we wish to continue his generosity by assisting students interested in pursuing education in these valuable trades and hope they find them as rewarding as he did. more...

David Peterson Scholarship Fund (General)
1. Recipient must be enrolled full time at UW-La Crosse.
2. Recipient must be in good academic standing grade point average above 2.8

6. Statement of Financial Need must be submitted with application
7. One $1000 award should be made annually more...

David R. Barnes Scholarship
This scholarship was established in honor of David R. Barnes. Dave was pursuing a teaching degree at UW Oshkosh when he died unexpectedly from cancer treatment in 2007. With a passion for literature and creative writing, he dreamed of being the next Shakespeare. After realizing he probably wouldn’t achieve that dream, he set out to share his gift through teaching. Applicant must be a full-time undergraduate enrolled at the Oshkosh campus. Applicant must be in good standing and must have been admitted, or have applied for fall admission, to the Teacher Education Program. Applicant must be majoring in secondary English education and must have a minimum 3.0 GPA. Applicant must have financial need based on the FAFSA. This award will be paid out in Fall 2022. more...

Dawn Kreft Lund Nursing Endowed Scholarship
This scholarship was established to honor Dawn Kreft Lund, a 1964 Madison College graduate from the Licensed Practical Nursing (LPN) program. It is available to continuing, full-time nursing students with a GPA of 3.0 or higher. Preference to students who have a family supporting children. Donor/Thank You Letter: Daryl & Dawn Lund
Ms. Lund was active in the profession as an LPN until her retirement in 1987. Her primary professional positions were in pediatric and geriatric nursing at Quisling and Jackson Clinics and private duty nursing in Madison. This is an opportunity to pay back the profession which allowed her to succeed and to pay forward to a student going in this profession of service. more...

Delta Dental Of Wisconsin Foundation Diversity & Inclusion Scholarship
The Delta Dental of Wisconsin Foundation Diversity & Inclusion Scholarship focuses on broadening the number of traditionally underrepresented groups in the dental hygiene field.
• Student enrolled in the dental hygiene field with a minimum of 10 credits
• Minimum 3.0 GPA
• Second year program students
• Resident of Wisconsin
• Preference will be given to applicants who are members of groups currently underrepresented in dental hygiene programs, including African American, Hispanic, Hmong, and Native American.
• Preference will be given to applicants who are first-generation college students, or displaced workers making a career change.
Thank you letter: Ann Boson, Delta Dental of Wisconsin more...

freshman who has been accepted for admissions to UW-L no later than April of the calendar year in which he/she shall enter the institution to be enrolled full time
enrolled for the fall semester in a mathematics course at or above the level of calculus
above average grade point average
show promise in mathematics and have demonstrated an interest and talent in mathematics by: (a) scoring in the top 250 students in Wisconsin on the American High School Mathematics Examination (AHSME) or scoring among the top 2% of students taking the MAA Wisconsin Section Exam; or (b) scoring 4 or better on the College Board Advanced Placement Calculus Exam or earning college credit with a final grade higher than B in a college mathematics course at or above the level of Calculus; or © ACT score 28 or higher on the mathematics portion more...

Diane R. Cholewinski Memorial Nursing Scholarship
This scholarship was established in memory of a loving wife, mother, and foster parent to more than two dozen infants, including one newborn who became her special needs adopted son. Applicant must be an undergraduate enrolled at the Oshkosh campus. Applicant must be admitted to the College of Nursing’s traditional BSN or accelerated BSN program. Applicant must be a Wisconsin resident and must have a minimum 3.5 cumulative GPA. Applicant must have an interest in pediatrics/special needs or have life experience with the pediatric/special needs population. Preference will be given to single parents with financial need as demonstrated by a statement. This award will be paid out in Fall 2022. more...

Diane Strassman Hospitality Scholarship
Diane Strassman, mother of Lynea LaVoy, faculty at Madison College since 2014, was described by many of her friends and family as the most hospitable person they ever knew. She created experiences and memories for people by always treating them with respect, giving them her full and undivided attention, and looking for small but meaningful ways to create memories for others.
Diane passed away from ALS at the age of 60 in 2013. She cared greatly for the work that her daughter Lynea wanted to do to provide opportunities for others, particularly for students. Thus, their scholarship is designed to encourage talented students to pursue degrees in hospitality and tourism. Eligible students will be those who are enrolled for a minimum of 12 credits in the semester in which the award is made and who have earned a minimum of 6 credits at Madison College. Selection is based upon grade point average, financial need as evidence by the FAFSA form and the intent to major in hospitality as described above. Donor/TY: Dr. Lynea LaVoy more...

Dick Goldberg Scholarship
Dick is establishing a named scholarship fund to support Madison College students because he recognizes that a gift of $1,000 could have an immediate positive impact on our students and could be transformative. He has compassion for ex-offenders trying to turn their lives around. The scholarships should be directed to offender/ex-offender students whether they are taking classes while incarcerated or once they return to society. If offenders or ex-offenders cannot be identified or have received other scholarships, Dick’s scholarship awards may be given to students of any race or gender with proven financial need. more...

Division Of Student Affairs/ Multicultural Student Scholarship For Incoming Freshmen
New freshmen award, renewable for up to three years as long as the student remains in good academic standing which is considered to be a 2.0 Grade Point Average.
•admitted Multicultural student (African-American, American Indian or Alaskan Native, Hispanic/Latino/a American, Southeast Asian)
•high school class rank in the top 15 percent
•demonstrated leadership and/or involvement in high school or community (athletic activities can’t be considered)
•for the scholarship to be renewed, recipient will have to demonstrate leadership and/or involvement in college extracurricular activities (recipient will be asked to complete a status update with a staff member in Multicultural Student Services)
•financial need will be considered when awarding scholarships; priority will be given to candidates admitted to UW-L with FAFSA forms on file by March 15; applicants admitted after March 15 will be considered if awards are still available more...

Don P. Burdick Memorial Scholarship
This scholarship was established in 2014 by Don’s friends, family, colleagues, and former students. Don was a passionate theatre professor and director at UW Oshkosh, working at the University for 36 years before retiring in 1998. This scholarship is intended to encourage life-long participation and love of theatre, providing financial support for students whose personal and professional qualities mirror the commitment and passion for the performing arts that Don embodied. Applicant must be a full-time undergraduate enrolled at the Oshkosh campus. Applicant must have a minimum 3.0 cumulative GPA in their major and a minimum of 45 credits completed. First preference will be given to students with a theatre major or minor. However, others are encouraged to apply. Applicant must demonstrate involvement in UW Oshkosh theatre productions. Financial need may be considered, but will not be the deciding factor. Previous recipients are eligible to reapply for the award. However, a student may only received the award a total of two times. This award will be paid out in Fall 2022. more...

Don Walker Memorial Scholarship
The Don Walker Memorial Scholarship is funded by generous gifts from the Milwaukee Press Club which includes many former colleagues of Don. This scholarship honors the legacy of Donald L. Walker, an alumnus of Marquette University and the University of Wisconsin-Milwaukee. He was an editor and reporter for the Milwaukee Journal and Milwaukee Journal Sentinel and a founding member of the Milwaukee Newspaper Guild.
The scholarship is given to a JAMS major on the journalism track, with demonstrated financial need, full-time status, and a minimum cumulative GPA of 3.0.
Applications are typically accepted in spring each year between February and April. Awards given in spring are for the following school year so students graduating that same spring or summer are not eligible. E.G. applications reviewed in Spring 2022 are for Fall 2022; students graduating in May or August 2022 are not eligible. more...

Donald G. And Dorothy Wing Pratt Scholarship
The Donald G. and Dorothy Wing Pratt Scholarship is open to entering freshmen at the University of Wisconsin, Eau Claire. You must be graduating from North High School of Eau Claire, Wisconsin and demonstrate high academic standing to be eligible for the award. more...

Donald P. Weber Veterans Scholarship Of The La Crosse Community Foundation
1. Recipient must be a Veteran or a member of the National Guard enrolled at UWL
2. Recipient must be enrolled full time or part-time (at least 6 credits) enrolled
3. Recipient must have a cumulative GPA of 2.5
4. Applicant must submit a copy of DD214
If there should be no Veterans or National Guard members that meet the criteria then a spouse of a Veteran can be considered
This scholarship is renewable for up to four years. The recipient must re-apply and maintain the credit and GPA requirement to receive the award in subsequent years. The scholarship is divided between the spring and fall semesters. more...

Donald R. Shea Scholarship In Latin American Studies
The Center for Latin American and Caribbean Studies at the University of Wisconsin-Milwaukee offers a limited number of scholarships in the amount of $250-$500 for undergraduates (sophomores and above) with a demonstrated interest in Latin American and/or Caribbean studies.
The scholarship may be used for UWM sponsored semester-long, year-long, or short-term (Winter, Summer) study abroad programs in Latin American or the Caribbean, or for other academic opportunities in the region that can be accepted for UWM credit. Students from any major or field of study are invited to apply. Virtual study abroad/internships are also acceptable. Please contact Aimee Orndorf, aorndorf@uwm.edu with any questions, or visit uwm.edu/clacs/funding/undergraduate-student-funding/shea-scholarship/ for more information.
Other criteria include:
3.0 GPA or higher and in good academic standing
Demonstrated academic interest in Latin American and/or Caribbean studies shown through coursework/extra curricular activities
Preference will be given to students who have not received this scholarship previously
*If doing virtual study abroad: must enroll in at least 2 courses through a Latin American/Caribbean Institution
The opportunity must occur between May 2022-December 2022 more...

Dorothy Wetterlin Scholarship For Expand
1. Student enrolled and participating in the UWL EXPAND program
2. Professionalism – demonstrates initiative, punctual and dependable, professional dress per syllabus, accepts feedback, engages in self-assessment.
3. Accountability- identifies acknowledges and accepts responsibility for actions, remedies errors in a timely manner, effective use of time, and resources.
4. Critical Thinking – utilizes problem-solving prior to asking, evidence-based practice, uses the ICF model to establish PT diagnosis/ plan of care.
5. Communication – professional and timely verbal and nonverbal communication, respectful, nonverbal communication consistent with the message, adjusts communication appropriate to the situation.
6. Documentation – written assignments completed per rubric in a timely manner, written assignments are completed without grammatical error, written assignments consist of terminology that is professionally and technically correct
Graduate students who are currently enrolled in the DPT program and who are eligible for this scholarship will be auto-matched to this award based on successful completion of general application and DPT conditional application questions more...

Doug And Carla Salmon Foundation Scholarship
This scholarship is awarded to highly motivated and academically able undergraduates enrolled at the Oshkosh campus who have a demonstrated need for financial assistance. Applicant must have completed at least one semester at UW Oshkosh. Applicant must have filed the FAFSA (international students and those not eligible to file the FAFSA are exempt from this requirement). Applicant must be pursuing a degree that leads to a clear, direct career path with a self-sufficient wage upon graduation (not requiring an advanced degree). Preferred majors include nursing, education, business (particularly accounting), or medical technology. Applicant must have a minimum 2.0 GPA.
Preference will be given to single parents, international students, first-generation college students, older students, and those who are overcoming significant financial, social, emotional, or physical barriers to success.
Finalists will be required to interview with a Salmon Foundation staff member before recipients will be determined. Students with a family or employment relationship with any member of the Doug and Carla Salmon Foundation board, staff or scholarship selection committee are not eligible. This award will be paid out in Fall 2021.
Based upon student performance, financial need, and availability of funding, recipients may be eligible to have this award renewed for additional semesters beyond the initial award. more...

Doug Redsten Memorial Endowed Scholarship
This fund was established by friends and family members in memory of Doug who left his mark on Madison Area Technical Colleges as a math instructor, basketball and golf coach, athletics administrator, alumni & Foundation executive director and friend. During a career that spanned 1965-1995, Doug affected the lives of thousands of students, colleagues and community members. Full or part-time students may apply. Must have a 3.0 GPA or higher. Donor/Thank You Letter: Dianne Redsten more...

Douglas And Shirley Bickley Memorial
Doug Bickley founded Commuter Bus in Stoughton to provide convenient transportation for workers commuting between Madison and points South. The bus service operated between 1965 and 1984. Beginning in 1985, Doug and Shirley operated Stoughton Cab Service which they continued through 1997. A gifted mechanic, Doug also operated a television repair business and a dairy farm. This scholarship was established as a tribute to Doug by Shirley, his wife and partner of 57 years. It is preferred that the recipient be a graduate of Stoughton High School or a resident of Stoughton. Must be a continuing Automotive Collision Repair/Refinish, Automotive Technician/Technology, Diesel & Heavy Equipment or Welding student with a GPA of 2.0 or higher. Donors/TY: Foundation Board President more...

Douglas C. Jirovetz Scholarship
This scholarship was established by alumnus Douglas Jirovetz, who worked at UW Oshkosh for over 29 years. Applicant must be a full-time undergraduate enrolled at the Oshkosh campus. Applicant must be a degree-seeking student. Applicant must have at least 30 credits completed by the end of the Fall 2021 semester. Applicant must have a minimum cumulative 3.0 GPA. Applicant must have financial need based on the FAFSA. This award will be paid out in Fall 2022. more...

Dr. Donna Decker Scholarship For English Department
The Dr. Donna Decker scholarship was established in 2017 by the family and friends of Dr. Donna Decker, a former instructor in the Journalism, Advertising and Media Studies (JAMS) Department who passed away at a young age. Donna was known as a passionate and engaging teacher with a bright spirit. She obtained her PhD in British Literature in the midst of her original cancer diagnosis and went on to teach at both Marquette University and UWM. Dr. Decker’s love of literature and journalism is reflected in this joint scholarship which is given to one English major and one Journalism major each year
Eligible students will be full-time students with junior or senior standing and a declared major in either English or journalism. The selected student will have demonstrated exceptional academic achievement with a minimum cumulative GPA of 3.5.
For optimal consideration, students should fill out these parts of the general scholarship application and make sure the most recent transcript is uploaded:
Co-curricular Activities
Community Service and Volunteer Work
Work Experience
Academic and Career Goals
You may edit your general application at any time prior to the deadline for the Dr. Donna Decker Scholarship. more...

Dr. Donna Decker Scholarship For Jams Department
The Dr. Donna Decker scholarship was established in 2017 by the family and friends of Dr. Donna Decker, a former instructor in the Journalism, Advertising and Media Studies (JAMS) Department who passed away at a young age. Donna was known as a passionate and engaging teacher with a bright spirit. She obtained her PhD in British Literature in the midst of her original cancer diagnosis and went on to teach at both Marquette University and UWM. Dr. Decker’s love of literature and journalism is reflected in this joint scholarship which is given to one English major and one JAMS major each year
Eligible students will be full-time students with junior or senior standing and a declared major in either English or JAMS. The selected student will have demonstrated exceptional academic achievement.
Students who have an up-to-date Panther Scholarship Portal General Application and the College of Letters & Science Scholarships and Awards Application will be considered, typically in spring each year between February and April. No additional or separate application is required; students should thoroughly fill out the Panther Scholarship Portal General Application and the College of Letters & Science Scholarships and Awards Application. Awards given in spring are for the following school year so students graduating that same spring or summer are not eligible. E.G. applications reviewed in Spring 2022 are for Fall 2022; students graduating in May or August 2022 are not eligible. more...

Kelbert. Applicant must be a full-time undergraduate enrolled at the Oshkosh campus. Applicant must have been admitted, or have applied for fall admission, to the Teacher Education Program and must have a declared elementary education major. Applicant must plan to student teach during the 2022-2023 academic year. Applicant must have financial need based on the FAFSA. Strong preference will be given to non-traditional (aged 25+) students and to students who are pursuing licensure for Middle Childhood through Early Adolescence (grades 1-8). However, others are encouraged to apply. This award will be split evenly between the Fall 2022 and Spring 2023 semesters. If the recipient is graduating in the fall semester, they are eligible to receive the full award amount in Fall 2022. more...

Dr. Joan L. Simmons Scholarship
This scholarship was established by Dr. James Simmons in memory of his wife, Dr. Joan Simmons, a tenured associate professor and former chair of the Department of Literacy and Language at UW Oshkosh. Dr. Simmons established this scholarship so Joan’s memory lives on through other teachers. Applicant must be a candidate or current graduate student in a licensure, certificate, or master’s degree program within the Literacy and Language Department at the Oshkosh campus. Applicant must be registered to, and in good standing within, the Literacy and Language graduate program. Applicant must have a minimum 3.5 GPA and must have at least 2-3 years experience teaching at the middle or secondary level or as a K-12 discipline specialist (art, music or physical education). Extracurricular (excluding athletics) or community activities, as well as demonstration of financial need based on an essay, will be taken into consideration, but will not be the dominant criteria in the selection process. This award will be paid out in Fall 2022. more...

Dr. Joy & Dr. Blair Mcmillan Science Scholarship
Joy and Blair were both known as innovators and science faculty members at Madison College for many years. Joy founded the nationally recognized biotechnology program in 1987. Blair was a biology instructor and faculty leader as well as UW Madison adjunct faculty member. Thus, their scholarship is designed to encourage talented students to pursue degrees in non-health related science disciplines such as biology, biotechnology, biochemistry, chemistry, engineering and zoology as a few examples. Eligible students will be those who are enrolled for a minimum of 12 credits in the semester in which the award is made and who have earned a minimum of 6 credits at Madison College. Selection is based upon grade point average, financial need as evidence by the FAFSA form and the intent to major in science as described above. This scholarship is intended to assist students in the college transfer program seeking to complete an undergraduate degree in natural sciences and/or engineering. Donor/TY: Dr. Joy & Dr. Blair McMillan more...

Dr. Kay Heggestad Of Wildwood Family Clinic Scholarship
From the Donor: Kay A. Heggestad, MD was a tough and determined gal. She began medical school in 1966 when it was tougher for women to get into medical school, but she worked hard and succeeded. Once she made up her mind, you had better not get in her way. Family Practice/Medicine became a specialty in 1969 and Kay was the first woman to graduate from the University of Wisconsin Family Medicine residency in 1975. Kay was the first Family Medicine woman to deliver babies in Madison, though there was a female Obstetrician, who delivered Kay in 1944. Kay was one of the founders of Wildwood Family Clinic, along with her husband Paul Wertsch, MD in 1978.
Kay was a strong supporter of the Medical Assistant Program at Madison College. She was a medical advisor for the program and enjoyed doing some teaching. She worked in a team with her Certified Medical Assistants at Wildwood Clinic to provide the best possible care to her patients. more...

Dr. M.A. Rouf Microbiology Scholarship
This scholarship was established in 2020 by Dr. Mohammed A. Rouf, UW Oshkosh faculty emeritus in microbiology, to help financially assist students in a field in which he dedicated his life. Applicant must be a full-time undergraduate student enrolled at the Oshkosh campus. Applicant must be majoring in microbiology within the College of Letters & Science. Applicant must have financial need based on a statement. Applicant must have a minimum cumulative 3.0 GPA and must have senior standing by the time the award is paid out. This award will be split evenly between the Fall 2022 and Spring 2023 semesters. If the recipient is not enrolled in the spring semester, the second installment will be forfeited. more...

Dr. Madhu N. Mahadeva Memorial Scholarship
This scholarship was established in memory of Dr. Madhu N. Mahadeva, professor of biology at UW Oshkosh from 1968 to 1991. The scholarship is intended for a high-achieving female with a high grade-point average in her chosen science major of mathematics, biology, microbiology, chemistry, or physics/astronomy. Applicant must be a full-time undergraduate enrolled at the Oshkosh campus, with a commitment to a career requiring rigorous education in the sciences. Preference will be given to applicants with an interest in pursuing advanced study, research, or leadership roles in areas in which women are traditionally underrepresented. Applicant must have between 54 and 80 credits and must have earned a minimum 3.5 cumulative GPA in their major. Financial need based on an essay may be considered only to differentiate candidates who meet all other criteria. This award will be paid out in Fall 2021. more...

Dr. Robert Ritzenthaler Memorial Museum Studies Scholarships
The Department of Anthropology periodically awards scholarships to Anthropology graduate students who will be in their second year of the Museum Studies Graduate Certificate Program. The scholarships are intended to partially support students’ research (e.g., travel expenses, supplies/equipment, conference fees).
Students are considered typically in spring each year between March and May. Awards given in spring are for the following school year so students graduating that same spring or summer are not eligible. E.G. applications reviewed in Spring 2022 are for Fall 2022; students graduating in May or August 2022 are not eligible. more...

Dr. Robert Ritzenthaler Memorial Research Internship In Anthropology
Anthropology graduate students who are currently enrolled in (or recently completed the requirements for) the Museum Studies Graduate Certificate Program at UWM are eligible to apply for this $1,750 scholarship, which provides financial support so that the student can complete an internship at the Milwaukee Public Museum during Summer 2022.
The internship depends on project and supervisor availability and may require previous experience and/or classes. The intern will be required to commit at least 150 hours of internship work during the semester. The student may apply for credit for the internship, if desirable. more...

It is awarded to a junior or senior who is committed to a career as a health care professional and who will be continuing their education at a professional or medical school. Applicant must be a full-time undergraduate student enrolled at the Oshkosh campus. Applicant must have one of the following pre-professional programs declared on their student record: PP-Medicine, PP-Dentistry, PP-Optometry, PP-Occupational Therapy, PP-Physical Therapy, PP-Physician’s Assistant, or a related pre-professional program. Applicant must have a minimum 3.0 cumulative GPA. Previous recipients are not eligible to apply for the award in subsequent years. Selection will be primarily based on the applicant’s promise and potential to succeed in their anticipated career in healthcare. This award will be paid out in Fall 2022. more...

Durward C. Layde Memorial Scholarship

Dzigbodi Akyea Memorial Scholarship
Dzigbodi Akyea worked at Madison College for 17 years and was a cherished member of the Academic Advising Team. Dzigbodi was a long-time friend, ally, colleague and an individual with countless talents and gifts. She was a gentle person, but with the strength of many. She was the calming presence, the nucleus of the team, and had the uncanny ability to be firm while also being tender and supportive in the same breath. Dzigbodi worked and advocated tirelessly for our students; serving as their voice when they could not find their own. Donations made in her name will be dedicated to black student(s) pursuing a Liberal Arts program at Madison College either with the intent of graduating or transferring to a 4-year school for a bachelor’s degree. more...

E. Garner Horton Memorial Scholarship
This scholarship was established in memory of E. Garner Horton, member of the UW Oshkosh administration and faculty from 1963 to 1983. Applicant must be a full-time undergraduate student enrolled at the Oshkosh campus. Applicant must be a public relations major or journalism major in the advertising-public relations emphasis, with a strong interest in becoming a public relations practitioner. Applicant must have a minimum 3.0 cumulative GPA and must have at least sophomore standing. Applicant must exhibit an understanding of and a commitment to the professional standards that are expected of PR practitioners. This award will be paid out in Fall 2022. more...

E. Garner Horton Memorial Scholarship
Scholarship for juniors or seniors attending the University of Wisconsin-Oshkosh who are majoring in Journalism with an emphasis in advertising-public relations. Applicants must have a minimum 3.0 GPA. Due date and number of awards may vary. Nonrenewable. more...

E. Paul And Jane Humke International Mathematics Scholarship
The E. Paul and Jane Humke International Mathematics Scholarship is given to a student for participation in the study abroad program in mathematics in Budapest, Hungary. More information about the study abroad semester can be found at: https://budapestsemesters.com/apply-2/. The study abroad experience can take place in Spring 2022, Summer 2022 or Fall 2022 prior to graduation from UWM. Eligible students will be math majors with at least sophomore standing and a strong record of academic success. Students should have completed one semester of real analysis or abstract algebra prior to going abroad in order to successfully complete the coursework in Budapest. The student offered the scholarship must still apply and be accepted to the Budapest program in order to receive the scholarship. Questions about the scholarship can be directed to Prof. Gabriella Pinter (gapinter@uwm.edu). more...

E. Peggy Bergomi Nursing Education Scholarship
Scholarship for college sophomore students enrolled in the Associate Degree Technical Nursing Program at Fox Valley Technical College. Students must have a minimum 3.0 GPA and demonstrate financial need. Due date and number of awards may vary. Contact the colleges financial aid office or the Foundation for more information and/or application. more...

at least a 3.0 gpa
preferably having primary emphasis in coaching and/or sports administration more...

Earl Landphier Memorial Scholarship
Applicants must be full-time, continuing Automotive Collision Repair/Refinish, Automotive Technician/Technology, Diesel & Heavy Equipment or Diesel Equipment Technology students with a GPA of 2.0 or higher.
Donor: Madison College Foundation Board President more...

Ed & Lu Bardill Memorial Scholarship In Photography (Sac)
sophomore, junior or senior to be enrolled full time with a minor in photography
at least a 3.0 in photography
minimum of 9 credits earned in photography courses
financial need may be considered

even-numbered years the recipient shall be a male and in odd-numbered years recipient shall be a female more...

Ed And Amy Greve Library Science Scholarship
The Ed and Amy Greve Library Science Scholarship is available to students majoring or minoring in library science at the University of Wisconsin, Superior. A minimum 3.0 GPA is required. Students who have completed their baccalaureate degree with a teaching certificate and are seeking to enhance their credentials by working toward library media certification in either Wisconsin or Minnesota will also be considered. more...

Ed Karrels Continuing Music Performance Scholarship
This scholarship was established by alumnus Ed Karrels ’97. Applicant must be a full-time undergraduate enrolled at or accepted for admission for Summer 2022 or Fall 2022 at UW Oshkosh. Applicant must be majoring in a discipline other than music (music minors are eligible). Applicant must have a keen interest in music and must have realistic and identifiable goals for their time at UW Oshkosh and after graduation. Applicant must be an instrumental musician who is accepted into a department of music ensemble group and must take hour-long (two-credit) lessons each semester at the Oshkosh campus. First preference will be given to brass performers. Applicant must complete a music scholarship audition. For more information about the scholarship or auditioning, please contact Marty Robinson at robinsm@uwosh.edu.
This award will be split evenly between the Fall 2022 and Spring 2023 semesters. If the recipient is not enrolled in the spring semester, the second installment will be forfeited. The scholarship is renewable for an additional three years, provided the recipient maintains full-time enrollment, a minimum cumulative 3.0 GPA overall and in private lessons, and funding is available. Students enrolled at the Fox Cities or Fond du Lac campuses must transfer to the Oshkosh campus in order to receive the final two years of the award. Recipients are expected to send annual correspondence to the donor describing the impact of the award on their future career plans, their progress as a musician, and some of their favorite performances over the last year (include recordings if available). more...

Edgewood College Grant
The Edgewood College Grant is available to students at Edgewood College. You must demonstrate financial need to be eligible for this award. more...

Edith Cartwright Scholarship In Education (Soe Or Sah)
Junior to be enrolled full time in the School of Education with a declared major in elementary education, secondary education, or physical education
above average grade point average
financial need should be considered
involved in extracurricular activities on campus more...

Edith Ravenhill Dopp Memorial Endowed Scholarship
The purpose of this fund is to provide scholarships for students enrolled in business, auto and general courses. Financial need and evidence of positive performance in coursework and in life (as documented by grade point average and through scholarship essays) will be used to determine recipients. In 1947, the donor of this scholarship was one of 10,000,000 returning WWII veterans completely unprepared for civilian life. He found his way to Madison College and had the good fortune to become a student in Edith Dopp’s Commercial Law class. Ms. Dopp was an attorney social worker and chose to teach at Madison College. After the class was over, she took this student aside and told him he could and should further his education. Her encouragement boosted his confidence and he pursued a bachelor’s degree in business at the University of Wisconsin. Applicant must be a continuing Automotive Collision Repair/Refinish, Automotive Technician/Technology or Business Management Student. Donor: Anonymous more...

Edith Ravenhill Dopp Memorial Scholarship
Scholarship to financially assist deserving students enrolled full time in a 1 year diploma or a 2 year Associate Degree program in the Business Division with a GPA of 3.0 or higher. Must be a continuing student. more...

Edwin J. & Dorothy M. Hartman Scholarship
This scholarship is named after two individuals who, while unable to attend college themselves, supported and encouraged the education of all those in their lives. Applicant must be a full-time undergraduate enrolled at the Oshkosh campus. Applicant must have an interest in small business and/or family business. Applicant must have a commendable scholastic record (a minimum 2.5 cumulative GPA) and must be active in extracurricular activities (excluding athletics) or work. Applications are encouraged from female students and those coming from disadvantaged backgrounds. This award will be paid out in Fall 2022. more...

Edwin J. & Dorothy M. Hartman Scholarship
Scholarship for female undergraduate students attending the University of Wisconsin-Oshkosh who have the intent to start a small business or are involved in a family business. Applicants must have a minimum 2.5 GPA. Nonrenewable. more...

Eileen And Robert Rabson Scholarship Fund
The Eileen and Robert Robson Scholarship Fund has been established to help Madison College students with the greatest need who are studying in the health education fields. The Robson family has a rich history of working in fields that are in the medical field or support the advancement of medicine. more...

Eileen Hanselman Kuhlers Music Scholarship
This scholarship was established by alumna Eileen Hanselman Kuhlers ‘63. Applicant must be an incoming freshman admitted to the Oshkosh campus for Summer 2022 or Fall 2022. Applicant must have an intended major in music performance (vocal or instrumental) or music education. Students must complete an audition to be admitted into the music department, however, audition performance is not a factor in award selection. Applicant must have a minimum high school GPA of 2.0. The primary criteria for selection are the applicant’s promise and potential to pursue music studies at the post-secondary level and an inability to attend college without the assistance of this scholarship. Applicant must have financial need based on the FAFSA, but must only qualify for federal loans and may not be eligible for need-based grants. Recipient must be enrolled full-time in order to receive the award. This award will be split evenly between the Fall 2022 and Spring 2023 semesters. If the recipient is not enrolled in the spring semester or is no longer majoring in music performance or music education, the second installment will be forfeited. The award is renewable for an additional three years provided the recipient continues to meet all of the criteria and funding is available. more...

Eleanor Eddis And Theodore R. Fults Memorial Scholarship
The Eleanor Eddis and Theodore R. Fults Memorial Scholarship is open to undergraduate elementary education majors at the University of Wisconsin, Eau Claire. You must have completed at least one year of course work, and demonstrate significant academic quality and promise for the teaching profession. more...

good academic standing
must show interest in service to students, the alumni and the broader campus community more...

Eli Lilly And Company Academic Merit Award
The Eli Lilly and Company Academic Merit Award is available to students in the College of Agricultural and Life Sciences at the University of Wisconsin, Madison. You must be an undergraduate major in animal sciences to be eligible for this award. more...

Eliana Berg Award For Graduate Research
The Elaina Berg Award is given as part of the annual WGS Paper and Project competition and recognizes outstanding research by a graduate student on a topic related to women’s and gender studies. more...

Elizabeth A. Regan Scholarship
This scholarship was established by Elizabeth Bymers Regan, who taught nursing in the UW System for 23 years. Applicant must be enrolled at the Oshkosh campus and must be admitted, or have applied for spring admission, to the College of Nursing. Applicant must be enrolled or planning to enroll in one of the following areas (in decreasing order of priority: BSN completion program, MSN program (for students who have already earned a BSN degree), or traditional BSN program. Preference will be given to applicants demonstrating financial need based on the FAFSA. Preference will be given to students from Central, Northern, or Northeastern Wisconsin, with greater preference given to those from Northeast WI. This award will be split evenly between the Fall 2022 and Spring 2023 semesters. If the recipient is not enrolled in the spring semester, the second installment will be forfeited. more...

Elizabeth G. Morris English Scholarship
The Elizabeth G. Morris English Scholarship is open to senior English-teaching majors at the University of Wisconsin, Eau Claire. You must have a minimum 3.5 GPA to qualify for this award. Preference is given to students who have used their electives to achieve a degree of parity among courses in the English language, in composition, and in literature. Preference is also given to students pursuing careers as a middle school or secondary school English teacher. more...

Ellen Healy Award
Graduate students in the Department of History who have not received any other award (including a TA or RA-ship) are eligible to be reviewed for this award. The award honors the late Ellen Healy, an alumna and onetime teaching assistant in the Department.
If you are a new graduate student who has no established UWM grades yet, be sure to upload a copy of your final undergraduate transcript as part of your general application process.
Students who have an up-to-date Panther Scholarship Portal General Application and the College of Letters & Science Scholarships and Awards Application will be considered, typically in spring each year between February and April. No additional or separate application is required; students should thoroughly fill out the Panther Scholarship Portal General Application and the College of Letters & Science Scholarships and Awards Application. Awards given in spring are for the following school year so students graduating that same spring or summer are not eligible. E.G. applications reviewed in Spring 2022 are for Fall 2022; students graduating in May or August 2022 are not eligible. more...

Ellen M. Dudley (Straavaldsen) Endowed Memorial Scholarship
Ellen was grateful for the skills she acquired as a 1967 graduate of the commercial art program. She proceeded to accomplish success as a Fashion Illustrator, textbook illustrator, and retired a senior graphic designer at the UW Division of Information Technology. Her parents’ encouragement enabled her to enroll in this program and she wanted to help graphic design students pursue their goals. This memorial scholarship was established by the love of her life, her partner Terry Straavaldsen. more...

Elmer & Margaret Otte Scholarship
Scholarship for graduating high school seniors from Kaukauna High School planning to attend Lawrence University in Appleton, Wisconsin. Students must hav a minimum 3.0 GPA. Due date and number of awards may vary. Contact students guidance counselor or the Foundation for more information and/or application. more...

Elmer Leach Foundation Undergraduate Student Award
Applicant must be a full-time undergraduate enrolled in the traditional BSN program at the Oshkosh campus. Applicant must have at least sophomore standing and preference will be given to sophomore students. Applicant must have financial need based on the FAFSA and must have earned satisfactory grades in college work (not less than C average). Previous recipients are eligible to apply. However, a student may only receive the award a total of two times. This award will be paid out in Fall 2022. more...

Emil J. Frautschi Family Endowed Scholarship
Students eligible for this scholarship include: Continuing students who have earned 6 or more credits at Madison College and are enrolled full-time (12 or more credits per semester) or part-time enrollment (6-11 credits per semester) with a minimum grade point average of 3.5. Students enrolled in any technical program and students enrolled in French language courses are eligible to apply. Students participating in French language learning activities such as French Immersion in France, a credit-bearing study abroad program offered by the Madison College World Languages Department and the Center for International Education, will also be considered. Donor/Thank You Letter: Kip Frautschi more...

Enciso Lopez Scholarship
This scholarship was established in 2019 by Diana Enciso Lopez ’17 to financially assist highly motivated and academically able undergraduate students who are pursuing a business degree. Applicant must be enrolled full- or part-time at the Oshkosh campus. Application must be admitted, or have applied for spring admission, to the College of Business. Applicant must have a minimum 3.0 cumulative GPA and must have financial need based on a statement. Preference will be given to students falling into any of the following categories: DACA status, international student, first-generation college student, working parent, non-traditional student (age 25 or older), or veteran. Previous recipients are not eligible to apply. This award will be split evenly between the Fall 2022 and Spring 2023 semesters. If the recipient is graduating in the fall semester, they are eligible to receive the full award amount in Fall 2022. more...

Endowment For Music Excellence Award
This award is given to students admitted to or enrolled at UW Oshkosh. It is given for Fall 2022 and Spring 2023 at the discretion of the UW Oshkosh Music Department based on the students’ scholarship auditions; no application is required. Recipient must be either majoring in music or must be participating in a music ensemble during the semester in which the award is disbursed. For more information, please contact the UW Oshkosh Music Department at music@uwosh.edu. more...

Endres Manufacturing Company Foundation Endowed Scholarship

Engineering Technology Continuing Student Scholarship
Applicant must be a full-time undergraduate enrolled at the Oshkosh campus. Applicant must be a declared engineering technology major. Applicant must have at least 20 credits completed and must have a minimum 3.0 cumulative GPA. This award will be paid out in Fall 2022. more...

Engineering Technology Freshman Scholarship
This scholarship is awarded to incoming freshmen and transfer students admitted to the Oshkosh campus for Summer 2022 or Fall 2022. Applicants must be planning to major in Engineering Technology. Incoming freshmen must have an ACT score of 22 or higher (or SAT equivalent) or must have a minimum 3.2 high school GPA. Transfer students must have a minimum 3.0 transfer GPA. Recipient must enroll full-time in Fall 2022 in order to receive the award. more...

Engineering Technology Leader Scholarship
This scholarship is awarded to incoming freshmen admitted to the Oshkosh campus for Summer 2022 or Fall 2022. Applicant must have an intended major of engineering technology. Applicant must have a minimum 3.25 high school GPA and ACT score of at least 22 (or SAT equivalent). Preferred applicants will have a minimum 3.5 high school GPA and ACT score of at least 25 (or SAT equivalent). In order to be considered for the award, students must submit their General Application in Academic Works; no additional application is necessary. Awards will be given based on academic achievement, which may include the rigor of the applicant’s high school coursework. Recipient must enroll full-time in Fall 2022 in order to receive the award. more...

Environmental Internship Scholarship
The Environmental Internship Scholarship provides funding for a Conservation and Environmental Science major or minor to engage in a for-credit internship. Eligible students will have an internship related to environmental science or conservation lined up or in the process of being secured. The criteria are:
Plans for completion of a 3-credit internship at an organization with an environmental science or conservation mission
A declared Conservation and Environmental Science major or minor
Minimum 2.75 GPA

Preference will be given to students with demonstrated financial need as shown on the FAFSA
Applicants need to thoroughly complete the UWM general scholarship application including the activities and work experience being sure to include all information that you wish to share with the review committee about your activities related to conservation and environmental science. Applications are typically accepted during the spring semester. more...

Environmental Scholarship Program
• Be attending DePaul University, University of Illinois – Chicago, Illinois Institute of Technology, Northern Illinois University, North Central College, Northwestern University, Elmhurst University or other 4-year degree granting institution, in northern Illinois. [Applications from other institutions (SE WI or NW IN) may be considered as long as eligibility requirements are met]; full or part-time for the academic year.
• Be pursuing a career in the environmental field (or as described below) as an undergraduate upperclassman (Junior or Senior) or graduate student in an environmental- related degree or certificate program, including but not limited to:
o Hazardous materials technologies
o Environmental engineering
o Civil engineering with an environmental emphasis
o Physical/natural sciences with an environmental emphasis, i.e., chemistry, geology,
biology, etc.
o Energy conservation or management
o The Emergency Management & Continuity Planning Program or Disaster
Management Certificate Program at University of Illinois at Chicago
• Have a minimum GPA of 3.0 and making satisfactory progress.
• Complete the application form, including the short essays.
• Have not previously been awarded the AHMP Environmental Scholarship.
• Be a resident of the State of Illinois, as proven by submitting a copy of a current REAL ID. more...

Must be an incoming freshman enrolled full-time with a major in the College of Business Administration
Financial need must be considered
The scholarship may be renewable for up to three additional years if the recipient receives the scholarship as an incoming freshman, maintains a 3.0 GPA, and continues as a CBA major.
Students must re-apply each year. Recipients will be asked to sign a non-binding statement indicating their intention to give back within 20 years of graduation from UWL to the Jungbluth or other scholarship fund. more...

Ethel Sloane Memorial Scholarship
The Ethel Sloane Memorial Scholarship is given to a senior majoring in a natural science within the College of Letters & Science. The recipient must be a full-time student with a minimum cumulative GPA of at least a 3.4. The successful applicant will also have a strong endorsement from a professor in the natural sciences.
Students who have an up-to-date Panther Scholarship Portal General Application and the College of Letters & Science Scholarships and Awards Application will be considered, typically in spring each year between February and April. No additional or separate application is required; students should thoroughly fill out the Panther Scholarship Portal General Application and the College of Letters & Science Scholarships and Awards Application. Awards given in spring are for the following school year so students graduating that same spring or summer are not eligible. E.G. applications reviewed in Spring 2022 are for Fall 2022; students graduating in May or August 2022 are not eligible. more...

Eugene & Nancy Winkler Scholarship
This scholarship was established by Eugene ’59 and Nancy ’63, ’90 Winkler. Applicant must be a full-time undergraduate enrolled at the Oshkosh campus who meets one of the following requirements: 1) a declared major in the College of Education and Human Services within the following departments: Teaching & Learning, Human Kinetics & Health Education, or Special & Early Childhood Education or 2) at least one parent who is or was a K-12 teacher. Preference will be given to students who meet both of these criteria. Applicant must have between 25 and 60 credits completed. This includes all college-level credits: CLEP, CAPP, retro, transfer, etc. Applicant must have a minimum cumulative 3.0 GPA. Involvement and demonstrated leadership in UW Oshkosh extracurricular activities (excluding athletics) will be considered. This award will be paid out in Fall 2022. The recipient is eligible to receive an additional year of the award, provided the recipient maintains a minimum 3.0 cumulative GPA, remains enrolled in the College of Education and Human Services (if this is how eligibility was initially determined), and funding is available. more...

Euphrosyne Scholarship
This scholarship was established by Leslie Schultz in 2020 to encourage students who are pursuing a career in nursing, in order to give back to the nursing professional for everything nurses have done during the COVID-19 pandemic. Applicant must be an incoming freshman admitted to the UW Oshkosh, Oshkosh campus. Applicant must be planning to pursue a degree in nursing. Applicant must demonstrate academic achievement with a minimum 3.0 cumulative high school GPA. Applicant must have financial need based on a statement. Recipient must enroll full-time in order to receive the award disbursement in Fall 2021. more...

Everett G. Pyle Graduate Scholarship
This scholarship was established in memory of Dr. Everett G. Pyle, founding dean of the UW Oshkosh Graduate School from 1965 to 1974. Applicant must be a full- or part-time graduate student enrolled at the Oshkosh campus. Applicant must be pursuing a graduate degree, must be in good academic standing, and must have completed at least one semester at UW Oshkosh. Applicant must demonstrated outstanding academic achievement and must display promise for graduate scholarship. Applicant must have financial need based on the FAFSA. This award will be paid out in Fall 2022. more...

Excellence Award
Scholarship for juniors attending the University of Wisconsin-Oshkosh who are majoring in Social Work. Selection based on academic achievement and contribution to the field and department. Due date, award amount and number of awards may vary. Nonrenewable. more...

Extreme Engineering Solutions Scholarship
Electrical Engineering Technology Program students. Every semester, Extreme Engineering Solutions (X-ES) is proud to offer a scholarship for two Madison College students in the Electronics program. Our company was founded by graduates of local engineering programs, so we feel it’s important to support the next generation of learners in our community. To that end, each recipient of the Extreme Engineering Solutions Scholarship will receive $500 toward tuition. Headquartered in the Madison area, X-ES is an industry-leading provider of rugged embedded computing solutions, supporting a wide variety of applications in some of the most extreme conditions on Earth. We’ve worked with Madison College for several years through donations and appearances at career fairs and informational sessions, and we like to invite students to tour our facilities. X-ES also employs several Madison College students every semester as part- of our co-op program. more...

3. Recipient must be in good academic standing.
4. Recipient may be a sophomore, junior, or senior or graduate student.
5. Financial need must be considered.
6. Statement of Financial Need must be submitted with application more...

Fale Family Nursing Scholarship
This scholarship was established by the family of Bob and Anne Fale (Fah’ lee) in the hope that it enables nursing students to complete their professional studies in spite of personal financial hardships. Applicant must be an undergraduate enrolled at the Oshkosh campus. Applicant must be admitted to the College of Nursing and must be pursuing a BSN degree. Applicant must have financial need based on a statement. Applicant must be in good academic standing. Preference will be given to students who are returning to study nursing and who come from an abusive/victimized life experience; however, others are encouraged to apply. This award will be paid out in Fall 2022. more...

Flahive Athletic Scholarship
Scholarship for incoming freshmen and transfer students accepted to Cardinal Stritch College, who compete in one of the Universitys 10 intercollegiate sports. Eligibility and award amount is determined by the respective coach. Due date and number of awards varies. more...

Florence L. Healy Scholarship
The Florence Healy Scholarship is open to students with research interests focused on women’s and gender studies. Eligible students will be sophomores, juniors, seniors, or graduate students who will be enrolled full-time in the 2022-23 school year and who have documented financial need. To demonstrate financial need, students must have a completed FAFSA on file that shows a need level.
A minimum 3.0 GPA is required, and applicants must have completed at least one Women’s and Gender Studies course (code WGS on the schedule of classes). A list of WGS courses you have taken as well as a statement explaining your interest in women’s and gender studies is required.
In addition, all applicants must have completed the Academic/Career Goals section of the General Application. You may go back and edit your General Application if needed up until the deadline for the Florence Healy Scholarship.
Preference will be given to students who are first-time applicants to this scholarship. more...

Food Fight Restaurant Group Culinary & Baking Scholarship
Founded in 1994, Food Fight is a locally owned and operated restaurant group with an ever-growing family of distinctive restaurants in the greater Madison area. Each of our restaurants has a unique flavor and atmosphere, and we strive to deliver top-notch food and service to every guest. Our business is more than providing exceptional dining experiences, it is also about giving back to the community we love. Food Fight prioritizes investments in education, and we are proud to offer this scholarship to hardworking full- or part-time students with a 3.0 GPA or higher in the Culinary Arts or Baking & Decorative Arts programs. Scholarship recipients are invited to apply to join the team at one of Food Fight’s many local restaurants. With flexible scheduling options, students can gain experience in the industry while getting a degree, and we love promoting from within. more...

Food Fight Restaurant Group Hospitality Scholarship
Founded in 1994, Food Fight is a locally owned and operated restaurant group with an ever-growing family of distinctive restaurants in the greater Madison area. Each of our restaurants has a unique flavor and atmosphere, and we strive to deliver top-notch food and service to every guest. Our business is more than providing exceptional dining experiences, it is also about giving back to the community we love. Food Fight prioritizes investments in education, and we are proud to offer this scholarship to hardworking full- or part-time students who are enrolled in the Hospitality Management program and who intend to pursue a career in the restaurant industry. Minimum 3.0 or higher GPA required. Scholarship recipients are invited to apply to join the team at one of Food Fight’s many local restaurants. With flexible scheduling options, students can gain experience in the industry while getting a degree, and we love promoting from within. more...

Forensics Scholarships
Scholarship for incoming freshmen accepted to Ripon College who have an interest in Forensics. Candidates must have a minimum high school GPA of 3.5, ACT score of 27 or SAT of 1220. Applicants must have commitment to academic excellence and service to their school and community. On-campus interview is required. Student must remain active in a forensics group each year for renewal. Renewable; must remain full-time, participate in three invitationals, and have satisfactory academic progress. more...

Foth & Van Dyke & Associates Inc.
Scholarship for residents of Brown, Door, Kewaunee, Oconoto, or Outagamie counties, Wisconsin who are FFA members and will be incoming freshmen or current undergraduate students enrolling/enrolled at selected colleges pursuing studies in Civil Engineering, Electrical Engineering or Mechanical Engineering. Selected colleges are: University of Wisconsin-Madison, University of Wisconsin-Platteville, Milwaukee School of Engineering, Madison Area Technical College or Northwest Wisconsin Technical College. Student must be a U.S. citizen. Criteria used for selection includes students GPA (minimum 3.2), ACT or SAT scores, class rank, leadership in FFA activities, leadership in community activities, and involvement in the Supervised Agricultural Experience Program (SAE). Nonrenewable. more...

Applications are typically accepted in spring each year between February and April. Awards given in spring are for the following school year so students graduating that same spring or summer are not eligible. E.G. applications reviewed in Spring 2022 are for Fall 2022; students graduating in May or August 2022 are not eligible. more...

No additional or separate application is required; students should thoroughly fill out the Panther Scholarship Portal General Application and the College of Letters & Science Scholarships and Awards Application. Awards given in fall are for the following semester so students graduating that same fall are not eligible. E.G. applications reviewed in December 2021 are for Spring semester 2022; students graduating in December 2021 are not eligible. more...

students exploring the international relationship between the United States and foreign countries
students exploring American History
a student eligible to become or currently serving as a teaching assistant

Fred And Ann Rouse Scholarship
Fred and Ann Rouse value their connections to the community and understand the need to support students to advance the skilled trades and manufacturing industry. As the workforce ages, there is a great need to inspire the younger generation to obtain a quality education. Fred Rouse has been in Real Estate Development and Management for 55 years and knows first-hand the need for high quality prepared trade workers. The Fred and Ann Rouse Scholarship Fund will support student scholarships toward a degree or certificate in the School of Applied Science, engineering and technologies, preferably in any of the construction or manufacturing programs. more...

Frederick I. Olson Scholarship
The Frederick I. Olson Scholarship is awarded to a graduate student who is a Wisconsin resident with financial need as documented by FAFSA. Should two or more students have equal need, the most academically qualified student will be selected. Masters students are eligible for a one-year renewal; doctoral students are eligible for a two-year renewal if funding is available. The recipient of this scholarship must enroll in a minimum of 6 credits per semester. If the recipient is in dissertator status, enrollment in three credits per semester is allowed.
Students who have an up-to-date Panther Scholarship Portal General Application and the College of Letters & Science Scholarships and Awards Application will be considered, typically in spring each year between February and April. No additional or separate application is required; students should thoroughly fill out the Panther Scholarship Portal General Application and the College of Letters & Science Scholarships and Awards Application. Awards given in spring are for the following school year so students graduating that same spring or summer are not eligible. E.G. applications reviewed in Spring 2022 are for Fall 2022; students graduating in May or August 2022 are not eligible. more...

Frederick I. Olson Scholarship
The Frederick I. Olson Scholarship is awarded to a graduate student who is a Wisconsin resident, is enrolled in six or more graduate credits, and demonstrates financial need as documented by FAFSA. Should two or more students have equal need, the most academically qualified student will be selected. Masters students are eligible for a one-year renewal; doctoral students are eligible for a two-year renewal if funding is available.
Students who have an up-to-date Panther Scholarship Portal General Application and the College of Letters & Science Scholarships and Awards Application will be considered, typically in spring each year between February and April. No additional or separate application is required; students should thoroughly fill out the Panther Scholarship Portal General Application and the College of Letters & Science Scholarships and Awards Application. Awards given in spring are for the following school year so students graduating that same spring or summer are not eligible. E.G. applications reviewed in Spring 2022 are for Fall 2022; students graduating in May or August 2022 are not eligible. more...
