Mark Chapman Piano Scholarship
This award was established in 2019 by Cheryl Mellenthin, BSN ’79, in memory of her late husband, Mark Chapman. Applicant must be a full-time undergraduate enrolled at the Oshkosh campus and must be majoring in music with piano as their primary applied instrument. Applicant must have at least sophomore standing and must have a minimum 3.0 cumulative GPA. Applicant must demonstrate skill as a pianist as shown through past performances with music department ensembles or past performances at recitals or juries. Applicant must have an interest in collaborative piano performance. This award will be split evenly between the Fall 2022 and Spring 2023 semesters. If the recipient is not enrolled in the spring semester, the second installment will be forfeited. more...

Mark Coyne Memorial Scholarship
A Wisconsin native, Mark earned his nursing degrees in Miami Florida where he began his nursing career. He returned to Madison in 1981, and worked as a staff nurse at UW Hospitals & Clinics. Mark began his teaching career as an Emergency Medical Services instructor at Madison College in January 1986. In June of that year, he was recruited to the UW Med Flight program where he worked as a nurse for 22 years. He passed away May 11, 2008 as the result of a UW Med flight accident. Family and friends have contributed memorial gifts to continue Mark’s legacy of teaching and learning. His motto was “Education is like a candle…you lose nothing by lighting another candle.”
This scholarship is available to full-time continuing Madison College students who have completed the EMT-Basic program and are currently enrolled in an emergency medical services related (EMT, EMS or Paramedic) program. Donor/Thank You Letter: Ann Coyne
HPS Scholarship more...

Mark Gruenwald Scholarship
This scholarship was established in memory of alumnus Mark Gruenwald. Applicant must be enrolled as an undergraduate student at the Oshkosh campus. Applicant must be involved in two or more areas of the arts and must demonstrate an interdisciplinary approach to the various creative arts, which may include but is not limited to: visual art, creative writing, music, theatre, media, and dance. This award will be paid out in Fall 2022. more...

Mark L. Tremble Scholarship
This scholarship was established in 2004 by J.J. Keller & Associates, Inc., in memory of Mark L. Tremble, former Senior Vice President of Sales and Marketing. It is awarded to incoming freshmen who are admitted to the Oshkosh campus for Summer 2022 or Fall 2022. Applicant must have a minimum 2.8 high school GPA. Selection will be based on financial need and community involvement. Recipient must enroll full-time in order to receive the award. This award will be paid out in Fall 2022. more...

Marlene Thompson Atkielski & Donald Atkielski Memorial Scholarship
Marlene Thompson Atkielski and Donald Atkielski Memorial Scholarship – Marlene Thompson Atkielski began her teaching career after receiving her Bachelor of Science in Education from Alverno College. She then went on to UWM to receive a Masters in Library Science. Marlene served as a school librarian in the New Berlin and Wauwatosa School Systems. Marlene was a member of Pi Lambda Theta at UWM. She had the highest regard for the professors who offered both challenges and opportunities. The purpose of the Fund is to provide scholarships to students enrolled in SOIS meeting the following criteria:
Graduate student enrolled in program leading to a degree as a Master of Library and Information Science (MLIS)
Academic merit (minimum cum GPA 3.0)
Financial need
Certified/licensed teacher
Demonstrated interest in and commitment to education and a career as a school librarian/media specialist. more...

Marquette University Scholarship
The Marquette University Scholarship is available to students at University of Wisconsin, Fox Valley. You must have a minimum GPA of 3.2 and be transferring to Marquette University to qualify for this award. more...

Marsha Lorene Hahn Cota Memorial Endowed Scholarship
This scholarship is for a full-time, self-supporting, continuing Occupational Therapy student with a GPA of 3.0 or higher who can demonstrate that the internship requirements of the Occupational Therapy Assistant Program create a financial hardship for them or their family, and may prevent them from pursuing their degree. Marsha Hahn enrolled in the OTA program in her late-40s. She spent much of her adult life working as an aide with both children and adults with cognitive and developmental disorders. Marsha had a unique ability and an innate sense of her client’s needs. She was very successful in reaching those that many could not. Her quiet and caring nature, extraordinary patience, keen insight and careful observations were her gifts and her clients loved her openly and unconditionally. In her position as an aide and with her unassuming nature, her talents were frequently overlooked. Ultimately, she decided to pursue her education as an occupational therapy assistant because it was a close match to the years of experience she already had in the workforce. Entering college was a daunting and frightening challenge that Marsha overcame, and though she struggled through many classes and internships, she inspired nearly everyone who came to know her along the way. During Marsha’s pre employment interview for her first COTA job, it was discovered that she had advanced colon cancer. She did not have an opportunity to practice as a COTA following graduation; however, she spent her life working in that role in an unofficial capacity. She was fortunate enough to be able to support herself during the internship requirement, but she noted several classmates that endured great financial hardship during this time. It is Marsha’s desire to provide a scholarship for use with living expenses to help ease the financial burden during their internship. Applicant must upload a letter of recommendation from an OTA Program Instructor.
Donor/Thank You Letter: Janet Harris more...

Martha Best / Martine Meyer Scholarship
This scholarship is offered in the names of two highly esteemed former professors in the UWM French program. Their excellence and dedication set a high standard that our program strives to maintain. The scholarship is awarded based on academic achievement and demonstrated financial need to an undergraduate who is studying French. Enrollment in French coursework is required, but students do not have to be a French major or minor. Applicants must have current FAFSA scores to be eligible and must be enrolled full-time. Priority will be given to students planning to become French teachers.
Students who have an up-to-date Panther Scholarship Portal General Application and the College of Letters & Science Scholarships and Awards Application will be considered, typically in spring each year between February and April. No additional or separate application is required; students should thoroughly fill out the Panther Scholarship Portal General Application and the College of Letters & Science Scholarships and Awards Application. Awards given in spring are for the following school year so students graduating that same spring or summer are not eligible. E.G. applications reviewed in Spring 2022 are for Fall 2022; students graduating in May or August 2022 are not eligible. more...

demonstrated financial need

Awards given in spring are for the following school year so students graduating that same spring or summer are not eligible. Mba - Executive Multi-Student Scholarship
The College of Business Executive MBA Program offers this scholarship to two or more individuals who either directly, or via their employer, successfully recruit a student for the EMBA Program who has not been previously identified as a potential student by the EMBA office staff. A successfully recruited student is one who has made their first tuition payment. The recruiting and recruited student each receive a $5,000 scholarship credit applied to their remaining tuition payments. The award amount will be prorated if the student’s remaining payments total less than $5,000. Combined UWO EMBA scholarships will not exceed the published EMBA total cost per student net of employer & government support. The scholarship will be applied to the recipient’s student account starting with the next tuition payment following selection.
The lockstep accelerated nature of the Executive MBA Program, as well as its modular format, may create uneven posting of credits to the student transcript. Students enrolled in the EMBA will be considered to be full-time students regardless of the number of credits posting to their transcript in a given semester. more...

Mba - Executive Not-For-Profit And Government Scholarship
The College of Business Executive MBA Program offers scholarships to graduate students who work for the government (federal, state, or local) or who work for a non-profit 501©(3) organization with a focus on enhancing the greater good. Applicant must be admitted to the Executive MBA Program. Scholarships are not retroactive and will apply to only future costs. If the student changes jobs and moves out of the NFP and/or Government profession once they have entered the program, future installments of the scholarships will be forfeited. Combined UWO EMBA scholarships will not exceed the published EMBA total cost per student net of employer & government support. The scholarship will be applied to the recipient’s student account starting with the next tuition payment following selection.
The lockstep accelerated nature of the Executive MBA Program, as well as its modular format, may create uneven posting of credits to the student transcript. Students enrolled in the EMBA will be considered to be full-time students regardless of the number of credits posting to their transcript in a given semester. more...

Mba - Executive Road Warrior Scholarship
The College of Business MBA – Executive Program offers scholarships to graduate students who travel more than 75 miles to the site of the Executive MBA classes. Applicant must be admitted to the Executive MBA Program. Scholarships are not retroactive and will apply to only future costs. If the student moves within the 75-mile radius once they have entered the program, future installments of the scholarships will be forfeited. Combined UWO EMBA scholarships will not exceed the published EMBA total cost per student net of employer & government support. The scholarship will be applied to the recipient’s student account starting with the next tuition payment following selection.
The lockstep accelerated nature of the Executive MBA Program, as well as its modular format, may create uneven posting of credits to the student transcript. Students enrolled in the EMBA will be considered to be full-time students regardless of the number of credits posting to their transcript in a given semester. more...

Mba - Executive Single Parents Scholarship
The College of Business Executive MBA Program offers scholarships to graduate students who are single parents with at least one dependent child under the age of 18. Applicant must be admitted to the Executive MBA Program. Scholarships are not retroactive and will apply to only future costs. Combined UWO EMBA scholarships will not exceed the published EMBA total cost per student net of employer & government support. The scholarship will be applied to the recipient’s student account starting with the next tuition payment following selection.
The lockstep accelerated nature of the Executive MBA Program, as well as its modular format, may create uneven posting of credits to the student transcript. Students enrolled in the EMBA will be considered to be full-time students regardless of the number of credits posting to their transcript in a given semester. more...

Mba - Executive Veterans Scholarship
The College of Business Executive MBA Program offers scholarships to graduate students who are currently serving or honorably discharged veterans of the United States military (any branch). Applicant must be admitted to the Executive MBA Program. Scholarships are not retroactive and will apply to only future costs. Combined UWO EMBA scholarships will not exceed the published EMBA total cost per student net of employer & government support. Applicants must be ineligible for VA benefits or have exhausted those benefits before the scholarship is applied. The scholarship will be applied to the recipient’s student account starting with the next tuition payment following selection.
The lockstep accelerated nature of the Executive MBA Program, as well as its modular format, may create uneven posting of credits to the student transcript. Students enrolled in the EMBA will be considered to be full-time students regardless of the number of credits posting to their transcript in a given semester. more...

Mckendry Cultural Exchange Scholarship
The McKendry Cultural Exchange Scholarship is available to undergraduate and graduate business students at the University of Wisconsin, Milwaukee. Recipients of this award will study at Sophia University in Tokyo during the summer semester. more...

Meadows Fund Scholarships
The Meadows scholarship supports a full-time bachelor’s degree student who was previously in foster care, with a preference for someone who aged out of foster care. Academic merit will be considered and qualified applicants will have a minimum 2.8 cumulative GPA.
Students who have an up-to-date Panther Scholarship Portal General Application will be considered, typically in spring each year between February and April. No additional or separate application is required; students should thoroughly fill out the Panther Scholarship Portal General Application. Awards given in spring are for the following school year so students graduating that same spring or summer are not eligible. E.G. applications reviewed in Spring 2022 are for Fall 2022; students graduating in May or August 2022 are not eligible. more...

You must be enrolled in an electronics program and be in at least your second semester with at least 12 hours earned from WCTC. Also, you must have a minimum GPA of 3.0 to be eligible for this award. more...

Mel Seamans started with the College in 1967. He served as Area Coordinator at the Fort Atkinson campus from 1980-89, and most recently worked part-time in Technology Services at the Downtown campus. This fund honors Mel Seaman’s years of service and dedication to the students and his coworkers. This scholarship is available to full and part-time Information Technology students. Meyer Family Scholarship
The scholarship was established to honor Wilma E. Meyer, who passed away on Wednesday, September 28, 2011. She always valued higher education and promoted it. Higher education provides value to the individual in that it generally increases their earnings over someone who does not have a college degree. Higher education provides a broad knowledgebase, critical thinking skills and reference points for discussion of politics, entertainment, art and history. Wilma valued Madison College. Her grandson, William Norwell and his wife, Brittany (Anderson) Norwell are both Madison College graduates. Single parents and/or community leaders strongly encouraged to apply. New or continuing Administrative Professional Program students with a GPA of 2.5 or higher. Donor/Thank You Letter: Nancy Meyer more...

Michael J. & Kathi R. Mcginley Endowed Opportunity Scholarship
The goal of the scholarship(s) is to provide at minimum 100% coverage of the cost of tuition when combined with Pell Grants and State of Wisconsin Grants. Preference will be given toward students who are Pell Grant eligible or are of High Financial Need as determined by the Office of Financial Aid. Applicants must meet the following criteria:
1. Recipient must be enrolled full time at UW-La Crosse with a major in a STEM-related field
2. Recipient must be in good academic standing with a grade point average above 2.8 when applying for the scholarship in the spring semester of their freshman year
3. Recipient must be successfully completing the First Year Research Experience (FYRE) program or have their application approved by the Dean of the College of Science and Health
4. Recipient must be a sophomore at the time the scholarship is paid more...

Midwest Association For Financial Aid Administrators (Masfaa) Access Scholarship
The Midwest Association for Financial Aid Administrators (MASFAA) acknowledges that many students face financial, academic, and social barriers that complicate the completion of their education. As financial aid professionals, we believe all students should be granted access to an affordable education to achieve their education and career goals.
The MASFAA Access Scholarship seeks to support students facing barriers to their financial, academic, and social success. In 2022, MASFAA will provide a one-time $500 scholarship to offer financial support towards a student’s tuition, fees, books and supplies, housing, and transportation costs.
All students (certificate, associate, undergraduate, graduate, or professional) from the MASFAA region (Illinois, Indiana, Iowa, Michigan, Minnesota, Missouri, Ohio, West Virginia, or Wisconsin) are welcome to apply.
The recipient of the MASFAA Scholarship will be announced mid-October. more...

The Milliman Scholarship is given to a sophomore or junior actuarial science major with demonstrated academic excellence and demonstrated potential for success as an actuary. Majors with a 3.2 or higher GPA will be considered.
Students who have an up-to-date Panther Scholarship Portal General Application and the College of Letters & Science Scholarships and Awards Application will be considered, typically in spring each year between February and April. No additional or separate application is required as long as the student has thoroughly filled out the Panther Scholarship Portal General Application and the College of Letters & Science Scholarships and Awards Application. Awards given in spring are for the following school year. E.G. applications reviewed in Spring 2022 are for Fall 2022 scholarships.. more...

Morris And Miriam Marden Graduate Award In Mathematics
The Morris and Miriam Marden Graduate Award in Mathematics is given to the best paper written on a mathematical topic by a graduate student as deemed by a committee of faculty members. Both quality of exposition and mathematical content will be evaluated. The paper need not be written specifically for the Marden Award; papers originally written for coursework, independent study, professional reports, dissertation, or other reasons are acceptable. more...

Morris And Miriam Marden Undergraduate Award In Mathematics
The Morris and Miriam Marden Undergraduate Award in Mathematics is given to one or more outstanding majors in the Department of Mathematical Sciences: math, data science, actuarial science, & applied math and computer science. Priority in the selection process will be given to students who submit an outstanding research paper on a mathematical topic. Both quality of exposition and mathematical content will be evaluated. The paper need not be written specifically for the Marden Award; papers originally written for coursework, independent study, or other reasons are acceptable. Students who choose to not submit a paper may also be considered based on their academic record at the discretion of the faculty review committee.
Applications are typically accepted in April each year. more...

Mother Caroline Friess Scholarship
Scholarship for incoming freshmen students accepted to Mount Mary College in Wisconsin full-time. Applicant must have 10 points to qualify for this award; awards are based on students test scores, cumulative GPA and class rank. Applicants must add the highest two of the three academic point values for a composite academic score (up to 12 points), then locate your points and the appropriate scholarship award amount. Due date and number of awards varies. Renewable. more...

Applicants must add the highest two of the three academic point values for a composite academic score (up to 12 points), then locate your points and the appropriate scholarship award amount. Due date and number of awards varies. Renewable. more...

The Grace Scholars award in conjunction with federal and state financial aid covers 85% of tuition annually for up to four years. more...

Myrtle Bahm Leonard Childcare Award
As the end of the Fall term at Wisconsin colleges and universities nears with the usual round of papers and examinations, three students in particular are grateful for having time to study while their children are well cared for at on-campus child care centers. They are the recipients of the Myrtle Bahm Leonard Memorial Scholarship, sponsored by the Perinatal Foundation to provide support for the child care expenses of students at Madison College. The recipients of this unique scholarship program, established in 1994 in memory of the wife of one of the Foundation’s major benefactors, are all parents of young children and are working toward a college degree. In order to qualify for the scholarship, their children must attend the Madison College Child & Family. The Myrtle Bahm Leonard Memorial Scholarship program is one of the most gratifying ways the Foundation fulfills its mission of improving the health of mothers, infants, and their families. Research shows that there is a strong relationship between the educational level of a mother and the health and well being of her children. Studies conducted around the world have confirmed a direct correlation between higher educational levels of mothers and lower infant mortality rates. Donor/Thank You Letter: Ann Conway, Perinatal Foundation more...

National Guardian delivers for its clients and community in some of life’s most troubling times, earning a reputation for trust and value among its customers. The company supports the development of a high quality workforce and, through a new, endowed fund, National Guardian Life will ensure that Madison area students have permanent support for the high quality learning that leads to good paying jobs. This scholarship is available to students enrolled in Business Technology, IT, Marketing or Accounting programs. Veterans will be given priority. more...

1. Recipient must be enrolled full time at UW-La Crosse with a major in public administration, economics, and/or an interest in developing the City of La Crosse, local government, and urban sustainability
2. Recipient must be in good academic standing with strong interpersonal skills
3. Recipient may be a junior, senior, or graduate student
4. One $1,000 payout should be made annually more...

Nevin James Public Speaking Contest Award
This award is given to the winners of the Communication Studies Department’s annual public speaking contest, held each December. One student from each COMM 111 class is selected to compete, based on a persuasive policy speech prepared for that course. Speeches are judged based on content and delivery. Recipient must enroll as an undergraduate student at the Oshkosh campus in Fall 2021 in order to receive the award. more...

Nevin James Writing Contest Award
To be considered for this award, students must submit an essay that has been submitted for a grade in WBIS 188, ENG 110, ENG 101, or CAPP WBIS. Recipient must be enrolled at the Oshkosh, Fox Cities, or Fond du Lac campus. For more information, please contact the English Department at english@uwosh.edu. Nevin S. James Scholarship

New Directions Scholarship
A four-year renewable scholarship for incoming new freshmen enrolled in a bachelor’s degree program with an intended major in the College of Letters & Science. Strong applicants will have a high school GPA of 3.75 or higher, strong writing skills as demonstrated on the application, and an array of high school activities.
Applications are accepted each year between October and December 31. Applications are reviewed in January and February, and recipients are notified in February or March.
The application is in three parts:
Complete the Panther Scholarship Portal General Application
Complete the College of Letters & Science Scholarships and Awards Application which consists of just one item – upload a copy of your high school transcript showing your most recent grades
Complete the New Directions Application which includes an essay
Awards given in spring are for the following school year so only INCOMING freshmen are eligible to apply. E.G. applications reviewed in Spring 2022 are for students who will be starting at UWM as a new freshman in Fall 2022. more...

New Manufacturing Alliance Engineering Tech Future All Stars Scholarship
This scholarship was established by the NEW Manufacturing Alliance, a membership of manufacturers working together with educational institutions, workforce boards, economic development, and state organizations to promote manufacturing in Northeast Wisconsin. Applicant must be an undergraduate student enrolled at the Oshkosh campus. Applicant must have a declared major in mechanical engineering technology or electrical engineering technology. Applicant must have at least 30 credits completed. Preference will be given to applicants with 60 or more credits completed. Financial need based on an essay may be considered, but will not be the deciding factor in selection. One award will be given to a mechanical engineering technology major and one award will be given to an electrical engineering technology major. Prior recipients are not eligible to reapply. This award will be paid out in Fall 2022. more...

New Manufacturing Alliance Technology Education Scholarship
This scholarship was established in 2020 by the NEW Manufacturing Alliance. Applicant must be admitted to or enrolled at the Oshkosh campus. Applicant must be majoring in Technology Education. Applicant must be from one of the following Northeast Wisconsin counties: Brown, Calumet, Door, Florence, Fond du Lac, Green Lake, Kewaunee, Manitowoc, Marinette, Marquette, Menominee, Oconto, Outagamie, Shawano, Sheboygan, Waupaca, Waushara, or Winnebago. Financial need is not a consideration. Recipient must be enrolled when the award is paid out in Fall 2022. more...

Nightingale Scholarship

Applicant must be enrolled full-time at the Oshkosh campus. Applicant must be admitted to the College of Nursing and must be pursuing a BSN degree. Applicant must demonstrate academic excellence and evidence of scholarship in the spirit of Florence Nightingale. Applicant must demonstrate how they are currently advancing the profession of nursing. This award will be paid out in Fall 2022. more...

Noble Entrepreneurship Scholarship
This scholarship is being established to support students in the Small Business Entrepreneurship program as a way of giving back royalties from the sales of Business Math Cleaves/Hobbs/Noble (a textbook co-authored by Jeffrey Noble) at Madison College. Applicants must be full or part-time continuing Small Business Entrepreneurship program students with a 3.0 GPA of higher. Donor/Thank You Letter: Jeffrey Noble more...

Nolan Jones Gibson Scholarship For Veterans
This scholarship honors Nolan Jones Gibson. Like many of Madison College’s students, Mr. Gibson has overcome obstacles in his life. Mr. Gibson is a disabled WWII veteran who overcame a severe head injury and went on to serve his fellow veterans for over 30 years as the Grant County Veterans Service Officer. The Nolan Jones Gibson Scholarship will benefit veterans attending Madison College. Applicants must be veterans. Preference is given to those with a service-connected disability (physical or PTSD). Must indicate financial need. Must submit 1-2 paragraphs describing career goals. Donor/Thank You Letter: Patricia Huber more...

Nonprofit Management General Scholarship
Eligible students must be enrolled (or admitted) as a student in the Graduate Certificate in Nonprofit Management or the Master of Science in Nonprofit Management and Leadership degree program at UWM. Scholarship applications will be reviewed on the basis of demonstrated financial need and/or academic merit and the potential for success as a nonprofit manager or leader. Students may be asked to submit additional information for consideration. If requested, additional information will be uploaded through the UWM Panther Scholarship Portal. For more information, contact the UWM Helen Bader Institute for nonprofit management at hbi-info@uwm.edu. more...

Norman And Carolyn Stoner Scholarship
This scholarship is available to Madison College students. Donor/Thank You Letter: Norman & Carolyn Stoner more...

Norman Muehrer Scholarship
This scholarship was established in memory of Norman Muehrer by his wife, Patricia ’44, ’46. Applicant must be an undergraduate enrolled at the Oshkosh campus. Applicant must have met Gateway I requirements and have been admitted, or have applied for fall admission, to the Teacher Education Program. Applicant must be majoring in elementary education (K-6) and must be planning to teach K-6, which could include dual licensure in elementary education/special education. Applicant must demonstrate an understanding of becoming an elementary education teacher and a commitment to the teaching profession at the elementary school level. This award will be paid out in Fall 2021. more...

North Central Group Hospitality Scholarship
Founded in 1981 by David Lenz, North Central Group (NCG} has become one of America’s foremost developers, owners, and operators of premium, select service and extended-stay hotels. NCG prioritizes investing in the communities where it operates and in the people who represent the future of the hospitality industry. NCG is proud to offer these scholarships to hardworking full-time students who are enrolled in the Hospitality Management program. Minimum 12 credit hours and 3.0 or higher GPA required. Thank you letter: Kim Richter more...

Northwestern Mutual Aspiring Leaders Scholarship
This scholarship was established by Northwestern Mutual in 2020. Applicant must be a full-time undergraduate student enrolled at the Oshkosh campus. Applicant must be a degree-seeking student within the College of Business, College of Education & Human Services, or College of Letters & Science. Applicant must have at least junior standing and must have a minimum 3.0 cumulative GPA. Applicant must submit a statement regarding their involvement and leadership in extra-curricular or volunteer activities while enrolled at UW Oshkosh. This award will be paid out in Fall 2021. more...

Northwestern Mutual Financial Planning & Risk Management Scholarship
This scholarship was established by Northwestern Mutual in 2020. Applicant must be a full-time undergraduate student enrolled at the Oshkosh campus. Applicant must be be pursuing a minor or certificate within the Insurance & Risk Management Program. Applicant must have at least junior standing and must have a minimum 3.0 cumulative GPA. This award will be paid out in Spring 2021. more...

Novum Structures Llc Scholarship
Scholarship for college sophomore enrolled full-time at the Milwaukee School of Engineering majoring in Architectural Engineering with a specialty in building structural system design. Students must have a minimum 3.0 GPA and participate in a paid summer internship at Novum Structures and willing to consider full-time employment. Number of awards may vary. An interview is required. more...

O'rourke/Pulvermacher Families Endowed Scholarship
The O’Rourke/Pulvermacher Families Endowed Scholarship was established in honor of the various members of the O’Rourke and Pulvermacher families who have benefitted and continue to benefit from the services of Madison College and who continue to dedicate their time and talents to forward the mission of the College. Students enrolled part- or full-time in any certificate, diploma or associate degree program offered by Madison College will are eligible to apply. The primary consideration is not financial need but the willingness to learn. Donor/Thank You Letter: Tim & Denise O’Rourke more...

Olive Campbell Educational Scholarship
Olive’s husband, Guy, and her children are indebted to the staff at Avalon SeniorCare in Fitchburg. Employees lovingly cared for Olive, renewing both her dignity and zest for life in the months preceding her death. Staff members continue to be there for Guy. President for many years of the Visiting Nurse Service in Muskegon, Michigan, where she lived before moving to Madison, Olive was keenly aware of the continual need for compassionate caregivers. She would enjoy knowing that an educational scholarship had been set up at Madison College in her name to help students enroll and graduate from the colleges Certified Nursing Assistant program. Preference will be given to current and prospective employees of Avalon SeniorCare.
Donor/Thank You Letter: Genie Campbell more...

Opportunity Scholarship Fund
This fund is created to provide the opportunity for access to education for those who need assistance. more...

Orange Shoe Personal Fitness Scholarship
Orange Shoe Personal Fitness is proud to support students that are pursuing a career in personal training. This scholarship is intended to financially support students that are passionate about helping others live an active and healthy life. The scholarship recipient may use the funds to cover tuition, certifications, or other professional development expenses. more...

Orville C. Sherman Journalism Scholarship
This scholarship was established through a bequest from Orville C. Sherman. Applicant must be a full-time journalism student enrolled at the Oshkosh campus. Applicant must have financial need based on the FAFSA. This award will be paid out in Fall 2021. more...

Orville C. Sherman Music Scholarship
This scholarship was established by Orville C. Sherman. Applicant must be a full-time music student enrolled at the Oshkosh campus. Applicant must demonstrate financial need based on the FAFSA. This award will be paid out in Fall 2022. more...

Orville C. Sherman Scholarship (H.S. Senior)
This scholarship was established by Orville C. Sherman. Two scholarships will be awarded each year: one to a graduating senior from Oshkosh North High School and another to a graduating senior from Oshkosh West High School, both of whom have been admitted to the Oshkosh campus for Summer 2022 or Fall 2022. Recipient must have financial need and must show the most promising ability as a musician, including a singer. This award will be split evenly between the Fall 2022 and Spring 2023 semesters. If the recipient is not enrolled in the spring semester, the second installment will be forfeited. more...

Oshkosh Allergy Center Marketing Scholarship
Scholarship for seniors attending the University of Wisconsin-Oshkosh who are majoring in Marketing. Applicants must have a minimum 2.5 GPA. Number of awards may vary. Nonrenewable. more...

Oshkosh Fine Arts Association Scholarship
Applicant must be an undergraduate enrolled at the Oshkosh campus. Applicant must be majoring in the creative arts, including but not limited to art, music, and theatre. Applicant must have completed at least 12 credits in their major. This award will be paid out in Fall 2022. more...

Outstanding Political Science Student Award
The Outstanding Political Science Student Award is given to a deserving political science major enrolled at the Oshkosh campus, who has excelled academically and has enriched the department while at UW Oshkosh. There is no application process for this award; it is given at the discretion of the Political Science Department. This award will be paid out in Spring 2022. more...

P. R. Dasgupta Memorial Scholarship
Available to full-time and part-time Madison College students who exhibit financial need for which a scholarship will make an impact on their ability to continue college. Financial Need is primary concern, though recipient should show initiative, self-reliance, and ability to progress in chosen program. Donor/Thank You Letter: Dipankar (Doug) Dasgupta more...

P.E.O. Program For Continuing Education
The P.E.O. Program for Continuing Education is a grant program providing financial assistance to women whose education has been interrupted and who find it necessary to return to school to support themselves and/or their families. They must demonstrate a need for financial assistance with their educational expenses in order to improve or gain skills needed for employment immediately following graduation. The grant is not intended to be used in covering the cost of prerequisite courses which may be necessary for securing admission to an educational program. A PCE grant is not intended for those choosing immediate continuation of their education beyond the current program. more...

Pagelow Family Freshman Scholarship
Applicant must be admitted as an incoming freshman to the Oshkosh campus for Summer 2022 or Fall 2022. Applicant must be a degree-seeking student and must have financial need as documented on the FAFSA. Recipient must enroll full-time in Fall 2022 in order to receive the award. The award shall be renewable for a second year, provided the recipient remains in good academic standing and continues to be enrolled at the University. more...

Pagelow Family Scholarship
This scholarship was established by Steve and Lori Pagelow to support high-achieving students who have the opportunity to attend the Honors College at UW Oshkosh. Applicant must be an incoming freshman admitted to the Oshkosh campus for Summer 2022 or Fall 2022. Applicant must also have been admitted to or plan to apply to the Honors College. Applicant must demonstrate financial need based on the FAFSA. Preference will be given to applicants majoring in the College of Business or in teacher education. However, applicants majoring in the College of Nursing, the College of Letters and Science, and non-education majors in the College of Education and Human Services are also encouraged to apply. Preference will also be given to applicants who are first-generation college students. Recipient must enroll full-time in Fall 2022 in order to receive the award. more...

Pamela Bach Schroeder Scholarship
The Pamela Bach Schroeder Scholarship is available to students at Waukesha County Technical College. You must be enrolled in the culinary program and demonstrate financial need to be eligible for this award. more...

Pastor's Scholarship
The Pastor's Scholarship is available to incoming freshmen at Maranatha Baptist University whose parent is a full-time fundamental Baptist pastor, pastoral staff member, evangelist, missionary, chaplain or Christian camp director. You must enroll on a full-time basis to be eligible for this award. more...

Pat Burek Memorial Scholarship
This scholarship is available to students seeking an Insurance Certificate with a GPA of 2.5 or higher. more...

Pat Tully & Chris Miller Scholarship Fund
Pat Tully and Chris Miller have established this scholarship fund because Pat is a retired teacher and she saw the many students who did not have access to higher education due to their financial barriers. more...

Patricia J. Koll Scholarship
This scholarship was established by Patricia J. Koll, former education professor, associate dean, coordinator of continuing education and outreach in the College of Education and Human Services, and assistant vice chancellor for the Graduate School and Research. Applicant must be a female graduate student enrolled in the College of Education and Human Services at the Oshkosh campus. Applicant must have a minimum 3.5 cumulative GPA and must show evidence of leadership. This award will be paid out in Fall 2021. more...

Patricia M. Noble Scholarship
This scholarship was established in honor of a mother’s dream and in gratitude for helping to make her daughter’s dream come true. Applicant must be a graduate student enrolled in the College of Nursing at the Oshkosh campus. Preference will be given to full-time students and to students in the Doctor of Nursing Practice program. Applicant must demonstrate academic achievement. The applicant, due to circumstances deemed beyond his or her control, must have financial need of support to continue their education. Applicant’s efforts to help finance their education and their reasoning for becoming a nurse, shall be an important determining factor in selection. This award will be paid out in Fall 2022. more...

Patrick G. Flanagan Interior Design Scholarship
Patrick G. Flanagan was hired in 197 6 to teach in the second year of MATC ’s new Interior Design Program which graduated its first class in May 1977. He became program director the following year and taught in the program until his retirement in May 2006. Patrick established the Patrick G. Flanagan Interior Design Scholarship in recognition of the value of education instilled in him by his parents, and with gratitude as a recipient of a Wisconsin Honor Scholarship as he embarked on his college career. He hopes this scholarship award will ease the financial concerns of an interior design student who has demonstrated a commitment to their studies in the Interior Design Program at Madison College. more...

Paul C. And Martha M. Witzke Fund In Music (Sac)
freshman, sophomore, junior or senior to be enrolled full time with a major in music
show enthusiasm for music and a desire to complete the full music curriculum
above average grade point average
Performance Guidelines
Piano: Two pieces required (at least one memorized): 1) An allegro sonata movement from
Beethoven, Mozart or Haydn OR Prelude and Fugue by J.S. Bach, 2) Any piece composed in the
Romantic or Contemporary Era. Any repertoire substitutions should be addressed PRIOR to the
audition date.
Strings: a 5-10 minute performance of two contrasting styles or movements of Class A-level
solo literature or above. Memorization is optional. Accompaniment is not required, but is
encouraged.*
Winds: a 5-10 minute performance of two contrasting styles or movements of Class A-level
solo literature or above. Memorization is optional. Accompaniment is not required, but is
encouraged.*
Percussion: a 5-10 minute performance of Class A-level solo literature or above on snare drum
OR timpani, AND a keyboard percussion instrument. Memorization is optional.
Accompaniment is not required, but is encouraged.*
Voice: a 5-10 minute performance of contest-quality solo literature. If the length of one piece is
less than five minutes, a second piece of contrasting tempo, style or language is preferred.
Memorization is optional, but suggested. Vocalists must provide their own accompanist.*
All auditionees will be expected to demonstrate sight-reading abilities
A list of local accompanists is available upon request from the Department of Music.
All auditionees must make their own arrangements with their accompanist of choice.
Questions may be referred to: Dr. Christopher Frye, Department of Music Scholarship
Committee, phone: (608) 785 – 6729 or e-mail: frye.chri@uwlax.edu more...

Paul E. Wenaas Scholarship
The Paul E. Wenaas Scholarship is available to a sophomore who demonstrates outstanding ability in chemistry at the University of Wisconsin, Whitewater. You must have a minimum GPA of 3.0 to be eligible for this award. more...

Paul S. Donhauser Art-Student Scholarship
This scholarship was established in memory of Paul S. Donhauser, Ph.D., professor emeritus at UW Oshkosh. Applicant must be enrolled as an undergraduate at the Oshkosh campus and must have a declared major in art or fine arts (any of the studio art emphases or art education). Applicant must have a minimum 2.5 cumulative GPA. Preference will be given to freshmen or sophomore applicants. This award will be paid out in Fall 2022. more...

Paul Stry Music Memorial Scholarship (Sac)
freshman, sophomore, junior, senior or first year transfers to be enrolled full time with a major in music, except entering freshmen or first year transfer students may be either music majors or minors
must be enrolled in one of the university’s music organizations and also must be taking applied lessons
demonstrated superior performance in classical music
live auditions will be required by applicants, unless waived by committee, or other alternatives such as audio or videotape required
Performance Guidelines
Piano: Two pieces required (at least one memorized): 1) An allegro sonata movement from
Beethoven, Mozart or Haydn OR Prelude and Fugue by J.S. Bach, 2) Any piece composed in the
Romantic or Contemporary Era. Any repertoire substitutions should be addressed PRIOR to the
audition date.
Strings: a 5-10 minute performance of two contrasting styles or movements of Class A-level
solo literature or above. Memorization is optional. Accompaniment is not required, but is
encouraged.*
Winds: a 5-10 minute performance of two contrasting styles or movements of Class A-level
solo literature or above. Memorization is optional. Accompaniment is not required, but is
encouraged.*
Percussion: a 5-10 minute performance of Class A-level solo literature or above on snare drum
OR timpani, AND a keyboard percussion instrument. Memorization is optional.
Accompaniment is not required, but is encouraged.*
Voice: a 5-10 minute performance of contest-quality solo literature. If the length of one piece is
less than five minutes, a second piece of contrasting tempo, style or language is preferred.
Memorization is optional, but suggested. Vocalists must provide their own accompanist.*
All auditionees will be expected to demonstrate sight-reading abilities
A list of local accompanists is available upon request from the Department of Music.
All auditionees must make their own arrangements with their accompanist of choice.
Questions may be referred to: Dr. Christopher Frye, Department of Music Scholarship
Committee, phone: (608) 785 – 6729 or e-mail: frye.chri@uwlax.edu more...

Pauline Abel Scholarship (Soe)
junior majoring in elementary education
financial need should be considered
candidate must show promise of becoming a good teacher more...

Pay It Frwrd Scholarship
From the Donor: "Many of us spent late May and June, 2020 watching as this country grappled with police violence and continuing racism. Wondering how we can help change things for the better. Maybe we joined in demonstrations, educated ourselves on black history and racism or supported the efforts of anti-racism groups. Maybe we persevered with the work we were already doing with more urgency than before. Maybe we constructively talked about race with friends and coworkers for the first time, ever.
One thing that Tyler and I kept going back to during this time was what we could do to make a lasting change to move towards equality and representation in our community. What could we do to help remove just one barrier on a young person of color’s path to be represented or in a position of influence in Dane County. What could we do to increase diversity in the criminal justice field to bring more empathy and understanding for persons of color.
In that spirit, we have established the Pay it FRWRD Scholarship Fund to help finance a person of color to attend the criminal justice program at Madison College.
Thank you for supporting this effort. Black Lives Matter. Move FRWRD Always, In All Ways.
Meg, Tyler and the FRWRD Hospitality Group"
HPS Scholarship more...

Pearson Engineering
The Pearson Engineering Scholarship is available to students enrolled in a variety of industrial-related one and two year programs and program clusters such as Applied Engineering Technology, Automotive Technology, Diesel Technology, and Manufacturing Programs. Thank you letter: Brian Basken more...

Peggy Spees Schneider Nursing Scholarship
This award was established in memory of Peggy Spees Schneider, a former nursing student at UW Oshkosh. Applicant must be a full-time undergraduate enrolled in the traditional BSN program at the Oshkosh campus. Applicant must have at least junior standing. Applicant must demonstrate a dedication to the nursing profession, qualities of leadership, strong character, striving for high professional standards, and academic achievement. Financial need is not considered a major factor in the selection of the recipient. This award will be paid out in Fall 2022. more...

The Pella VerHalen Design Scholarship is open to Master of Architecture students at the University of Wisconsin-Milwaukee. You must demonstrate design merit to be considered for this award. A portfolio review is also required. more...

Pete And Jill Lundberg Scholarship
Peter and Jill recall the excitement of learning and being in a new and diverse environment where the possibilities seemed endless. We also remember trying to balance multiple part-time jobs during school and know that finances are often challenging. Our hope is to alleviate that burden in a small way, so that a student can concentrate on studies with a little less worry. more...

Applicant must be admitted, or have applied for spring admission, to the College of Nursing and must be pursuing a BSN degree. Applicant must be in good academic standing and must have financial need based on the FAFSA. This award will be paid out in Fall 2022. more...

Piano Scholarship Fund At The University Of Wisconsin-La Crosse (Sac)
freshman, sophomore, junior or senior but must be enrolled currently in an applied piano course to be enrolled full time with a major or minor in music
above average gpa
financial need may be considered
must be accepted into the Department of Music based upon live or taped audition before full faculty
Performance Guidelines
Piano: Two pieces required (at least one memorized): 1) An allegro sonata movement from
Beethoven, Mozart or Haydn OR Prelude and Fugue by J.S. Bach, 2) Any piece composed in the
Romantic or Contemporary Era. Any repertoire substitutions should be addressed PRIOR to the
audition date.
Strings: a 5-10 minute performance of two contrasting styles or movements of Class A-level
solo literature or above. Memorization is optional. Accompaniment is not required, but is
encouraged.*
Winds: a 5-10 minute performance of two contrasting styles or movements of Class A-level
solo literature or above. Memorization is optional. Accompaniment is not required, but is
encouraged.*
Percussion: a 5-10 minute performance of Class A-level solo literature or above on snare drum
OR timpani, AND a keyboard percussion instrument. Memorization is optional.
Accompaniment is not required, but is encouraged.*
Voice: a 5-10 minute performance of contest-quality solo literature. If the length of one piece is
less than five minutes, a second piece of contrasting tempo, style or language is preferred.
Memorization is optional, but suggested. Vocalists must provide their own accompanist.*
All auditionees will be expected to demonstrate sight-reading abilities
A list of local accompanists is available upon request from the Department of Music.
All auditionees must make their own arrangements with their accompanist of choice.

Pickard Scholarships
Scholarship for incoming freshmen accepted to Ripon College. Student must have a minimum 3.8 GPA, ACT score of 30, SAT score of 1340, rank in the top 5% of their class, and be involved in extracurricular activities. Applicant must submit two recommendations, and will be required to attend interview. Renewable; must maintain 3.25 GPA. There is 1 award for $17,000, and 9 awards for $10,000. more...

Plant Sciences Scholarship
The Department of Biological Sciences periodically awards scholarships to students engaged in faculty-led research related to plant sciences. No application is required and students are identified by plant sciences faculty members. more...

Political Science Emerging Scholar Award
This scholarship was created to support political science majors at UW Oshkosh. Recipient must be enrolled in at least 9 credits at the Oshkosh campus. Recipient must have a declared political science major and must have completed Political Science 245 in Spring 2021 or Fall 2021. There is no application for this award. Selection will be based on students’ papers submitted in Political Science 245. This award will be paid out in Spring 2022. more...

Precollege Pipeline Scholarship
Applicant must be an incoming freshman admitted to UW Oshkosh. Students enrolling at any of the UWO campuses are eligible (Fox Cities, Fond du Lac, or Oshkosh). Applicant must have graduated from one of the following WI high schools: Appleton East, Appleton North, Appleton West, Fond du Lac, Menasha, Neenah, Oshkosh North, or Oshkosh West. Applicant must have financial need based on the FAFSA OR Tuition Remission Form (for students not eligible to submit the FAFSA). Applicant must be a first-generation college student and must demonstrate a commitment to social justice. Recipient must enroll full-time in Fall 2022 in order to receive the award disbursement. Award amounts will range in value based on student’s unmet financial need. Awards will be disbursed on a first come, first served basis until all funds are depleted. more...

President's Scholarship - Uw, Superior
The President's Scholarship is available to entering freshmen at the University of Wisconsin, Superior. You must graduate in the top quarter of your class and have a minimum 21 ACT score to be considered for this award. more...

Presidential Scholarship - Edgewood College
The Presidential Scholarship is available to incoming freshmen at Edgewood College. more...

Presidential Scholarship - St. Norbert College
The Presidential Scholarship is available to incoming freshmen at St. Norbert College. You must have a strong college preparatory background to be eligible for this award. more...

Pride Of Oshkosh Art Student Scholarship
Applicant must be enrolled as an undergraduate at the Oshkosh campus and must be majoring in art. Applicant must have at least 60 credits completed. Applicant’s quality of artwork and their ability to articulate their vision are the primary considerations in awarding the scholarship. Applicant’s financial need based on an essay will be of secondary consideration. This award will be paid out in Fall 2022. more...

Professor Bud Weare Scholarship
This award is named in honor of Professor Bud Weare and is given to a student who meets the following criteria.
A student with sophomore, junior or senior standing and an intended or declared major in History. Preference will be given for declared majors.
Demonstrated financial need as shown on the FAFSA.
Demonstrated academic achievement with a minimum GPA of 3.0
Full-time enrollment
Students who have an up-to-date Panther Scholarship Portal General Application and the College of Letters & Science Scholarships and Awards Application will be considered, typically in spring each year between February and April. No additional or separate application is required; students should thoroughly fill out the Panther Scholarship Portal General Application and the College of Letters & Science Scholarships and Awards Application. Awards given in spring are for the following school year so students graduating that same spring or summer are not eligible. E.G. applications reviewed in Spring 2022 are for Fall 2022; students graduating in May or August 2022 are not eligible. more...

Professor Debra Majeed Honors Scholarship
The Professor Debra Majeed Scholarship is awarded to BIPOC undergraduate students enrolled in the Honors College, with a special preference for Milwaukee Public School graduates. It was created to celebrate Dr. Majeed’s lifelong commitment to social justice and to encourage scholarship recipients to use their UWM education as a springboard for a life of meaning and purpose. more...

Professor William J. Woolley History Scholarship
Scholarship for undergraduate students attending Ripon College in Wisconsin full-time, majoring in History. Number of awards varies. Renewable; must remain full-time and have satisfactory progress. more...

Project Assistantship - Uw Madison, Business School
The Project Assistantship is available to MBA students at the University of Wisconsin, Madison, Business School. You must work at least 13 hours per week to be eligible for this award. more...

Prospera Credit Union Freshman Scholarship
This scholarship is awarded to graduating high school senior admitted to UW Oshkosh. Student admitted to the Oshkosh, Fox Cities, or Fond du Lac campuses are eligible to apply. Applicant must be a member of Prospera Credit Union by the application deadline. Applicant must have a minimum high school GPA of 3.0 and must demonstrate community involvement. Recipient must enroll full-time in Fall 2021 in order to receive the award. more...

Prospera Credit Union Undergraduate Scholarship
This scholarship is awarded to an undergraduate enrolled full-time at UW Oshkosh. Students enrolled at the Oshkosh, Fox Cities, or Fond du Lac campuses are eligible to apply. Applicant must be a member of Prospera Credit Union by the application deadline. Applicant must have a minimum cumulative GPA of 3.0 and must demonstrate community involvement. This award will be paid out in Fall 2021. more...

Provost's Scholarship - Uw, Superior
The Provost's Scholarship is available to entering freshmen at the University of Wisconsin, Superior. You must graduate in the top quarter of your class and have a minimum 21 ACT score to be considered for this award. more...

Public Communication-Interpersonal Communications Scholarship
Annual award for incoming freshmen accepted to Cardinal Stritch College in Wisconsin, majoring in Public or Interpersonal Communications. Students must have a minimum 3.0 GPA. Submit one letter of recommendation, a detailed resume of credits and experiences, and a one page essay outlining career objectives with application packet. Number of awards varies. Renewable; maintain 2.5 GPA. more...

Quest Iii Community Engagement Scholarship
This scholarship is for students who have finished a Quest III course and are excited to promote their program and community experience with other students. Applicant must be currently enrolled in at least six credits as an undergraduate student at the Oshkosh campus. Applicant must have successfully completed a Quest III course (or Honors equivalent) and must have a minimum 2.0 cumulative GPA. This award will be paid out in Spring 2021.
Finalists may be asked to complete an interview or submit a short video before recipients are selected. Before the award is disbursed, recipients must give a 10 minute presentation at the Celebration of Scholarship & Creative Activity about their course addressing the following: their experience with their community partner, reflections on what they learned, and insights into either how this could be researched in the future or how they will continue to work with this project in the future. Recipients will also be expected to give an additional presentation at either a University alumni meeting, a Chancellor’s meeting, or other selected event within one year of the award.
For information about the award, please contact Mike Lueder at luederm@uwosh.edu. more...

R.E. Carter Memorial Endowment Scholarship
The R.E. Carter Memorial Endowment Scholarship is available to students at Chippewa Valley Technical College. You must be an automotive maintenance technician and have completed at least 12 credits to be eligible for this award. more...

Rachel Skalitzky Award For Undergraduate Research
The Rachel Skalitzky Award is given as part of the annual WGS Paper and Project competition and recognizes outstanding research by an undergraduate student on a topic related to women’s and gender studies. more...

Racial Justice Community Project Grant
The UWM Urban Studies Program has developed a grant program for Urban Studies majors and Urban Studies certificate students. This program is designed to help students pursue community-based activities that further racial equity and racial justice, broadly defined, in Milwaukee. Grants for up to $500 are available to support work on a project with a community partner or partners. Applications are accepted on a rolling basis except for the period of September 15 through October 15 when the UWM Panther Scholarship Portal is closed for annual software maintenance. Applicants should notify Jamie Harris (jmh@uwm.edu) when they apply so that your application is viewed promptly. Dr. Harris can also be contacted directly with any questions.
Examples of projects include but are not limited to internships, volunteer positions, community organizing, urban gardening, and mentoring or tutoring of elementary or high-school students. Funding may be used for student compensation for unpaid work (such as unpaid internships), supplies and expenses, travel to and from community work sites, and other expenses associated with the community project. Projects must include a community partner, such as an organization or agency hosting internships or volunteer positions. more...

Rada/Melby Scholarship For Information Systems
IS major or 2nd major more...

Radford Boeing Mathematics Scholarship
This scholarship was established in memory of Radford Boeing, UW Oshkosh mathematics faculty member from 1946 to 1969. Applicant must be a full-time undergraduate majoring in mathematics at the Oshkosh campus. Applicant must have financial need based on the FAFSA. Applicant must demonstrate academic achievement in the field of mathematics. This award will be split evenly between the Fall 2022 and Spring 2023 semesters. If the recipient is not enrolled in the spring semester, the second installment will be forfeited. more...

The Ralph L. and Frances A. Jaeschke Arts and Sciences Endowed Scholarship is available to full-time students majoring in the arts or sciences at the University of Wisconsin, Parkside. You must have a minimum 3.3 GPA, demonstrate financial need, and participate in extracurricular activities to be eligible for this renewable award. more...

The Ralph L. Jaeschke Memorial Endowed Mathematics, Physics and Computer Science Scholarship is available to full-time students majoring in Mathematics, Physics or Computer Science at the University of Wisconsin, Parkside. You must have a minimum 3.0 GPA and demonstrate financial need and participate in extracurricular activities to be eligible for this award. more...

Raman J. Ghei / Tower View Investments Scholarship
The Raman J. Ghei/Tower View Investments Scholarship is funded by the generous gifts of Raman J. Ghei. This scholarship is renewable for multiple years pending available funding. It is awarded to a declared major in the College of Letters & Science with a minimum 3.00 cumulative GPA who also meets all of these criteria:
Sophomore standing
Full-time enrollment
First generation student (no parent or grandparent graduated from college)
Demonstrated financial need
An interest/commitment to equity, inclusion or social justice as shown through personal statement, and/or evidence of participation in community, UWM groups or activities with this focus.
Students who have an up-to-date Panther Scholarship Portal General Application and the College of Letters & Science Scholarships and Awards Application will be considered, typically in spring each year between February and April. No additional or separate application is required; students should thoroughly fill out the Panther Scholarship Portal General Application and the College of Letters & Science Scholarships and Awards Application, ensuring that information is provided that meets the criteria of this scholarship. Awards given in spring are for the following school year so students graduating that same spring or summer are not eligible. E.G. applications reviewed in Spring 2022 are for Fall 2022; students graduating in May or August 2022 are not eligible. more...

Rath Family Endowed Scholarship
This scholarship was established by Hilarie Rath ‘81, James Rath ’76, Thomas Rath ’70, ’76, and Mary Rath ’65, all graduates of the University of Wisconsin Oshkosh, in honor of their parents, Hilary and Ardis Rath. This scholarship is awarded to a graduating senior from Two Rivers High School who resides in Two Rivers, WI. Recipient must enroll full-time at the Oshkosh campus in Fall 2022 in order to receive the award. The application and selection process is managed by Two Rivers High School. For more information, please contact the Two Rivers High School Guidance Office. If there is no new recipient in any given year, a previous recipients’ award may be renewed. more...

Oshkosh, Fox Cities, and Fond du Lac campus students are eligible. Full-time enrollment is not required. Applicant must have a documented disability and must be a member of the Project Success program. Applicant must have a minimum 2.75 cumulative GPA and must have earned more than 30 credits. Financial need is not a requirement. This award will be paid out in Fall 2022. more...

Renee And Tom Boldt Scholarship
This scholarship was established by alumna Renee Boldt and her husband, Tom. The purpose of this scholarship is to help highly motivated students with academic ability and financial need achieve their educational goals. Applicant must be an undergraduate student admitted to, or enrolled at, the Oshkosh campus. Applicant must be a WI resident. Applicant must show evidence of scholastic ability and financial need based on the FAFSA. Applications are encouraged from older and other non-traditional students, minorities, previously incarcerated persons, and others who face challenging circumstances. This award will be paid out in Fall 2022. more...

Residence Life Access To Excellence Scholarship
This scholarship is awarded to incoming freshmen admitted to the Oshkosh campus for Summer 2022 or Fall 2022. Applicant must have at least $2,000 of financial need based on the FAFSA. Recipients must enroll full-time and live in an Oshkosh campus residence hall in Fall 2022 and Spring 2023 in order to receive the award. Recipients of this scholarship are not eligible to receive the CAPP Excellence Award, the CAPP Stay A Titan Award, or the Campus Life Award.
In order to be considered for the award, students must submit their General Application in Academic Works; no additional application is necessary. Awards will be made on a first-come, first-served basis using the General Application submission date.
This scholarship will be renewable for a second year provided the recipient maintains a minimum 2.5 cumulative GPA, completes at least 27 credits between Fall 2022 and Spring 2023, continues to live in on-campus housing during their second year, and provided funding is available. more...

Rhc Emergency Fall Award
The University of Wisconsin-Milwaukee Roberto Hernández Center (RHC) has established the Latino Student Fund as a source of emergency funding for currently enrolled Latino/a/x students who face unexpected expenses that affect their continued pursuit of an undergraduate degree. The overall goal of the Latino Student Fund is to increase the number of Latino/a/x students successfully graduating from UWM.
Please be advised that receipt of an Emergency Scholarship can be interpreted as taxable income. If you are awarded money through an Emergency Scholarship, you may receive a 1099 form at the end of the year indicating that the amount of your award is being counted as part of your income. If this occurs, you will be responsible for reporting that income to the IRS. more...

Applicant must be majoring in elementary education. Applicant must have at least junior standing and must have a minimum cumulative GPA of 3.5. This award will be paid out in Fall 2022. more...

Robert A. Wessler General Music Scholarship Endowment Fund (Sac)
at least a junior to be enrolled full time at UW-L with a major in music education with a music emphasis
at least a 3.0 gpa
financial need shall not be considered except as a tie breaker
Performance Guidelines
Piano: Two pieces required (at least one memorized): 1) An allegro sonata movement from
Beethoven, Mozart or Haydn OR Prelude and Fugue by J.S. Bach, 2) Any piece composed in the
Romantic or Contemporary Era. Any repertoire substitutions should be addressed PRIOR to the
audition date.
Strings: a 5-10 minute performance of two contrasting styles or movements of Class A-level
solo literature or above. Memorization is optional. Accompaniment is not required, but is
encouraged.*
Winds: a 5-10 minute performance of two contrasting styles or movements of Class A-level
solo literature or above. Memorization is optional. Accompaniment is not required, but is
encouraged.*
Percussion: a 5-10 minute performance of Class A-level solo literature or above on snare drum
OR timpani, AND a keyboard percussion instrument. Memorization is optional.
Accompaniment is not required, but is encouraged.*
Voice: a 5-10 minute performance of contest-quality solo literature. If the length of one piece is
less than five minutes, a second piece of contrasting tempo, style or language is preferred.
Memorization is optional, but suggested. Vocalists must provide their own accompanist.*
All auditionees will be expected to demonstrate sight-reading abilities
A list of local accompanists is available upon request from the Department of Music.
All auditionees must make their own arrangements with their accompanist of choice.
Questions may be referred to: Dr. Christopher Frye, Department of Music Scholarship
Committee, phone: (608) 785 – 6729 or e-mail: frye.chri@uwlax.edu more...

Robert H. And Randall K. Zentner Music Scholarship
This scholarship was established at the Oshkosh Area Community Foundation in 2016 by Randall K. Zentner, a 1978 music education graduate of UW Oshkosh, long-time Oshkosh music educator and life-long advocate for public education and UW Oshkosh. The scholarship is named, in part, in honor of his father, Robert H. Zentner, who supported education and was proud of his son’s educational accomplishments.
This scholarship is available to full-time undergraduate students majoring in music or music education at the UW Oshkosh, Oshkosh campus. Preference will be given to music education majors. Applicants must have a minimum 3.0 GPA on all coursework. Applicant must have a high level of musical participation and service, commitment to excellence and improvement in their voice or instrumental performance and dedication to their area of professional study. Applicant must have excelled academically as well as demonstrate outstanding leadership qualities. Financial need may be considered. Students must be enrolled in Fall 2021 in order to receive the award payout.
To apply for this scholarship, download the scholarship application by clicking the “visit” button below. Scholarship applications must be mailed to or dropped off at the Oshkosh Area Community Foundation. more...

Katzman, Sr. This scholarship was created by Bob’s son and UW Oshkosh alumnus, Russell “Russ” Katzman, in order to help ease the educational burden on those looking to create their own entrepreneurial legacy. Applicant must be admitted or enrolled as a full-time undergraduate or graduate student at the Oshkosh campus. Applicant must be pursuing a bachelor or master’s degree and must have a minimum 3.0 cumulative GPA. Oshkosh, Fox Cities, and Fond du Lac campus students are eligible. Applicant must be a member in good standing of Project Success. Undergraduate students must have between 45 and 85 credits completed and must have a minimum 2.75 cumulative GPA. Graduate students must have a minimum 3.25 cumulative GPA. Preference will be given to students who have taken additional simultaneous multisensory coursework and who have given back to the Project Success program through paid and volunteer experiences. Preference will be given to applicants with financial need based on the FAFSA. This award will be split evenly between the Fall 2022 and Spring 2023 semesters. Scholarships Open To Undocumented Students
My (Un)Documented Life offers up-to-date information & resources for undocumented immigrants including available scholarship opportunities. more...

Schwartz Injury Law Perseverance Scholarship
Our Orland Park personal injury law firm advocates for victims of serious car accidents, medical malpractice, and other catastrophic injuries. For the Fall 2022 semester, we are offering our $1,000 Perseverance Scholarship to support the education of a student who overcame a severe injury or medical issue in their life.
Applicants for the Schwartz Injury Law Perseverance Scholarship must be enrolled at an accredited college or university within the United States during the Fall 2022 semester.
Students must submit their contact information, proof of enrollment, and a professional headshot. Additionally, an application must include an original essay of 500-1000 words addressing the following prompt: more...

Sentry Insurance Foundation Student Leadership
The Sentry Insurance Foundation Student Leadership is available to incoming freshmen at the University of Wisconsin-Stout. You must be in the top 15 percent of your graduating class, be involved in extracurricular and community service activities, and be majoring in Applied Math (Actuarial Science)/Computer Science (MIS) to be eligible for this renewable award. more...

Sentry Insurance Leadership Foundation, Inc. Freshmen Leadership Scholarship
Scholarship for incoming freshmen enrolling at the Univeristy of Wisconsin who will be majoring in Business, Mathematics (Applied/Actuarial emphasis) or Computer Science. Applicants must rank in the top 15% of their high school graduating class and demonstrate outstanding leadership potential. Renewable. more...

Sentry Insurance Student Leadership Scholarship - Uwec
The Sentry Insurance Student Leadership Scholarship is open to incoming freshmen at the University of Wisconsin, Eau Claire. You must rank in the top 15 percent of you graduating class and be majoring in one of the following fields of study: business administration, computer science, information systems, accounting, finance, mathematics, or engineering. You must rank in the top 15 percent of your graduating class and be involved in extracurricular activities, community activities and charitable organizations. Special consideration is given to the dependents of Sentry Insurance employees. more...

Serra Transfer Scholarship
Scholarship for incoming transfer students attending Cardinal Stritch University in Wisconsin. Applicants must have completed at least 24 credit hours and have a minimum 3.0 GPA. Award amount is based on GPA. Due date, number of awards and award amount varies. Renewable; maintain 3.0 GPA. more...

Shane M. Hopfensperger Scholarship
The Shane M. Hopfensperger Scholarship is available to undergraduate students majoring in construction at the University of Wisconsin-Stout. You must be a member of the Student Construction Association and demonstrate financial need to be eligible for this award. more...

Sharon & Rod Depue Family Scholarship
For individuals who were in the Foster Care system and are Bachelor degree-seeking, as well as a Milwaukee County resident with demonstrated financial need (completed FAFSA), eligible for in-state tuition. Preference for graduates of a Milwaukee Public School and those from the Milwaukee County foster care system. This scholarship is renewable for four academic years (five total). more...

Shirley Tipler Schultz Scholarship
This scholarship was established in memory of Shirley Tipler Schultz ’56. Applicant must be a full-time business major enrolled at the Oshkosh campus. Applicant must in good standing and must be admitted, or have applied for spring admission, to the College of Business. Applicant must have at least sophomore standing and must have a minimum 3.0 GPA. The scholarship will be awarded based on need as outlined in an applicant statement. This award will be paid out in Fall 2021. more...

Sigma Lambda Chi Scholarship - Univ. Of Wisconsin, Stout
The Sigma Lambda Chi Scholarship is available to junior and senior students majoring in construction at the University of Wisconsin-Stout. You must have a minimum 2.5 GPA and demonstrate financial need to be eligible for this award. more...

Sister Caroline Marie Sloan Scholarship
Scholarship for incoming freshmen students accepted to Mount Mary College in Wisconsin full-time. Applicant must have 7 points to qualify for this award; awards are based on students test scores, cumulative GPA and class rank. Applicants must add the highest two of the three academic point values for a composite academic score (up to 12 points), then locate your points and the appropriate scholarship award amount. Due date and number of awards varies. Renewable. more...

Sister Dominic Cunningham Scholarship
Scholarship for incoming freshmen students accepted to Mount Mary College in Wisconsin full-time. Applicant must have 2 points to qualify for this award; awards are based on students test scores, cumulative GPA and class rank. Applicants must add the highest two of the three academic point values for a composite academic score (up to 12 points), then locate your points and the appropriate scholarship award amount. Due date and number of awards varies. Renewable. more...

Sister Irene Kohne Scholarship
This scholarship was established in honor of Sister Irene Kohne of Fond du Lac, recipient of a UW Oshkosh Honorary Doctorate of Science in 1992. Applicant must be an undergraduate enrolled at the Oshkosh campus. Applicant must have at least 30 credits completed and must be from Fond du Lac County. Applicant must demonstrate involvement in community service projects, charitable organizations, and/or extracurricular activities (excluding athletics) with an emphasis on involvement in activities directly related to serving others. Applicants demonstrating financial need based on an essay and meeting all other requirements may be given special consideration in the selection process. This award will be split evenly between the Fall 2022 and Spring 2023 semesters. If the recipient is not enrolled in the spring semester, the second installment will be forfeited. more...

Sister Mary Eugene Coleman Scholarship
Scholarship for incoming freshmen students accepted to Mount Mary College in Wisconsin full-time. Applicant must have 5 points to qualify for this award; awards are based on students test scores, cumulative GPA and class rank. Applicants must add the highest two of the three academic point values for a composite academic score (up to 12 points), then locate your points and the appropriate scholarship award amount. Due date and number of awards varies. Renewable. more...

Scholarship for incoming freshmen students accepted to Mount Mary College in Wisconsin full-time. Applicant must have 6 points to qualify for this award; awards are based on students test scores, cumulative GPA and class rank. Applicants must add the highest two of the three academic point values for a composite academic score (up to 12 points), then locate your points and the appropriate scholarship award amount. Due date and number of awards varies. Renewable. more...

Applicant must have 3 points to qualify for this award; awards are based on students test scores, cumulative GPA and class rank. Applicants must add the highest two of the three academic point values for a composite academic score (up to 12 points), then locate your points and the appropriate scholarship award amount. Due date and number of awards varies. Renewable. more...
