Applicant must have 4 points to qualify for this award; awards are based on students test scores, cumulative GPA and class rank. Applicants must add the highest two of the three academic point values for a composite academic score (up to 12 points), then locate your points and the appropriate scholarship award amount. Due date and number of awards varies. Renewable. more...

Applicant must have 8 points to qualify for this award; awards are based on students test scores, cumulative GPA and class rank. Applicants must add the highest two of the three academic point values for a composite academic score (up to 12 points), then locate your points and the appropriate scholarship award amount. Deadlines and award amounts may vary. Contact the colleges financial aid office or the Foundation for more information and/or application. more...

Society For Human Resource Managment (Shrm) Club Scholarship
Scholarship for undergraduate students attending the University of Wisconsin-Oshkosh who are majoring in Human Resources and are members of the SHRM Club. Applicants must have a minimum 3.0 GPA and participate in the Club Point System. Number of awards may vary. Nonrenewable. more...

Society Of Manufacturing Engineers Scholarship
The Society of Manufacturing Engineers Scholarship is available to students majoring in manufacturing engineering at the University of Wisconsin-Stout. You must have a minimum 3.0 GPA to be eligible for this award. more...

Sociology Department Award For Undergraduates
The Department of Sociology recognizes outstanding sociology bachelor’s degree students with various merit awards. Students who have an up-to-date Panther Scholarship Portal General Application and the College of Letters & Science Scholarships and Awards Application will be considered, typically in fall each year. No additional or separate application is required; students should thoroughly fill out the Panther Scholarship Portal General Application and the College of Letters & Science Scholarships and Awards Application. more...

Sociology Department Awards - Graduate Students
The Department of Sociology recognizes outstanding sociology graduate students with various merit awards including, but not limited to, Best Graduate Student Paper, Outstanding Teaching Assistant, etc. Students are selected by a faculty committee. Students are typically selected during the fall semester each year. more...

Sociology Scholarship
Scholarship for undergraduate students attending Cardinal Stritch University in Wisconsin, majoring in Sociology. Due date, number of awards, and award amount varies. more...

Som N. Ghei And Ram Kaur Ghei Scholarship
Applicant must be a female student enrolled full- or part-time at the Oshkosh campus. Applicant must be a psychology major with two to four semesters remaining at UW Oshkosh. Applicant must have a minimum 3.0 GPA and must have financial need (the FAFSA is not required). Applicant must be planning to attend graduate school in psychology. This award will be paid out in Fall 2021. Recipient may be eligible to receive a one-time renewal of this scholarship provided they enroll in the UW Oshkosh Psychology Graduate Program and funding is available. more...

Som N. Gheir & Ram Kaur Ghei Scholarship
Scholarship for female juniors or seniors attending the University of Wisconsin-Oshkosh who are majoring in Psychology. Applicants must have a minimum 3.0 GPA, financial need and be planning to attend graduate school. Due date may vary. Nonrenewable. more...

Stanley H. Ostrand Uwfv Scholarship

Students must have a minimum 2.6 CGPA. Due date and number of awards may vary. Contact the colleges finacial aid office or the Foundation for more information and/or application. more...

Stanley Linton Memorial Scholarship In Choral And General Music Education
This scholarship was established in memory of Stanley Linton, coordinator of music education at UW Oshkosh from 1952 to 1984. Applicant must be a full-time music education major who is admitted to the Teacher Education Program at the Oshkosh campus. Applicant must have earned at a minimum 3.0 GPA overall and in all music courses. Applicant must demonstrate a commitment to teaching. Financial need based on an essay may be considered, but only as a subordinate criterion in the selection process. This award will be paid out in Fall 2022. more...

Stanley Ostrand Memorial Scholarship
The Stanley Ostrand Memorial Scholarship is available to students at University of Wisconsin, Fox Valley. You must have wrestled on a high school varsity team for at least two years, have a minimum GPA of 2.5 and plan to transfer to UW- La Crosse, UW- Green Bay or UW- Oshkosh to qualify for this award. more...

Stanley Talarek Scholarship
Scholarship for juniors or seniors attending the University of Wisconsin-Oshkosh who are majoring in Special Education. Applicants must have completed the sophomore practicum. Number of awards may vary. Nonrenewable. more...

String Quartet Scholarship
This award is given to string quartet members who are currently enrolled at the Oshkosh campus. It is awarded at the discretion of the UW Oshkosh Music Department; no application is required for this award. For more information, please contact the UW Oshkosh Music Department at music@uwosh.edu. This award will be split evenly between the Fall 2021 and Spring 2022 semesters. If the recipient is not enrolled in the spring semester, the second installment will be forfeited. more...

Student Construction Association Scholarship
The Student Construction Association Scholarship is available to students at the University of Wisconsin-Stout. You must be majoring in construction and be a member of the UW-Stout Student Construction Association to qualify for this award. more...

Student Honors Art Exhibition Award
This award is given to students who have work exhibited in the Student Honors Exhibition. Recipient must be enrolled at UW Oshkosh and must have been enrolled in an art class when the work was created. Awards are given for the Best in 2D, Best in 3D, Best in Graphic Design, Best in Digital Media, and Honorable Mentions. There is no application for this award. Selection is based on demonstration of technical and intellectual excellence. These awards will be paid out in Spring 2022. more...

Student Playwriting Contest Award
This Award is given to a student enrolled at the University of Wisconsin Oshkosh. Students enrolled at any campus (Oshkosh, Fox Cities, or Fond du Lac) are eligible. To be considered, students must submit an original script of 25-30 pages in a double-spaced, bound, play-script format to the theatre department office. There is no application required within Academic Works for this award. The award will be paid out in Spring 2022. more...

Study Abroad Scholarship
This scholarship supports undergraduate students from any major leading to a bachelor’s degree going on an approved study abroad experience outside of the United States. Students must have demonstrated financial need, a minimum cumulative GPA of 2.50, and preference will be given to first-generation students. Students also must be accepted into a UWM approved study abroad experience through UWM’s Center for International Education (CIE) or in the process of applying for a study abroad experience through CIE. Applications are typically accepted in November/December for Spring study abroad and in February/March for Summer and Fall study abroad. more...

Sullivan-Spaights Scholarship
Intended for full-time underrepresented minority students from Milwaukee Public High Schools with demonstrated community leadership, a cumulative GPA of 3.0 or higher and financial need. Renewable to students who continue to meet the requirements. (Current recipients do not need to re-apply). A letter of recommendation is strongly suggested for this opportunity. more...

Summer Fellowship In Government & Community Service
Annual fellowship for full-time medical students to gain knowledge of state government and the private sector delivering health care service to the public. Fellowship is an 8-10 week course held at University of Wisconsin-Madison Medical School or the Medical College of Wisconsin. Applicants must be U.S. citizens and be members of the Wisconsin Medical Society. Number of awards may vary. Nonrenewable. more...

Susan Hardy Heaney Memorial Scholarship
This scholarship was established by the family of Susan Hardy Heaney of Oshkosh. It is awarded to incoming freshmen admitted to the Oshkosh campus for Summer 2022 or Fall 2022. Applicant must have a minimum 3.0 high school GPA and must plan to major in nursing, special education, social work, or human services. Selection is based on academic achievement, involvement in extra-curricular and community activities, and financial need. Recipient must enroll full-time in Fall 2022 in order to receive the award. more...

Susan Hardy Heaney Memorial Scholarship
Scholarship for incoming freshmen enrolling at the University of Wisconsin-Oshkosh who will be majoring in Nursing, Special Education, Social Work or Human Services. Applicants must have graduated in the top 25% of class. Nonrenewable. more...

Annual award for South Wood County, Wisconsin resident, who is a sophomore or higher college student at an accredited four-year college or university pursuing a degree in the field of Engineering. Preference will be given to students attending the University of Wisconsin-Madison. Award amount varies. more...

1. Recipient must be enrolled full time at UW-La Crosse.
2. Recipient must be in good academic standing.
3. Recipient must be from a rural town in Wisconsin with a population of less than 6,000.
4. Recipient may be junior or senior.
5. Financial need must be considered. more...

In order to be considered eligible for The Triumph Over Adversity Scholarship, students must be currently enrolled in an undergraduate, graduate, or law program within the United States. High school seniors who will be enrolled in college the following semester are also eligible to apply. All applicants must have a minimum cumulative GPA of 3.0 on a 4.0 scale. more...

2. Recipient must be junior or senior
3. Recipient must be in good academic standing with a cumulative grade point average of not less than 3.5
4. Recipient must be female
5. Recipient preference to be given to a student who is actively involved on the UW-La Crosse campus and/or in the La Crosse Community more...

The Darlene Joan Zielinski Parker Scholarship For Social Justice Fund
must be enrolled full time at UW-La Crosse with a major in elementary education
must be in good academic standing with above average grade point average
must be dedicated to and involved in social justice issues on campus or in their home or La Crosse community
will be required to submit a 1-2 page essay describing how she/he would attempt to implement a curriculum addressing racism, sexism and homophobia
recipient may be a freshman, sophomore, junior or senior
financial need should be considered more...

The Eckman Scholarship
This scholarship is given to a meritorious Linguistics master’s level student or junior or senior Linguistics major.
Students who have an up-to-date Panther Scholarship Portal General Application and the College of Letters & Science Scholarships and Awards Application will be considered, typically in spring each year between February and April. No additional or separate application is required; students should thoroughly fill out the Panther Scholarship Portal General Application and the College of Letters & Science Scholarships and Awards Application. Awards given in spring are for the following school year so students graduating that same spring or summer are not eligible. E.G. applications reviewed in Spring 2022 are for Fall 2022; students graduating in May or August 2022 are not eligible. more...

The Gloria Dixon Dream & Believe Scholarship
This scholarship is given to a student in the College of Letters & Science who meets all of the following criteria:
Full-time status
Sophomore or junior standing as of August 31, 2021
A declared major in one of these majors: mathematical sciences, applied math and computer science, data science, geosciences, neuroscience, physics, biological sciences, microbiology, chemistry, biochemistry, psychology (BS track only)
Graduate of a high school in the Milwaukee Public School system (MPS) – preference given to a student who graduated from Riverside University High School
At least one of these: (1) a demonstrated commitment to, or interest in, racial equity, diversity or social justice or (2) personal circumstances that present barriers to higher education such as experience in foster care, living in a single parent household, having an incarcerated parent, responsibilities for providing financial support or primary care for other household members, or overcoming personal adversity. Students should address this criteria in their application, including for example, an explanation of the personal circumstances or a commitment to diversity and equity as shown by participation in community groups or activities with this focus
Preference given to a student with demonstrated financial need as shown on the FAFSA
This scholarship is for the Spring 2022 semester; students graduating December 2021 are not eligible. more...

The Jeffrey & Carrie Hoye Academic Scholarship
The Hoye Scholarship is funded by a generous donation from Jeffrey and Carrie Hoye. Eligible applicants will be full-time undergraduates, with Junior or Senior standing, who have demonstrated financial need. Other criteria include a minimum 3.25 GPA and a declared STEM major in one of these academic disciplines: Math, Geosciences, Conservation & Environmental Science, Physics, Chemistry & Biochemistry, Biology, Data Science, any engineering field, Applied Math and Computer Science, Neuroscience, or Computer Science.
Students who have an up-to-date Panther Scholarship Portal General Application and the College of Letters & Science Scholarships and Awards Application will be considered, typically in spring each year between February and April. No additional or separate application is required; students should thoroughly fill out the Panther Scholarship Portal General Application and the College of Letters & Science Scholarships and Awards Application. Awards given in spring are for the following school year so students graduating that same spring or summer are not eligible. E.G. applications reviewed in Spring 2022 are for Fall 2022; students graduating in May or August 2022 are not eligible. more...

● Must be a new incoming student to UWL (first-year or transfer) and enrolled full-time
● First preference shall be given to a multicultural student, especially one that is a first-generation college student
● The second preference is for any student that is a first-generation college student
● Financial need may be considered more...

Theatre Scholarships
Scholarship for incoming freshmen accepted to Ripon College, who are active in Theatre. Student must submit two letters of recommendation, and attend an interview and/or audition with the drama faculty. Candidate must have proven talent in performing arts, commitment to academic excellence and school/community service. Award is renewable as long as student remains active in theatre. more...

Thedacare Pre-Nursing Scholarship
The ThedaCare Pre- Nursing Scholarship is available to students at University of Wisconsin, Fox Valley. You must be majoring in nursing, have a minimum GPA of 3.0 and demonstrate activity within the community to qualify for this award. Preference is given to students planning to attend UW Oshkosh who plan to stay in the Fox Valley area and seek employment within the ThedaCare system. more...

Theodore Saloutos Award For Phd Dissertation Research In American History
The Theodore Saloutos Award for PhD Dissertation Research in American History is given to a graduate student in the Department of History who is in dissertator status and whose dissertation topic is in American history. Preference will be given to students whose dissertation topic is in American immigration or American agricultural history. Applications are typically accepted in spring each year between February and April. more...

Thomas & Margaret Annett Scholarship For The Arts (Sac)
preferably a senior piano student; if a piano student cannot be identified, the next choice would be a student who plays a stringed instrument
at least a 3.5 gpa
Performance Guidelines
Piano: Two pieces required (at least one memorized): 1) An allegro sonata movement from
Beethoven, Mozart or Haydn OR Prelude and Fugue by J.S. Bach, 2) Any piece composed in the
Romantic or Contemporary Era. Any repertoire substitutions should be addressed PRIOR to the
audition date.
Strings: a 5-10 minute performance of two contrasting styles or movements of Class A-level
solo literature or above. Memorization is optional. Accompaniment is not required, but is
encouraged.*
Winds: a 5-10 minute performance of two contrasting styles or movements of Class A-level
solo literature or above. Memorization is optional. Accompaniment is not required, but is
encouraged.*
Percussion: a 5-10 minute performance of Class A-level solo literature or above on snare drum
OR timpani, AND a keyboard percussion instrument. Memorization is optional.
Accompaniment is not required, but is encouraged.*
Voice: a 5-10 minute performance of contest-quality solo literature. If the length of one piece is
less than five minutes, a second piece of contrasting tempo, style or language is preferred.
Memorization is optional, but suggested. Vocalists must provide their own accompanist.*
All auditionees will be expected to demonstrate sight-reading abilities
A list of local accompanists is available upon request from the Department of Music.
All auditionees must make their own arrangements with their accompanist of choice.
Questions may be referred to: Dr. Christopher Frye, Department of Music Scholarship
Committee, phone: (608) 785 – 6729 or e-mail: frye.chri@uwlax.edu more...

Thomas A. Plein Memorial Endowed Scholarship
Applicant must be a graduate or undergraduate student enrolled in a minimum of six credits in a degree-seeking program at the Oshkosh campus. Applicant must have financial need based on the FAFSA. Applicant must demonstrate excellence in academic achievement under distressed conditions. This award will be paid out in Fall 2022. more...

Thomas H. Annett Scholarship (Sac)
sophomore, junior or senior to be enrolled full time with a major in music
good academic standing
Performance Guidelines
Piano: Two pieces required (at least one memorized): 1) An allegro sonata movement from
Beethoven, Mozart or Haydn OR Prelude and Fugue by J.S. Bach, 2) Any piece composed in the
Romantic or Contemporary Era. Any repertoire substitutions should be addressed PRIOR to the
audition date.
Strings: a 5-10 minute performance of two contrasting styles or movements of Class A-level
solo literature or above. Memorization is optional. Accompaniment is not required, but is
encouraged.*
Winds: a 5-10 minute performance of two contrasting styles or movements of Class A-level
solo literature or above. Memorization is optional. Accompaniment is not required, but is
encouraged.*
Percussion: a 5-10 minute performance of Class A-level solo literature or above on snare drum
OR timpani, AND a keyboard percussion instrument. Memorization is optional.
Accompaniment is not required, but is encouraged.*
Voice: a 5-10 minute performance of contest-quality solo literature. If the length of one piece is
less than five minutes, a second piece of contrasting tempo, style or language is preferred.
Memorization is optional, but suggested. Vocalists must provide their own accompanist.*
All auditionees will be expected to demonstrate sight-reading abilities
A list of local accompanists is available upon request from the Department of Music.
All auditionees must make their own arrangements with their accompanist of choice.
Questions may be referred to: Dr. Christopher Frye, Department of Music Scholarship
Committee, phone: (608) 785 – 6729 or e-mail: frye.chri@uwlax.edu more...

Thomas J. Bontly Fiction Award
The Thomas J. Bontly Fiction Award is given to a graduate student in the Department of English who has produced an exceptional work of fiction. more...

Thompson-Thiex Memorial Scholarship
Scholarship for full-time undergraduate students attending Lawrence University majoring in Organ Performance. If no organ majors apply scholarship may be awarded to a Music Education major. Contact the university for more information and/or application. more...

1. Recipient must be enrolled full time at UW-La Crosse
2. Recipient must be in good academic standing
3. Recipient must have a relative who is a UWL alum or be an alum themselves
4. Recipient must be a graduate student
5. Financial need must be considered more...

Timothy George Vrakas Memorial Scholarship
The Timothy George Vrakas Memorial Scholarship is given to a biochemistry major or intended major with high academic achievement, demonstrated financial need, and junior or senior standing.
Students who have an up-to-date Panther Scholarship Portal General Application and the College of Letters & Science Scholarships and Awards Application will be considered, typically in spring each year between February and April. No additional or separate application is required; students should thoroughly fill out the Panther Scholarship Portal General Application and the College of Letters & Science Scholarships and Awards Application. Awards given in spring are for the following school year so students graduating that same spring or summer are not eligible. E.G. applications reviewed in Spring 2022 are for Fall 2022; students graduating in May or August 2022 are not eligible. more...

Tinsley Helton Dissertation Fellowship
The Tinsley Helton Dissertation Fellowship is given to a student in the Department of English studying Literary Studies, Creative Writing, or Composition who is in the dissertation phase of their degree. Eligible students must have completed all of their PhD coursework and met the PhD residency requirements. Eligible students will have passed their preliminary exams and their dissertation topic will have been approved. Faculty advisors will be consulted and the selected student will have received a strong recommendation amongst the faculty. There is no application required. more...

Titan Scholarship
This scholarship was established in 2019 based on the fundraising efforts of Jon Lica, ’09. Applicant must be an undergraduate student enrolled at the Oshkosh campus. Applicant must be a degree-seeking student. Applicant must have junior standing and must have a minimum 3.0 cumulative GPA. Applicant must be actively involved in activities outside the classroom, such as extra-curricular activities, volunteer activities, or working. Due to NCAA division III regulations, athletic involvement cannot be considered in the selection of scholarships. This award will be paid out in Fall 2021. more...

Titan Thunder Capp Scholarship
This scholarship is awarded to high school Cooperative Academic Partnership Program (CAPP) students who have been admitted to UW Oshkosh as incoming freshmen for Summer 2022 or Fall 2022 and are planning to join the marching band. Students attending the Oshkosh, Fox Cities, or the Fond du Lac campus are eligible to apply. Applicant must apply during their senior year of high school. Applicant must have either successfully completed at least one CAPP course or be currently enrolled in a CAPP course at the time of application. Recipients must be enrolled full-time and must be enrolled in MUSIC 156 (Titan Thunder Marching Band) in Fall 2022 to receive the award. This scholarship is not renewable. Students may apply for the CAPP Scholarship and the Titan Thunder CAPP Scholarship, but are only eligible to receive one of the awards. more...

Titans Access Campus Scholarship
This scholarship is awarded to incoming freshman who are admitted to the Fox Cities or Fond du Lac campus for Summer 2022 or Fall 2022. Applicant must have a minimum 2.4 high school GPA. Selection will be based on financial need and community involvement. Recipient must enroll full-time in order to receive the award. This award will be paid out in Fall 2022. more...

Titans First Generation Scholarship
This scholarship is given to incoming freshmen who are admitted to the Oshkosh campus for Summer 2023 or Fall 2023. Applicant must have a minimum 2.8 high school GPA and must be a first-generation college student. Selection is based on a holistic approach that considers the applicant’s academic history and grade-point average, extracurricular participation, community involvement, and financial need. Priority may be given to students who have financial need based on the FAFSA, students who are first generation college students, and those who excel academically. Recipient must enroll full-time in order to receive the award. This award will be paid out in Fall 2023. more...

Titans Promise Incoming Freshman Scholarship
This scholarship is given to incoming freshmen who are admitted to the Oshkosh campus for Summer 2022 or Fall 2022. Applicant must have a minimum 2.8 high school GPA. Selection will be based on financial need and community involvement. Recipient must enroll full-time in order to receive the award. This award will be paid out in Fall 2022. more...

Titans Promise Transfer Scholarship
This scholarship is given to incoming transfer students who are admitted to the Oshkosh campus for Spring 2022. Students transferring from the Fox Cities or Fond du Lac campuses are not eligible. Applicant must have at least 12 transfer credits earned, but no more than 90 transfer credits earned or in progress at the time of application. Applicant must have a minimum 2.75 transfer GPA. Selection will be based on financial need and community involvement. Recipient must enroll full-time in order to receive the award. This award will be paid out in Spring 2022. more...

Tommie A. Harsley Scholarship
Students who apply for the Tommie A. Harsley Scholarship must:
• Be currently enrolled at an accredited US college or university as a Freshman, Sophomore, or Junior more...

Tommy G. Thompson Leadership Scholarship
To be eligible for this award, a student must:
• Be enrolled as a full-time student at UWL
• Be in good academic standing at the time of application;
• Be a degree-seeking student at the time of application and at the time they receive the award;
• Has not received the Tommy G. Thompson Scholarship in the prior year. (The scholarships are one-time, non-renewable, and non-transferable);
• Submit their cumulative undergraduate GPA from the undergraduate campus from which they are applying (This means that students without a cumulative GPA [e.g., freshmen] are ineligible); and
• Agrees to attend one Thompson Center event during the year of scholarship.
Additionally, to be eligible for this award, a student must:
• Submit a personal statement/biographical sketch that is no more than 450 words. (The personal statement/biographical sketch may be posted on the Thompson Center website and used in press releases if the candidate is selected for a scholarship.) The biographical sketch must include:
o The candidate’s definition or understanding of leadership;
o A discussion of how the candidate demonstrated leadership during their time on campus;
o The candidate’s aspirations; and
o An explanation of the ways in which the candidate’s leadership reflects Governor Thompson’s spirit and legacy of bringing people together to develop common-sense solutions.
The candidate may wish to include within this statement a brief description of any relevant volunteering, internships, or employment they have undertaken that reflect a spirit of leadership.
• Provide a copy of an up-to-date academic transcript, which thereby grants permission to the review panel(s) to consider it as part of the scholarship application. The student may include a brief appendix that summarizes any classes that relate to leadership or the personal statement/biographical sketch. more...

Transfer Academic Scholarship - Northland College
The Transfer Academic Scholarship is available to transfer students at Northland College. Transfer students from two- and four-year colleges are eligible for this award based on cumulative academic record. more...

Transfer Student Scholarship - St. Norbert College
The Transfer Student Scholarships are available to incoming full - time transfer students at St. Norbert College. Your selection for this award will be based on educational records, standardized test scores and extracurricular activities. more...

Trio Student Degree Completion & Transfer Scholarship
The TRiO Student Degree Completion & Transfer Scholarship Fund has been established to increase degree attainment and transfer rates among TRiO Student Support Services participants. TRiO SSS serves the most ‘at-risk’ students on the Madison College campus with more than 86% of the program participants possessing two or more of the following barriers: first-generation college student, low-income student, and student with a documented disability. The founders of this scholarship hope that this gift to students will serve to motivate them, celebrate their achievements and help to offset the financial burden of postsecondary education. more...

Trustee Distinguished Scholarship
The Trustee Distinguished Scholarship is available to incoming freshmen at St. Norbert College. You must maintain good social standing and a minimum 3.0 GPA to be eligible for this renewable award. more...

Trustees Distinguished Scholarship
Scholarship for incoming freshmen accepted to St. Norbert College. This is a prestigious scholarship awarded to exceptionally talented students based on high school courses and involvement in and out of high school. Student must rank in the top 10% of their class, have a minimum 3.75 GPA, a minimum ACT composite score of 27 or a combined SAT score above the 90th percentile. Due date and number of awards may vary. Renewable. more...

Have completed an internship at UW Health.
or
Have graduated from the Caminos Certified Nursing Assistant Program
and
You must be enrolled in 6 or more credits during the upcoming semester
You must be planning to enroll in one of the following degree programs: Associate Degree Nursing, Medical (Clinical) Laboratory Technician, Nursing Completion, Occupational Therapy Assistant, Physical Therapy Assistant, Radiography, Respiratory Therapist, Medical Assistant, Medical Coding Specialist, Nursing Assistant, Optomtetric Technician, Surgical Technologist, Clinical Ophthalmic Assistant, Mammography, Phlebotomy, Polysomnography or Liberal Arts Transfer Program
You may also apply for this scholarship if you are a UW Health employee in the Industrial Maintenance Technician program.

Vicki Lord Larson Endowed Scholarship
This scholarship was established in honor of Vicki Lord Larson, the first woman to serve as Provost and Vice Chancellor of Academic Affairs at UW Oshkosh. Applicant must be a female undergraduate enrolled at the Oshkosh campus. Applicant must have earned between 30 and 80 credits at the time of application, with at least half of the credits earned at UW Oshkosh. Applicant must have a minimum 3.0 UWO cumulative GPA. Applicant must demonstrate contributions to the University and community with preference given to students who show leadership in activities focused on women (excluding athletic participation). Activities can be, but are not limited to, working for equal rights for women, volunteering in organizations that support women and their families, raising awareness of women’s health issues, engaging in women’s social issues, or participating as a leader in issues of concern to both men and women, but traditionally labeled “women’s issues.” Financial need based on the FAFSA will be of secondary consideration only. This award will be paid out in Fall 2021. more...

The Virginia Burke Award is given to students who demonstrate excellence in English 102 – College Writing and Research. Only degree-seeking bachelor’s level students at the Milwaukee main campus are eligible for this award. Associate degree students who take CGS ENG 102 are not eligible, and flex students are also not eligible. Applications are typically accepted late in Spring semester for students who took Eng 102 during the previous year. more...

Applicant must demonstrate financial need based on the FAFSA and must not qualify for need-based grants (loans are acceptable). This award will be paid out in Fall 2022. more...

Whitburn Graduate Assistant Tuition Remission Award
The UW Oshkosh Whitburn Center for Governance and Policy Research offers a graduate research assistant position. Students holding this position are eligible to receive a tuition remission award. To be eligible for the award, the graduate assistant must hold a minimum 33% FTE appointment and must be enrolled in a minimum of six credits at UW Oshkosh. The tuition remission will be applied to the recipient’s student account as a scholarship each semester they are eligible to receive the award. The recipient is responsible for paying their segregated fees and any other fees. The award is contingent on available funding. more...

Wilder Crane Memorial Scholarship
The Wilder Crane Memorial Scholarship is given to a political science major or a political science graduate student with demonstrated high academic achievement and engagement in the field of study. In order to be considered for this scholarship as an undergraduate, students must be in their senior year with defined plans for graduate study after college.
Students who have an up-to-date Panther Scholarship Portal General Application and the College of Letters & Science Scholarships and Awards Application will be considered, typically in fall between November and December and again in spring between February and April. No additional or separate application is required as long as the student has thoroughly filled out the Panther Scholarship Portal General Application and the College of Letters & Science Scholarships and Awards Application. Awards given are for the following semester year so students graduating that same semester are not eligible. E.G. applications reviewed in Spring 2022 are for Fall 2022; students graduating in May or August 2022 are not eligible. more...

Preference will be given to applicants with a Nurse Educator emphasis who have an interest in teaching in an academic setting and a future goal of achieving a PhD in nursing. William F. Halloran Scholarship
The William F. Halloran Scholarship is given to sophomores with a major in the College of Letters & Science. Eligibility criteria include:
Minimum 3.5 cumulative GPA

Declared or intended major in the humanities division of the College of Letters & Science (English, foreign languages, comparative literature, Latin American, Caribbean and US Latinx studies, religious studies, philosophy, communication, art history, Jewish studies, ethnic studies, digital arts and culture, classics, film studies, or women’s and gender studies)
Demonstrated leadership as evidenced through extracurricular activity, volunteer work, or paid work
Full-time student
Preference given to students in the Honors College
Students who have an up-to-date Panther Scholarship Portal General Application and the College of Letters & Science Scholarships and Awards Application will be considered, in spring of their freshman year of college, typically between February and April. No additional or separate application is required; students should thoroughly fill out the Panther Scholarship Portal General Application and the College of Letters & Science Scholarships and Awards Application. Awards given in spring are for the following school year. E.G. applications reviewed in Spring 2022 are for Fall 2022. more...

Wisconsin Academic Excellence Scholarship
This scholarship is awarded to the high school senior who has the highest GPA in their WI high school. Students will be notified by their high school if they have been designated as an Academic Excellence Scholar (AES) and will also be asked to submit an AES form to the WI Higher Educational Aids Board (HEAB). Students must attend a college that offers the Academic Excellence Scholarship in order to receive the award.
Academic Excellence Scholars attending any UW Oshkosh campus are eligible to receive this scholarship. Recipients may receive the award for a total of four years (eight semesters), provided the recipient maintains full-time enrollment, earns a minimum 3.0 cumulative GPA, makes satisfactory progress toward a degree, and their award is approved by HEAB. more...

Xcel Energy Scholarship For Incoming Freshmen
•must be incoming freshman to be enrolled full time and live in a county where service is provided by Xcel Energy
•either a major in computer science, biology with a concentration in environmental, any major within the College of Business Administration or any qualifying major within the College of Liberal Studies with a minor in environmental studies
•graduate in the top 25% of high school class
•financial need may be considered more...

Xcel Energy Scholarships For Continuing Students
two scholarships awarded—one for a freshman and one for a continuing sophomore, junior or senior to be enrolled full time
either a major in computer science, biology with a concentration in environmental, any major within the College of Business Administration or any qualifying major within the College of Liberal Studies with a minor in environmental studies
at least a 3.0 gpa
financial need may be considered
must have come to UW-L from a county within Wisconsin that is served by Xcel Energy which include: Ashland, Barron, Bayfield, Buffalo, Chippewa, Clark, Dunn, Eau Claire, Iron, Jackson, La Crosse, Marathon, Monroe, Pepin, Pierce, Polk, Price, Rusk, St. Croix, Sawyer, Taylor, Trempealeau, Vernon, Vilas and Washburn more...

’S Most Recent Year In School).
The Doug and Carla Salmon Foundation Scholarship is available to students at University of Wisconsin, Fox Valley. You must have a minimum GPA of 2.75, be a single parent, non-traditional student, minority student or foreign student and demonstrate financial need to qualify for this award. more...
